Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: Christina K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in Feb and loved it. Great location near everything and the staff were all great. Clean attractive rooms. Can't speak to the restaurant as we ate out around town while we were there. Had a great stay and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Love OPUS Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: Tiffany S
Reviews.Content: Stayed at OPUS on the weekend for a date night, and we loved everything about our stay. Excellent service from the staff, lovely King room, enjoyed a tasty breakfast in bed. Great location, we went out for dinner in Yaletown and walked around the neighbourhood afterwards. We brought our dog with us, and the hotel provided a dog bed, bowls and treats for our pup to enjoy. They offer complimentary water and liked the music from the in room CD. The IPADs are a fun extra touch if you don't bring a laptop. Looking forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: KP1717
Reviews.Content: This will definately be the place I stay for any future trips to Vancouver. The hotel is in a great location in yaletown, close to great bars, restaurants and the sea wall and very close to the sky train for trips to the waterfront, gastown and city centre. The hotel is very funky, modern, clean and has a great restaurant downstairs. The staff are fantastic and very friendly particularly the concierge who are so helpful and ready to answer any questions you have.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return, ever.”
Reviews.Author: sunshinegm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Opus hotel last night and was looking forward to the stay as the Website shows a very trendy hotel. The front desk staff and the valet attendent were excellent, we even had a glass of complimentry bubbly at check in. However when we came into the room we were very disappointed. The doorway to the washroom was dirty the walls were not not cleaned very well, and the headboard on the bed had evidence of some prior romantic nights. We really did not want to stay the night but it was to late to move. In the morning I decided to check out using the remote and decided against it once I saw how filthy the remote was. The service was excellent but the cleanliness was terrible. I can think of many other hotels to stay in while in Vancouver and will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Opus is always great”
Reviews.Author: PHughesMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: Great rooms, comfortable beds, staff who knows you - and a wonderful location for getting around VCR - next to the light rail and all. I've stayed many times and have a uniformly great stay each time. A favorite hotel - and not just for VCR hotels - but for all around hotels anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: F C
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel right in downtown Vancouver. Spacious rooms with Ipads for the guests. Impeccable service.

Reviews.Title: “Love Vancouver too”
Reviews.Author: cathy c
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Opus recently and had a great time . Location is perfect, walk to little hopper ferries to places or get on the tube/ DLR type line across the road. Lovely restaurants nearby too. Staff a delight knew where to eat and can do lifts sometimes to local places and a glass of bubbly on arriving. Lovely rooms.( remember to pull the blinds !) and free wi fi downstairs, shame not free in the room ! Great products in bathroom and lots of towels plus jelly beans on pillows at night. Nice bar and a great coffee shop next door. Vancouver a delight I reccommend a visit soon and do try Opus you will surely love it.

Reviews.Title: “Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: Nice to stay in someplace other than the big chains. This is located in a great place with lots of restaurants from which to choose. And it is located centrally to other parts of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “exceptional service and handy location in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: Lucy B
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Opus. Rooms were so neat and clean - and the staff was exceptional from the front desk to housekeeping. Very friendly and accommodating. The bed was comfortable (Sealy posturpedic - NO BED BUGS - I checked thoroughly!!!) Some street noise if the window was open so we closed it to sleep. Complimentary beverage in the lobby upon arrival. Nice bar, cozy lounge, good food. Elevator key security. Ample room amenities and nice big umbrella provided for use during your stay - nice touch! The location was perfect also for access to pharmacies, boutiques, restaurants and a walk along the beachfront. Pricey, but worth it. Would love to book there again. I didn't notice the swimming pool so couldn't include that in my rating - so if my final rating comes out a bit lower than great, that's the only reason!

Reviews.Title: “World class service”
Reviews.Author: Drock34
Reviews.Content: My name is derek magennis, i stayed at the opus hotel for work with the Honda group as im a saleman for Marv Jones Honda in maple ridge. From the begining of my stay till i left the service was top class. Jackson in the restuarant helped us out as a group to enjoy our stay that evening. Even the owner of the reaturant as myself how im doing and how longs my stay. World class service ive stayed alot of places around the world and demand the best and i recieved it with my stay at the opus hotel in vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was 99% awesome”
Reviews.Author: SouthBayBilly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is similar to other boutique hotels I've stayed in in NYC, SF, and Barcelona. So there's nothing special about the place, but overall it's a good call. The room was clean and comfy. The staff was great. There was only one server in the restaurant who was kinda lame so that's why the staff was not 100% awesome. I only had breakfast there and it was quite average. The restaurant/ lobby turns into somewhat of douchey club at night. So I'd ask for a room NOT on the second floor. Mine was on the forth floor and was fine. The location is good because you can access other parts of Vancouver quickly and easily via taxi, which when called upon by the aforementioned staff appear almost immediately. I didn't think the Yaletown area was all that cool, but a couple of the helpful people at the front desk guided me to some other parts of town with great restaurants and good vibes.

Reviews.Title: “First time there, won't be staying anywhere else in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CelesteToronto
Reviews.Content: I chose Opus since my business was in Yaletown and I could walk. Fantastic hotel. The rooms are a little small, but very well-organized. Everything seemed to have been organized in the perfect spot. The service was great, too. It was more expensive than other hotels in while I was there ($199 / night versus about $180 or even a little under) but I didn't have to cab anywhere so I probably saved some money. Honestly - especially if I'm working in Yaletown - won't stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky, Modern, fantastic service in heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: jodie s
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in the best part of town. Staff great and prepared to go that extra mile.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice.”
Reviews.Author: bestinkelowna
Reviews.Content: The best location for a getaway in downtown Vancouver. Very short walk to get the Aquabus to Granville Island. Everything is close by and the Opus Bar was a great end to every day......the staff was great (thank you Victoria!) and room was hip & funky. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Open Solutions”
Reviews.Author: Farhad W
Reviews.Content: Thank you Kelly for making my clients stay most memorable. Your professionalism, courtesy and service was outstanding! We will definately book with your property in the future. Thanks again! Farhad Walji Connect-Cash Services Inc.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Guest that will continue to return...”
Reviews.Author: K T
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many of the 5-star hotels in Vancouver, and consistently return to the OPUS. The General Manager ensures each Guest enjoys a personal welcome and his frontline team are well trained and hospitable. The OPUS offers a terrific location and unique room selections. It's the place to go for customer service excellence!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel With A Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BrittneyJade
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Opus Hotel for the second time and I have to say that each time I have been equally pleased with my stay. First of all, the hotel location is amazing! It's situated right in one of the most beautiful parts of Yaletown with lots of cute stores and restaurants. You will not run short of great places to eat any type of meal at any time of day. The hotel itself is really cute and trendy. One of the other best things about the hotel is the staff. Everyone who works there is extremely friendly and hospitable - I was very pleased with the excellent customer service. I also personally love that the hotel is pet friendly and that dogs are welcome at no extra cost. The rooms are very clean and if you're bringing a dog, they set up the room with a cute mat, stainless steel food and water dishes, and a little dog gift. The rooms have iPads in them, along with iPod docks, fully stocked mini bars, and great high end bathroom products. I have to say that I would hands down much rather stay at the Opus rather than any of the large hotel chains in Vancouver. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Teammiler
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel - beautifully appointed - and nicely situated in a trendy area of Vancouver. Very friendly and helpful staff. I was delighted to have access to an in-room IPad which allowed me to download a You Tube yoga workout and enjoy a late night Hatha class in the privacy of my room. Had to pay ~$16 for Internet access, but it was worth it. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel but not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: lennix1776
Reviews.Content: Loved staying at the Opus. The hotel is fun and the staff is friendly and helpful. The cons - it's an energetic fun hotel but if you want something quiet and peaceful this is not the place for you. I traveled with a friend and we stayed in a Superior Deluxe which I believe is their entry level room. With the way the bathrooms are set-up, the shoji screen provided very little privacy. So wouldn't recommend for people who are shy. Otherwise great hotel and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Jai H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Opus Hotel in Vancouver on several occasions (at least 5-6 for weeks at a time), and I can honestly say I've never been disappointed. A classy boutique style hotel, amazing location, and top notch customer service, Opus is truly one of my favourite hotels in all of Canada. Great turn down service at night and attention to detail. Not to mention great bath products from L'Occitane. I will definitely be back very shortly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: Amanda T
Reviews.Content: Opus, you are indeed the best hotel I have ever been to. Back in October, my boyfriend and I bought a groupon for Opus and stayed the weekend after my birthday. We travel from Seattle, so while it isn't that far, it is still a nice getaway. We fell in love with the posh interior, the amazing service, and yaletown! What an adorable neighborhood! Well, as soon as we were heading home, I made sure to follow @OpusHotel on twitter to follow what was going on at this lovely spot. Jeremy, the social marketing coordinator responded to my follow right away, followed me, and let me know to let him know the next time we needed a place to stay. Cut to present day. My boyfriend and I haven't been able to have a romantic weekend away in awhile, so we decided to spend the weekend before valentines with our good friends at Opus. We decided to go big and get an executive king suite and Jeremy got us free wi-fi, late check out and a food and beverage credit! Talk about taking care of your customers! Walking into Opus always makes me feel extremely chic. The modern decor is incredible. I love the magenta and gold seating. Our concierge was nice enough and commented "oh, you're in the penthouse" while we were checking in. We didn't think much of it, what do we know? As we jumped in the purple lit elevator we realized we were on the top floor and were excited to see what room awaited us. Opening the door was a new experience entirely. Wow. The black velvet wall paper, magenta and gold pillows, fire place that can be viewed from the living or bed rooms all were incredible...but the bathroom, oh man. The bathtub, while large and jetted, overlooked yaletown. What an incredible view. You better believe I utilized that tub and the complimentary L'Occitane products!! Jeremy also left us a bottle of wine, some snacks, and a nice note letting us know if we needed anything he was available. I popped open the wine and my boyfriend started playing w the complimentary iPad 2 that is now available in every room. Jeremy also got us reservations at Coast (review to follow) on a busy Saturday night. Coast was recommended by the concierge last time we were there and we fell in love with it. The next morning, after a restful sleep in the comfortable king sized bed, we decided we didn't want to leave, so we cancelled our reservations at Cento Notti for brunch (we will try it next time, right?) and ordered room service. This room was simply too amazing to leave if we didn't have to! Every step of the way was a delight with Opus. I recommend this hotel to everyone I know and we will be returning soon...we just don't know how we can ever settle for an average hotel room again! We were spoiled this weekend for sure...thank you, Jeremy and the rest of the staff at Opus! You made our weekend truly special.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: PamHiran
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located with excellent walk-ability. Close to the false creek and ferries dock. We used a Groupon to book a superior queen room but they also honored Tripadvisor's upgrade coupon. We ended up with the courtyard room (401) which was spacious, quiet, and also came with a fireplace. The iPad was a nice way for guests to stay connected, especially for those of us from out of town with no international roaming plan (iPad has 3G so you don't need to pay for wi-fi). We were caught a bit off guard when we came back to the hotel at 10PM to find a bouncer in the lobby which transformed into a very lounge/club-like environment. It didn't affect our stay one bit, we just thought it was kinda strange. Valet parking was free for us because they offer free valet for hybrid cars.

Reviews.Title: “Living the Good Life in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RandPEdmonton
Reviews.Content: We stayed for only one night on a Friday,booked a King room and when we arrived were offered a heavily discounted penthouse suite. We couldn't refuse and totally enjoyed every minute. The room had a fireplace,huge jacuzzi bath with a floor to ceiling window,2 bathrooms, music ,an iPad and 3 TVs. Overkill? Sure, but for one night in Vancouver quite a treat. We had a fantastic dinner and breakfast in the restaurant. The food for both meals was great..service was a little uneven but we didn't have to be anywhere special so it wasn't a big deal. The area is perfect,easy to get just about anywhere in the city. Our only issue would be the internet and Valet charges which seemed a bit much in an already pricey place. On the plus side the package we got gave us 2:00 checkout and 25 dollar credit in the restaurant for food and beverage(also 20% off on food and beverage. So I guess it all evens out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - but watch out for the $extras$”
Reviews.Author: roger g
Reviews.Content: A nice little hotel, great location for restaurants and entertainment. I've stayed here a few times, but I think this will be my last. One of my pet peeves is being charged extra for internet. When Starbucks can do it for free, why can't a $200/night hotel do it? Internet was an extra $16, and parking $35 for 1 night. I just can't justify the added expense. Sorry Opus, maybe when you revise your policy I will return.....

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: flyingkdj
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a couple of times, this time for three nights. Great location: walk to the seawall and bike rentals; one block to Urban Fare where it is great to shop and have breakfast; walk to great restaurants. Enjoyed dinner at Opus' Cento Notti restaurant. Staff is very friendly and helpful, and very accommodating to our old dog. Overall very professional but personal at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service for a Business Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: H C
Reviews.Content: Our organization held our annual strategic planning workshop at Opus for the second time. The weekend went extremely smoothly. The front desk staff were very knowledgeable and in tune with our group, the wait staff at Cento Notti were professional and courteous. The girl who looked after the meeting room/food adapted well to last minute changes and she was discrete when coming in and out of the room. All the planning that was involved before the weekend was handled perfectly by Victoria and Kristin. They were friendly, professional and very accomodating! The service at Opus is top notch. The hotel is comfortable and clean. Ipads in the rooms are also a nice touch! On the weekend, the lobby turns into a party hotspot in Yaletown, so if you are sensitive to noise, I would suggest requesting a room on one of the top floors.All in all, a great weekend and very reasonably priced for a work retreat!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to be”
Reviews.Author: Michael C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have now stayed at the Opus ten times (we discovered when greeted by champagne and flowers in our suite at the last visit). This is simply a great hotel to stay in. Small and personal but unobtrusive in manner. Excellent staff. Brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: Amy C
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Opus Vancouver, which was my third visit to the boutique hotel and the staff is so welcoming and friendly each and every time, you almost feel at home or that you arrived to a friend's house. I love the decor in the rooms and the beds are extremely comfortable! It's so convenient to get to the airport too on the Canada Line that drops you off directly across the street. Yaletown is my favorite area of Vancouver to stay with the best shopping, dining and bars. Next trip to Vancouver, I'll be staying at Opus again.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Board Workshop/Retreat”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: I must say the service of the staff at the Opus was extraordinary!! Very accommodating and attentive. The room was great with great amenities. I would have rated this as excellent in both Sleep Quality and Location as well - except it's location by the very nature of being right in the heart of Yaletown's restaurant and club district also means you've got loud bar patrons making a fair whack of noise on the street below till the wee hours, making it not optimal for getting to sleep if you're at all a light sleeper! And I was on the 6th of 7 floors so can't imagine how loud it must get on the lower floors! Perhaps certain sides are more quiet than others. That said, I imagine that the pronounced street level revelry is much more weekend related. Again excellent service from the hotel staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Still as good as the first time”
Reviews.Author: Johnnyojohnny
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this hotel on and off for a decade now and still continue to be impressed by the attention to personal details and service

Reviews.Title: “A new favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: rsp1
Reviews.Content: Terrific 'boutique' hotel, perfectly located, with excellent service. The preloaded iPad was a nice touch. Front desk staff were helpful with suggestions/directions, and the hotel's free car service was much appreciated. Prices were very reasonable for services provided. Would not think to stay anywhere else in yvr.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things”
Reviews.Author: Martin W
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful 2 night stay at Opus Hotel in Vancouver and would loved to have stayed longer. I am definitely making the Opus my hotel of choice when in Vancouver. From the moment I arrived the staff were very helpful and suggestive. Yet it was the little things that really elevated the stay. The heated bathroom floor was a great start. The complimentary overnight shoeshine service was a help. The bed turned down with a little card noting the next day's expected weather was a nice touch. The business centre on the 2nd floor was quiet and with everything I needed to make the work I had to do flow more easily. A great hotel - worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: thomasrealtor67
Reviews.Content: A friend told me to stay here, and I'm sure glad I did. The room was great, the bath room was huge with a big walk in shower and real soap / shampoo. A 3g ipad in my room pre loaded with some music. The location was easy walking to shoping and bars. The only thing I didn't love was the iron it was hard to use. It worked but just as nice as my sunbeam. I would stay again for sure

Reviews.Title: “First time in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Zamir D
Reviews.Content: On our first trip to Vancouver we stayed at the Opus hotel in Yaletown. It’s one of the best boutique hotels we ever been to. Spacy room, great shower, rich continental breakfast and above all – sophisticated staff who knows everything about anything in town.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver, no thanks”
Reviews.Author: Rangijones
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the penthouse suite for a valentines celebration. First up it's valet parking not something I really like and it's extra $, The room is ok nothing over the top, modern styling and yes a comfy bed. Internet/ wifi is extra????(even airports are free) Went to the restraurant food and service was good nothing mind blowing. Overall it depends what you want, a place where people try and be trendy and charge over the top prices for the image without a lot of substance (it cost me over $1300) or all the same thing for a lot less.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: LJLtraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to be close to the Roundhouse for the First Half-Marathon. Enjoyed being close to the restaurants of Yaletown and walking the seawall of the north side of False Creek. The hotel was a wonderful experience, right from dropping the car at the valet, to the sparkling wine offered at check-in, to a stylish hotel lobby and room. For dinner we thoroughly enjoyed The Flying Pig in Yaletown, 1/2 block away - excellent food and value.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: mike&gina
Reviews.Content: I've been in 5 Star hotels all over the world and my experience with this hotel is more memorable than any that I've had with Fairmont, Westin, etc The amenities in the room from the IPAD, to the sound system with docking station l'Occitane toiletries, and the most comfortable bed ever. I never sleep well in hotels but I sure did when I stayed here. The service and location also can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, Hip and Sophisticated!”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond35
Reviews.Content: There are no disappointments with this boutique hotel; it is charming, hip and centrally located. The train station is literally across the street. The rooms are modern and comfortable, the staff helpful and kind. And there is a pretty happening bar in the lobby which can be accessed at night from the hotel (for hotel guests, of course) without having to wait in line. I loved this Hotel and will no doubt choose it for my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I've Ever Experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Shehryar S
Reviews.Content: The best hotel experience I've ever had in my life! There is a reason why this hotel has won many "Best Of..." awards from reputable travel magazines. My girlfriend and I travelled all the way from San Jose, California to watch our beloved Sharks play the Vancouver Canucks. We happened to stumble upon a Groupon for Opus that gave us $40 in breakfast credit at the hotel restaurant, free-wifi, and a great discount on a fabulous room. When we walked into our room, we were blown away with how posh it looked. But what really blew us away was the free bottle of wine and snacks that Nicholas, the manager, left for us after he heard about the reason for our trip. Amenities are great. The gym is small, but we used it every morning. There is 1 treadmill, 1 elliptical, dumbells, and a multi-purpose machine. What's great is that there is a snack bar area inside with complimentary apples, refridgerated towels, and a water cooler with slices of fresh lemon. There's also a stereo system that lets you hook up your iPod/iPhone to the gym speaker system. We stayed for 3 nights at Opus and really didn't want to leave. The location is amazing. It's in Yaletown, right across the street from the train station. There are many great places to eat, including a grocery store that feels like a Whole Foods. My girlfriend (soon to be fiance) and I are on a mission to see the Sharks play in every city in the NHL, so when we end up in Montreal, we'll be staying at Opus Montreal. I e-mailed Nicholas after our trip and told him to expect us this Summer!

Reviews.Title: “The professionalism of the staff make this hotel an excellent choice.”
Reviews.Author: delighted57
Reviews.Content: We were delighted to receive upon checkin a glass of sparkling wine to enjoy. I emailed Victoria (sales manager) ahead of time to organize an early room service breakfast since we were not arriving until very late the first evening and had a 8:00am meeting to make the next day. The room service was right on time. The breakfast was excellent. When entering our room we were delighted to see a snack,and a bottle of VOSS water. We were quite surprised to have an inroom IPad for our use and our turndown service with the very calming music playing when we entered was a very appreciated touch. All my expectations were met and beyond. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone either on business or pleasure The staff are all very accomodating,friendly,and made me feel right at home. I am looking forward to returning to The Opus the next time I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect...Once Again”
Reviews.Author: RobertCampbell
Reviews.Content: Seems every trip to Opus in Vancouver is uniformly perfect. Any minor glitch that has ever occurred has been taken care of promptly and professionally by the friendly staff. Everything from the valet car attendant to the person I met at check-out was courteous and friendly. Bravo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, but service could be improved”
Reviews.Author: AlphaBaje
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opus Vancouver for 2 nights in December and was not impressed. The location is nice - Right in the middle of Yaletown across the street from the Canada line sky train station. However the rooms were very small and noisy, partially due to the club downstairs but also due to it being close to a noisy street. Keep in mind I live in Toronto in a very trendy part of town and I am a young professional who likes to party, so this isn't a baseless complaint. Also I found the staff not to be the most helpful: e.g. recommendations for a nice restaurant for sushi was met with 2 places that were close by ... when I asked if they were any good, I saw them and they looked suspect but who am i to judge, they did not even bother to look further into other options... the sushi at the place they recommended was probably the only bad sushi place in Vancity! ... Also another staffer dropped my snowboard on the ground from an upright position and didn't even apologize ... I have been back to Vancouver since then and needless to say I did not stay at Opus!

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations.”
Reviews.Author: xx23
Reviews.Content: Great vibe, super comfortable room (deluxe king), loved the heated washroom floor. The Hello Kitty pez dispenser left by house-keeping was a very nice touch. The lounge was also very happening both Friday and Saturday nights. Will visit again. Only problem was the shades had gaps between them so didn't completely keep the sun out in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Opus”
Reviews.Author: Pamela D
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Opus hotel twice now. It couldn't be a better location and we've never been treated so well at any hotel- anywhere. Fantastic service. We felt like celebrities. Staff was very attentive. We were given great advice on where to go and what to do. We were driven in the hotel car to destinations and loaned bikes for a fun ride around Stanley Park. We were there on my husband's birthday and when we returned from dinner,the turn down service included birthday cupcakes, a pitcher of water a note and soft music. The rooms are very nice and unique. We couldn't recommend the Opus more.

Reviews.Title: “vancouver stay”
Reviews.Author: brian b
Reviews.Content: On a recent visit to Vancouver myself and my family had the pleasure of staying at the ''OPUS ''. Exellent location, personal sevice, very comfortable .

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, but not what I expected for the price”
Reviews.Author: sisyphusrocks
Reviews.Content: I first found the Opus hotel through Groupon--but after purchasing a Groupon, the hotel made it so hard to make a reservation with that Groupon that it ended up expiring. So that was strike one against the place. However, my boyfriend and I were intrigued so we splurged and made a reservation for a special occasion anyway. We found the hotel to be clean and well-managed, but I have to say that it wasn't what I expected from the price and the advertisements. The rooms were clean and had decent amenities, and I loved the heated floor in the bathroom. Other than that and the nice bath products, however, I wasn't sure what justified the high price. For one thing, the decor was an ugly brown--a color guaranteed to hide dirt and which I consequently associate with places like Motel 6. Also, it's discomfiting to pay so high a price for the room, only to be charged outrageous sums for extras like parking and internet. The service also left something to be desired. We had purchased the continental breakfast option when we made our reservation, and we told the waitress about it when we sat down in their restaurant for breakfast. However, she told us to put our voucher away and preceded to let us order off the regular menu without explaining what would and would not be covered by the voucher, so we were left with the erroneous impression that everything was. Her supervisor had to come over and tell us what our breakfast options *after* we had ordered, which he did in an extremely rude fashion. And although the hotel had said they would be able to accommodate my boyfriend, who is a vegan, they did not even have soy milk in the restaurant! To their credit, they did get some the second day. On the good side, the actual breakfast options (eggs, etc) at the restaurant turned out to be tasty, but the continental breakfast was pretty blah. Probably the best thing about this hotel is its location. It's only a short walk from the train and a number of cute boutiques and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Badir S
Reviews.Content: Thi shotel is very good and has excellent staff who will cater to very whim. I enjoyed my second visit just as much as my first visit. Go Opus!!!

Reviews.Title: “Family vacation, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: BrittanyR01
Reviews.Content: We were planning a trip to Vancouver with our 9 month old and were having a hard time choosing between Opus and Pan Pacific. I love boutique hotels and the Opus looked so nice, but I was worried that the location would be too noisy, especially with the bar downstairs. After lots of research and review reading, I decided to go for it and stay at Opus because I knew I would probably never have the opportunity again-and I was thankful I did. My expectations weren't too high about the way I would be treated by the staff for a few reasons: It is Vancouver and we are from Texas, it is the Opus, we have a 9 month old with us, and we used a Groupon. However, as stated above, we were pleasantly surprised. Every staff member throughout our stay was extremely polite and helpful (and I must add they looked very presentable). I figured the Opus wasn't too kid/baby friendly, but they were helpful in that area as well and happily provided a playpen . We didn't have a problem with any noise, but we stayed on the 6th floor so we were far from it. The interior was very contemporary and very clean. The rooms were a bit pricey for the quality of the material used in the room, but none the less, it was nice and comfortable. My only disappointment was that I went to the restaurant expecting a bright, modern, uplifting 100 Nights, but instead walked into a dark, mellow atmosphere with an entire new interior. The hotel website at the time still advertised 100 Nights and I was really looking forward to eating there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: Consuela1972
Reviews.Content: Great experience, friendly staff, beautiful rooms, centrally located, clean. Tried because of Groupon and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LynnNVancouver
Reviews.Content: What a great experience, I would stay there again without hesitation. We had booked off a lot of rooms for a corporate event that we had in January in Yaletown. We were taken care of from the time of booking the rooms through to the entire stay. I have heard nothing but praise from our customers & business partners who stayed in the hotel on Saturday night. Your staff is very efficient, accommodating & extremely professional. I stayed there myself and certainly felt the same way. You all should be very proud, Kudos to you all. Thank you for taking care of us and making this event that was extremely important to us go flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: “My Opus Experience - Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: Nerida B
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the best places to stay in Vancouver. Beautifully positioned, just down the street from Urban Fare, a wonderful supermarket of international foods and a 5 minute ferry ride from Granville Island as well as 10 minute walk from the centre of the city shops. The hotel itself is ultra chic and at the same time wonderfully comfortable and welcoming as are the staff who excel in their positions. Nothing is too much trouble. Great for a romantic get a way of for a family experience in Vancouver. We have stayed there a number of times over the years and coming from Australia the standard remains the same. Thoroughly recommended

Reviews.Title: “returned stay”
Reviews.Author: vaiteL
Reviews.Content: It's my second time in Opus hotel. That is unusual as I never return in the same hotel as I like to be surprised by the hotel. What made me wanted to come back: trendy atmosphere, small entrance, large rooms with winter colours. I wanted to test the Deluxe King with the bathtub under the glass window of the room. I appreciated the personalized guest survey.

Reviews.Title: “very nice!”
Reviews.Author: erinovens
Reviews.Content: Love the opus boutique hotel. Right in Yaletown. Close to everything. Friendly and professional staff (unlike some others in Vancouver). Highly reccommend this quaint little hide-a-way.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Matthew F
Reviews.Content: I never usually write reviews, but for the Opus I had to make an exception. The hotel was excellent, great style, great atmosphere and perfectly positioned within the city. The staff were phenomenal - not only were they professional and friendly, but so helpful when asked about places to go and things to do. They consistently went the extra mile to help out - to be honest they made the stay the great experience that it was. I can't recommend this hotel enough - if you're going to Vancouver you couldn't ask for a more perfect place to start your adventure!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carleigh H
Reviews.Content: Even though we are only 30 minutes from Vancouver our special treat is to spend a nite @ OPUS, beautiful hotel & the staff are excellent. Along with enjoying our time @ OPUS we love just wondering around Yaletown, enjoying the water & the fab restuarants here

Reviews.Title: “The Opus - A Great Place to Stay in Downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Wayne R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in a great location in Yaletown. Everything you could possibly want is minutes away. Very customer focused hotel that welcomes you with open arms.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS Vancouver ; Outstanding customer service, will be sending our clients back.”
Reviews.Author: Danielle J
Reviews.Content: I would like to say Thank You for the excellent service that our guests received during their stay this weekend, and for the care and help you showed me over the last few months with arranging accommodations for this event. This was an important weekend to show our customers and colleagues their significance to our business, and the care of your staff and service helped to make it a huge success. All of the team at OPUS treated our guests with great concern, and ensured that all requests were met going above and beyond standards. All of our clients who stayed were blown away by the service, and had nothing but great things to say. Thank you again Victoria, for all of your help, and for the exceptional service of the staff at OPUS. We will definitely be sending guests back in the future.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS- It's a must stay”
Reviews.Author: G S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled through Vancouver on our honeymoon and we were recommended the Opus Hotel for our stay on the way through to Whistler. Without knowing much about the hotel, we were completely blow away on arrival. The staff were friendly, helpful, resourceful, and fun... The Manager even left a personal message in our room congratulating us, this was one small example of the personalised client experience. The hotel is well located, saying that we were slightly lazy and dined in the new restaurant. The restaurant was fabulous, the waiter staff were so energetic and good value. Full credit to the chef as well, I ordered the spag-bol as it was listed as the chef special. When the dish arrived I was salivating, it was a masterdish of spaghetti served rather alternatively with blue cheese delicately placed on top of the food. I highly recommend your next stay in Vancouver to be at Opus, and while you are there do give the Spaghetti Bolognese a go.

Reviews.Title: “FUNKY and COOL! Hippest hotel in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: John C
Reviews.Content: After being tired of staying hotels they all look like they were decorated by my grandparents I wanted someplace for my wife and I to stay was fun, stylish (without being fancy pancy) and close to the happening stuff downtown. I started reading the reviews about the Opus and thought - this sounds like the place. I saw the picture of the room with the bathroom that has the full window facing the street and decided that we'd give this a try for a one night downtown Vancouver hotel+dinner+drinks evening. The hotel might be a little hard to find for first timers and there isn't the typical recessed pull out in front for the valet (it's fairly busy street and you just have to pull over to the curb and the valet will come out, or you might have to run in and let them know you are there). Valet is $30 for the night which is a little steep, but easier than worrying about finding parking in Yaletown (where the hotel is located). The lobby was decorated for Christmas and it looked like you stepped into a cool update 60's lobby. Modern design but funky and cool. The lobby also doubles as a lounge (and a nightclub on weekends I guess). As you check in they offer you champagne (or water) and then it's off to the room. I opted for a the basic room with queen bed as it's the one with the cool bathroom. They have nicer rooms with a fireplace and stuff but they face an inside courtyard and what's the point of staying in a hotel downtown if you can't look out the window. I asked for a room on a upper floor so I wouldn't hear as much street noise. The room was fairly small, but perfect for a couple. The rooms are blue or red or yellow and we got the blue room. Again like the lobby it look modern, had a fun funky feel, but had everything a hotel room needs. Small flat screen TV, chair, desk, night tables, etc. The bathoom is separated from the main room by some Japanese looking sliding doors. The bathroom itself is the coolest thing in the room - free standing table, full windows, and nice tile shower with glass door. bathroom was very clean (room had nice clean robes as well). The view wasn't anything super exciting but you could see another building and the downtown buildings in the background. And of course you can look down and see people on the street. If you want to do your business there are shades that can be lowered so people can't look in and see you :) Now maybe lowering and raising the shades is a little annoying but you've probably never had a bathroom with a full windows so it's worth the trouble. Also late at night with the lights off I didn't bother to lower the shade when taking a shower so I could look out at the city (I assume no one could see me) and it was a cool experience. We had drinks in the lounge downstairs (this was a weeknight). The waitress was nice but seemed a little full of herself but we got drinks quickly and charged it to our room. I had considered eating at the place inside the hotel but I'd read mixed reviews and with tons of amazing places nearby I figured we'd go out and explore. The hotel is located in Yaletown which is the hip and cool place to hang out in Vancouver. It's near everything! There are dozens of great places to eat within walking distance. We chose to eat that the Blue Water Cafe (some of the best seafood in Vancouver) and the dinner was amazing. It's a great place for a romantic meal - even though it's a larger room and quite busy the tables are far apart and the service makes you feel very well taken care of. There is a 7-11 nearby and on the way back we picked up some late night snacks to enjoy in the room. Checkout the next day was a snap and the valet had our car ready out front in about 5 mins. The stay was around $179 which is reasonable for downtown Vancouver and we enjoyed ourselves very much. No it's not as fancy as some hotels in the area, but for younger 20-40's couples who want a night out on the town and a fun hotel to stay in without breaking the bank the Opus is a awesome experience. I wouldn't hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with great service,”
Reviews.Content: On checking in I was presented a courtesy glass of sparkling which was needed after a long flight. Spoke with Patrick who was incredibly helpful and checked in quickly. The Internet is only free in business center but they do have wifi which is chargeable... Apparently if you get on a good room rate/confirm before they may waive this charge too. The rooms are clean and modern. Overall first impressions are excellent and really pleased with it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but be prepared to have to travel to shop...”
Reviews.Author: NWWineGirl
Reviews.Content: The Opus is lovely. Stayed in January 2012 for two nights; they greeted us at the front desk with hot mulled wine. Our room, 608, had a bathroom with huge windows that overlooked the street, and directly INTO the apartments across the street. Pulled those blinds down a lot while using the shower & toilet! Fun, though. And the heated floor was great. Cute space, decent tv, beautiful bedding and toiletries. Only had dessert in the restaurant downstairs. Used the in-room coffee maker once, but I take cream and didn't find any in the room, so we just hit the Starbucks across the street the next morning instead. To get to the downtown shopping area we used the train once and took cabs once. It's just a quick walk from this hotel to the water taxi to Granville Island. Really nice staff that works there.

Reviews.Title: “Empfehlenswert”
Reviews.Author: Thomas P
Reviews.Content: Das Personal ist äußerst freundlich und zuvorkommend. Die Zimmer sind großzügig geschnitten und modern eingerichtet. Die Lage ist gut und zentral. Für nur einen geringen Aufpreis erhielten wir einen early check-in, einen late check-out und ein Zimmer-upgrade. Empfehlenswert

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: I stay here regularly for business and the caliber of the hotel and staff is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “don't bother with any other”
Reviews.Author: vancouverlucky
Reviews.Content: the opus hotel in vancouver offers exceptional value: location, price and quality. When travelling to Vancouver, whether on business or leisure, I would not stay at any other hotel. The staff are warm and helpful, the guest rooms are well appointed and the location, in Yaletown, is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Hotel is EXTRAORDINARY!”
Reviews.Author: Inder S
Reviews.Content: Love Opus Hotel! It's Vancouver BEST jewel boutique hotel. The staff & service are remarkable! Cento Notti is the newest hottest spot to hit Yaletown. Great food, great drinks, great door staff & def. great service! Opus will leave a lasting impression! Everything is pretty much walking distance - retail therapy, restaurants, bars, coffee shops etc. Yaletown is such a trendy area to stay in - it's cozy & it makes you feel like your at home.

Reviews.Title: “I wish all of my friends could stay here!”
Reviews.Author: HyacinthBucketDFW
Reviews.Content: First, we were surprised to find that the train station is right across the street, which was really great. The front desk personnel were very friendly and helpful with directions and recommendations. Our room was fantastic, and just like the pictures they publish. They even gave us the VIP treatment, and chauffeured us to and from our dinner restaurant in a brand new BMW 7 Series. The hotel is located very close to the waterfront, and we killed an afternoon just walking along, and also riding the water taxi to Granville Island for a visit to the market there. We had a fantastic breakfast at the hotel, and were really impressed with the food. I have nothing negative to say about this hotel, you should definitely consider it when looking for something different and special in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Service was great & better than before”
Reviews.Author: TFsea
Reviews.Content: Had excellent service by front desk staff upon arrival at the Opus in early Dec 2011. I've stayed here before but the service this time was really excellent is the only reason I'm writing a review. In the past, workers at hotel seemed a bit cold and aloof and I never felt like a valued guest. It seems they've really made strides here and is one of best hotel experiences I've had in awhile (and I stay at a LOT of hotels). There was an issue with the Groupon I used for the personal travel trip, but the front desk agent offered both deals (one printout I had said one thing and the other something else - agent told me the Opus has offered different deals via Groupon before and it seemed they'd been combined depending on which page was printed out). I appreciated this and then after we got to our room he called and said he felt badly about the confusion and also wanted to offer us free breakfast. I did not expect this! We had left the front desk content, but then his effort even after we'd arrived in our room really stood out. While the valet did not greet us upon arrival (we arrived in the evening, around 5pm) - and this has been an issue at the Opus before, where you just bring your keys to the front desk - upon checkout valets were there and they were just as friendly as everyone else had been during our stay. I'm a returning guest at Opus, and there was a note and some items thanking me for my business waiting for us in our (upgraded) room. I love this little effort and it leaves an impression on me. I'll be back to the Opus for sure (great location) based on the great customer service from this visit.

Reviews.Title: “This is not your parent's old-fashined hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TraveljohnsonJ
Reviews.Content: This is not your traditional hotel, thank goodness. The Opus lobby is a real wow for the senses. Obviously the staff is cherry-picked for their attractiveness and to go with the young, contemporary and stylish looks this hotel exudes. Where else would you find a lobby person dressed with coordinated purple infused dress shoes to match their striped dress shirt and the lobby lighting? This hotel is all about design and fashion. The standard guest room can be a little on the small side; but, it is amazingly comfortable. The clean, all white sheer curtains gave the room a large look. I loved the crisp pressed white bed linens. They felt so good. The nightly turn down service is sensational. There is a total blackout shade rolled down at turn down to give the late night celebrants the chance to sleep in. There is even a small stereo system in the room that is tuned to really nice music at turn down. The bedside carafe of drinking water is useful and an environmental friendly alternative to plastic water bottles. Like an ocean liner, the best housekeeping service is that which is never seen...it just magically happens. And so it is at the Opus. Controlling the lighting in the room was a bit confusing and one needs to go back to the switches at the room's door to control them. And if the hotel could get the neighboring building's 7:30 AM waste removal truck to come later would be a welcome treat for late sleepers. The high speed internet service, while a little pricey, was excellent. The bathroom toiletry amenities are pretty nice, too. The bathroom is clean and stylish with its glassed-in shower, that could easily accommodate two people, and sparkling metal sink basin. The overhead shower heads feels so good, even if having to shower alone! The room has a generously stocked mini-bar which I did not discover until I was preparing to depart. That was probably a good thing for me. There was a vast collection of "goodies " discretely hidden away in the base cabinet which could sustain a party for two should they elect not to emerge from the room for a couple of days. It would really be hard to find something not to like when stay at this hotel...even if staying alone. This is one sexy little hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at Opus”
Reviews.Author: HLG H
Reviews.Content: Opus Hotel Vancouver went out of there way to make my sister and I comfortable, well attended to and impressed. We enjoyed fun treats that were set up in our room prior to arrival. Once we arrived one of their staff brought up some water and a whether card. She was so kind to show us how the stereo worked because we asked about music. The room was really fun, urban and beautifully laid out. The heated bathroom tiles were fantastic. The bed and comforter were beyond amazing. They are making me rethink my own... We were surrounded by windows with the option of pulling down a solid blind that made it feel like walls. 2 flat screen tv's, a very cool partition awesome local art on the walls. I realized I forgot my toothpaste and called up for some. The person who brought it up also brought a toothbrush which was perfect because my sister forgot hers. We had breakfast in the restaurant which had some good choices, but our server wasn't the best. Besides that we had an amazing time. It was really neat to see that there was an airport check in kiosk in the business room. They are very into keeping up on what is new and fresh. Fantastic boutique hotel experience. Oh ya and greeted with apple cider and champagne!

Reviews.Title: “Opus hotel in Vancouver better than ever !”
Reviews.Author: andrewrosscollins
Reviews.Content: We had a great night at the Opus hotel in Vancouver. Really attentive and quick service, amazing room and an all round great stay. Standouts were the delicious calamari and drinks from the new Cento Notte restaurant... and the perfect double espresso. When a place is already great then it is the small details that really make the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuck t
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great staff and great area recomend to all to give it a try

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ghorton
Reviews.Content: If ever you visit in Vancouver the Opus is a MUST! Very classy and very clean place to experience. Staff is amazing. Check out the shoes on the ushers. The rooms are too cool! Slick bathrooms. And the hotel location is superb. Yaletown is exciting and alive. Terrific restaurants near by. Sorry but please don't miss the lounge - very fashionable site. Definitely worth the $

Reviews.Title: “Why can't all hotels be like the Opus?”
Reviews.Author: oshiers
Reviews.Content: On my second business trip to Vancouver I stayed at the Opus. What a beautiful hotel. From the heated bathroom floors, to the fireplace and sunken bathtub, what more could you ask for? You get so much for your money. The turndown service was a very lovely touch as well. My only complaint was that I missed the champagne at check-in, but because the Janelle was so helpful in arranging a rental car for me for the weekend, I didn't miss it.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: Andrea G
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at OPUS Hotel in Vancouver for two nights, and it was an incredibile experience! Nice room, excellent level of cleanness, friendly staff and the restaurant inside of the structure, Cento Notti, was really good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kent L
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Opus hotel in Vancouver for meetings. The rooms were excellent with very comfortable beds. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The concierge even drove us to Holt Renfrew in the hotel's new BMW sedan. Great experience and great location in the heart of Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C E
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend staying at Opus. Excellent Yaletown location, superb staff, great rooms, cool lounge. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jessica K
Reviews.Content: If you are coming to Vancouver, stay at the Opus. It is a very modern boutique hotel, super chic but not with tiny guest rooms like other boutique hotels we have stayed at. We showed up an hour prior to standard check-in time and the staff mentioned nothing of it, just graciously checked us us and gave us an upgrade, unrequested. The concierge simple said "We like to give an upgrade whenever we can." My husband and I used the car service to get to dinner later that night and then took a cab home. I love the turndown service they offer as well. So nice to come back to a room that has been straightened up, lights dimmed and soft music playing in the background. This was a second stay at the Opus Vancouver, and it won't be our last.

Reviews.Title: “Service beyond compare”
Reviews.Author: BNJC
Reviews.Content: We had not heard of the Opus but stayed here because of a Groupon deal. Our overnight at the hotel was phenomenal! The rooms were comfortable and well-appointed, but the highlight of the experience was the super-friendly and knowledgeable staff. They were experts on the town, gave us great recommendations, and helped us plan a fun-filled two days in gorgeous Vancouver. We were unable to have dinner at the hotel because the dining room was completely booked, but we had a delicious breakfast there in the morning. We would come back to this hotel in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “opus”
Reviews.Author: JERMAINE84
Reviews.Content: Everything went perfect couldn't of been better! I love the atmosphere, you always get a fantastic vibe at the opus on Davie. They make u feel like your vip and the location is convenient for night life lovers. Thx opus will see you soon.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: 44Leslie
Reviews.Content: We chose the Opus for it's location and because it looked like a nice hotel, but we never anticipated how fabulous the service would be. The staff were super friendly and helpful, both upon arrival and then again when we checked out. We travel quite a bit and I can honestly say I can't remember the last time I was this impressed with a hotel and it's service. The room was gorgeous and with so many unique and thoughtful details, we would have liked to have had more time to experience all that it offered. Also important room details: the bed and pillows were extremely comfortable and the in-room coffee was great! This is a fabulous choice for business or pleasure, with Yaletown and Vancouver at your doorstep. This will definitely be where we stay when we return, except that next time we will stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “i have never felt so welcome during checkin.”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: wow, what a great crew they have at this hotel,so friendly and attentive. i felt like a guest,not another paying customer. our room was spotless and well-appointed. it was our anniversary and we received a very nice gift from the hotel management. we have stayed in many hotels in vancouver and this was the first hotel to acknowledge our celebration with a gift. we always go the city for our anniversary.we will return...

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DuaneCalgary
Reviews.Content: I've been travelling to Vancouver for many years and the past couple years I have stayed exclusively at the Opus. Couple key reasons for anyone travelling into Vancouver to stay here is the easy access to the hotel, it is directly located across the Canada Line, which is the train directly from the airport to downtown. You walk 100 feet from the station and you are there. The Opus is located in Yaletown, which is a great area with lots of restaurants, bars, easy walk to the seawall and anything you may need. For a vibrant city like Vancouver, I prefer staying in Yaletown because it is so quiet compared to other areas in downtown. It is much easier to get in and out from here than anywhere else I have experienced in the city. Staff at this hotel are ALWAYS accomodating. Very friendly, not pompous, and sincerly down to earth. Finally, the hotel is a boutique hotel and the rooms are all amazing. I've stayed in almost all the rooms here and each one is unique which makes it a nice change from standard hotels. Anyone who stays here will enjoy the easy access to the hotel, the friendly staff, and the excellent accomodations. All first class, but also very reasonable when you compare other hotels in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, friendly, fun and very cool”
Reviews.Author: jaldridge1962
Reviews.Content: Really impressed, upgraded room was superb. Very stylish, comfortable and good to work in as well as sleep. Quiet too. Hotel staff couldn't have been more helpful, every single one. I was on crutches and they made my stay so much better. Thanks all - and this from a very frequent, very hard to please, traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Very good nights at OPUS Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Robson_Del_Fiol
Reviews.Content: The welcome I got here was beyond exceptional, was my first time at this hotel and if I return to Vancouver again I´ll stay there! Also, the atendant Cashmire was very nice and respectfull.

Reviews.Title: “STELLAR HOTEL...artistic, modern, designer's dream!”
Reviews.Author: MagentaDynamo
Reviews.Content: I can't rave enough about my stay at the Opus Vancouver. I surprised my Mom with a spectacular week-end getaway...we were impressed beyond belief with every aspect of our stay at this very cool and unique boutique hotel. Stayed in a Red Executive Suite...the colours, design, and originality are fantastic. And....awaiting us were two decadent chocolate cupcakes! Turn-down service included the whimsical touch of a Pez dispenser on the pillow. Mom loved the bed - plush, cozy, uber-comfortable! The bathroom is fab....with a large window view looking towards False Creek - don't worry, there are blinds you can draw for privacy....the concept of window in the bathroom is witty! The magenta, hot-pink and purple furnishings in lobby are for every fashionista. The porters are decked out in purple sweaters and John Fluevog black and hot-pink wingtip shoes. Even the white bathrobe had a hot-pink "O" for "Opus" embroidered on it. Not only is this hotel visually stunning, but the staff is incredible. I've had experiences at other designer hotels where the staff has been pretentious and intimidating. Not so at the Opus. Everybody working here is down-to-earth, kind, enthusiastic, approachable....this is one helluva impressive staff. We got the feeling that they love working/playing here ....we loved their professionalism and humour. Mom and were treated royally. Ordered breakfast room service - loved it! Great food and super presentation. The Opus is in the centre of all the action...close to BC Place Stadium, cool dining hotspots, fantastic Yaletown shops. This is a one-of-a-kind hotel in Vancouver. If you want to treat someone to a fantastic experience, book this place!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular getaway”
Reviews.Author: rqvillan
Reviews.Content: An incredible location: 2 minute walk to the Canada Line, 5 minute walk to amazing restaurants. The property itself is a nice 7-storey heritage building filled with character. We stayed in the Executive Suite (the pictures on their website don't do it justice --the walls are more a vibrant red than a pink.) The bathroom is a minimalist white with a very respectable rainhead shower (more than big enough for 2.) I was a fan of the inroom wetbar, with a microwave, sink, winefridge, and Nespresso machine. Extremely comfortable and decadent room, overall. If you're not used to inner-city living (i.e. street noise), you might consider bringing earplugs (part of my standard travel kit.) Even though we were on the 6th floor, it was quite noticeable (albeit moderate and more than tolerable.) The staff were polite and friendly, particularly in the breakfast lounge. And the food: pretty decent. Although, I think there's far better restaurants in the vicinity. Well-worth the money! I wish I could've stayed for a few more nights! I'd choose this place over a high-end chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: jojonyc72
Reviews.Content: The welcome I got here was beyond exceptional. I had just traveled from NY and had a terrible travel day. They greeted me with a smile and even offered to drive me to my interview because my flight was so late and I seemed off. The hotel itself is lovely - decent sized rooms and nice amenities. I would highly recommend to anyone traveling to Vancouver on business or pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “Business Stay in Yaletown at the Opus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLTravel20
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed the quality of rooms and the location of the Opus Hotel. I was able to walk to variety of shops and good restaurants. The room was spacious and relaxing and the bed was really nice. The bathroom was large, and the shower was really refreshing, with high quality products. The breakfast was expensive and lackluster. I did not eat dinner there but the service at breakfast, albeit friendly, was very flat and slow. I would definitely stay there again especially if you like going for runs or bike rides. The sea wall is like 5 minutes from the front door and a nice path around the city!

Reviews.Title: “smoke and stains er mirrors”
Reviews.Author: GoBigOr
Reviews.Content: Great location. Fantastic Yaletown location. BUT Front desk staff have a lot of attitude (why??) - rest of staff really helpful and friendly. Rooms and hotel decor...ugh. Stained carpets, stained headboards, painted plywood, chipped, worn, cheap, cheap, cheap...... Go elsewhere for better value for money...Wedgewood, Shangri-la, Rosewood Hotel Georgia....heck YMCA

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: SeattleCatt
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the Opus in Vancouver. Its in a great area and its a wonderful hotel. Its fun, funky and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Amelia K
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel is a great boutique hotel located in Yaletown. Steps away from the trendiest resturants, bars and shops. Complimentary champagne upon arrival and excellent valet and guest service staff at check-in. No need to stay anywhere else. It's got it all!

Reviews.Title: “A night to remember”
Reviews.Author: LoveinVancouver
Reviews.Content: Enhance your playful spirit with a stay at the Opus! My husband and I enjoyed an amazing night at the Opus, Clean, funky, friendly and very accommodating. We received super excellent service from all staff. The "Happy Anniversary" note was a lovely touch! We are local residents and chose to take transit instead of the car, great choice, the hotel is only a few steps away from the Canada Line. Be sure to book online to get some added indulgence... the breakfast was delectable! We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: abather
Reviews.Content: clean rooms, friendly staff, great hotel bar and restaurant, and great location. will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: evilbee11
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at a lot of hotels in downtown Vancouver, and this is the best. Funky with excellent service and lots of little touches that make the stay special (retro-candy on the pillows!). We didn't have much of a view, but that didn't make the room any less comfortable. I highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeds expectations ....as always!”
Reviews.Author: Blair S
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I have an opportunity and choice to stay at a number of hotels across Canada and Opus is by far my favourite, even when comparing Opus against hotels such as The Pacific Rim in Vancouver. From the car service that takes you to your downtown meeting, the friendly staff and the relaxed feel of the bar, all of this makes for a highly anticipated stay. While most of my hotel stays are at Fairmont, this boutique hotel capitalizes on its smaller customer base to provide each guest with a personalized experience. The location in Yaletown provides lots of options for restaurants and entertainment......I almost forgot...try the lobster Mac and Cheese at the bar.....simply awesome!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience ever”
Reviews.Author: cassie p
Reviews.Content: Bought a night at this hotel from groupon. The service was the best I have ever experienced. The hotel staff was great and greeted us with a beverage. The room took our breath away. Heated bathroom floor, huge shower with great water pressure. The ice buckets were already filled up for us by the turn down survice and there was a wide variety of DVD's to watch. The bed was so comfy and the breakfast was amazing. The decor is modern and unbeat and really makes you smile. The staff were so friendly and helped us with any questions we had. The location is great. This was the perfect way to start our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in a while”
Reviews.Author: mcmorris99
Reviews.Content: Bought a night at this hotel on a Groupon. Great experience, right from pulling up at the valet stand. As we are checking in, the valet points out to the desk person that parking is free for us since we drive a hybrid. The room was nice, contemporary, clean with L'Occitaine toileteries. Turn down service left a Pez dispenser on the bed. Cool. Better, I was about to trudge out to the ice machine, when I grab the ice bucket, I notice that it's already full! It was great to just get in, and pour a drink with ice waiting. Got back to the hotel at about 10 pm, and went to the bar/lounge. It was packed with the nightclubbers, and they were turning people away. they let us in with our card key, which was nice, but the bar was a bit too packed with a few too many old men trying to be cool. Breakfast was included with the Groupon at their restaurant. Very good brunch, and really excellent service. Last but not least, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great as usual”
Reviews.Author: RobertCampbell
Reviews.Content: Opus has always given us great value for our dollar. If you want Motel 6, don't even consider Opus as you'll pay the going rate for this service- but not a penny more. I doubt any hotel has ever provided more despite staying at much more expensive hotels. Also, the highest water pressure in the shower that I have ever seen! You will get clean ;-)

Reviews.Title: “USA Residents lose 10% on currency exchange!”
Reviews.Author: themidlifetraveler
Reviews.Content: First time in Vancouver so my friend and I decided to stop in the the Opus Hotel bar because we had read some great reviews from the past years. Well, firstly, the overall lobby decor is what I would call dated-trendy. The patrons having drinks were mostly upper middle aged -- not the crowd we anticipated. The drinks in the bar were fine but what really got us was that the hotel charged a .90 exchange for the US dollar -- we complained and they told us that they never change it --- that was weird because it was the first time in 3 days of using US dollars that we had the issue. Nevertheless, the front desk clerk and manager told us that they were sorry but that is standard policy around Vancouver -- they must not get outside the hotel! They are mistaken. I'd recommend spending your vaca at one of the numerous other great hotels and visit the hip bars and restaurants vs. this place -- it was our least favorite thing about Vancouver and I am so glad we didn't decide to take a room here.

Reviews.Title: “Not as cool as you think based on the website”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was pretty nice but not as cool as the website makes it out to be. The rooms were clean and had everything that they promised but they were pretty small and not all that chic. The car service was also a huge let down because I think there is only one car and you apparently can't reserve it earlier in the day so it is busy and not able to take you most of the time. It also won't pick you up anywhere so you have to pay for a cab no matter what. Additionally the food wasn't that spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful wedding weekend!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica O
Reviews.Content: In August of 2011, the Opus was the hotel was choose for our wedding weekend and it did not disappoint. The night before the wedding, my bridesmaids and I stayed at the Opus and we were all treated like gold. The room was absolutely amazing - beautifully decorated, comfortable, and quiet. The location was perfect as we could easily walk to many restaurants and our spa appointment (which the Opus set up for us), not to mention the hotel is very near a SkyTrain station so the airport was so easy to get to the morning we left for our honeymoon. The staff were accommodating and friendly and even came up to steam one of our dresses last minute before we had to leave for the wedding. They were quick at getting our car when we needed it and didn't complain when I needed to get into my car numerous times in one day. My husband and I stayed the night after our wedding as well and come back to our room that night to find chocolate covered strawberries and champagne - a very nice touch. The day after the wedding, we were treated like royalty with staff we had never met wishing us congratulations. And as a side note, our photographer loved the Opus for shooting as the decor is so colourful and classy. Overall, staying at the Opus was an incredibly experience. They helped keep our wedding day perfect and stress-free and we can't wait to stay there for our anniversaries in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect blend of business and pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: Scottwall
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to Vancouver for work and will never stay at another hotel. The staff is incredibly charming and always willing to go the extra mile. The rooms are trendy and refined, offering large windows, a large work desk and very comfortable bedding. Not to mention evening turn-down service, on my last night I had a pez dispenser sitting on my bed! Another example of the trendy service Opus provides. Additionally, and the best part... It's centered in Yaletown! Incredible restaurants and shopping are everywhere and easily in walking distance. Overall, with all my international traveling and countless stays in all sorts of hotels, Opus in Vancouver, BC is where I prefer and call my 2nd home.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver Gem!”
Reviews.Author: Dick I
Reviews.Content: Opus will always be our first choice when visiting Vancouver. Staff always very friendly and helpful. Location can’t be beat, in Yaletown with great restaurants and boutique shops within a 2-block radius. Leave the car home or at the airport – light rail access from airport to within 200 feet of the Opus! Easy walk to the waterfront where you can catch a water taxi to explore Granville Island.

Reviews.Title: “A great time was had by all!”
Reviews.Author: JustMeB
Reviews.Content: In July of 2011 I organized an executive/client trip to Vancouver. Location, immenities and that 'wow' factor all came into consideration when selecting OPUS for our accomodations, and I can happily report that OPUS exceeded my expectations, and more importantly those of my guests. The staff was a pleasure to work in all aspects of planning through to execution, and the immenties were top notch. My guests enthusiastically reported back to me they were impressed with their rooms, the in-house dining was exceptional, and the staff were graciously hospitable. Without any hesitation, I'll return to OPUS for my next corporate event... I'm truly looking forward to working with them again.

Reviews.Title: “I will not stay anywhere else in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: vancouverlucky
Reviews.Content: Whether I am travelling for business or holiday, when the destination is Vancouver, it"s always the OPUS I am here, generally, once a week and won"t stay anywhere else. It's every thing you would want in a hotel. Warm, friendly, stylish and located in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver Stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda T
Reviews.Content: Great and knowledgeable staff. Great location in Yaletown, and ten minutes away from Robson shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel in Yaletown.”
Reviews.Author: craignakamoto
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Opus in Vancouver for many years now and I always enjoy my time. You can't beat the location and the service is fantastic. You are almost across the street from the LRT (20min to/from airport), 5 minute walk to False Creek (walking/biking trails, bike rentals, water taxi to Granville Island), and you are in the middle of one of the coolest neighbourhoods in Vancouver with world-class bars, restaurants, and services. They really take customer service to a new level. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service and Quality”
Reviews.Author: bejou
Reviews.Content: This hotel in in the Yaletown district. It was extreamly easy to get to from disembarking from the cruise ship... Got on the Canada Line at the Waterfront Station ... two stops later at the Yaletown Station. Opus was kitty corner less than one block up. We arrived very early and they accommodated us by taking our luggage and we were free to explore Yaletown. We roamed for about an hour before we stopped at the Yaletown Brewery, found a comfy spot to hang out and watch our Football Team win. Yaletown has $9.00 pizza's on Sundays. After the game we checked into our Hotel Room. After Dinner we stopped in at the Opus lobby for dessert and after dinner drink. The Customer Service was awesome. Drink was just what we needed to top off the evening... Oh and the Jumbo Cookie and Chocolate Panna Cotta was to die for! The only down side would be that the rooms are near busy traffic areas and I was occasionally woken up by outdoor street sounds.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, Best Staff”
Reviews.Author: Myles B
Reviews.Content: The best location in Vancouver, hands down. Excellent shopping right outside the door, so much to see and do all within walking distance. The OPUS staff is friendly, professional, helpful and made us feel at home. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Martin813
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly smiles and first class service inc luding champagne to start our weekend off ... such a wonderful touch ! We were away on a ladies getaway and had a beautiful suite that was very well appointed. Just steps away from the hotel are charming little shops and great restaurants. It was a great experience and we wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexis2011
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping, food, and parks. The holtel staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the free bikes and used them for a ride around Stanley park.

Reviews.Title: “As Good As Its Reviews”
Reviews.Author: ScottW636
Reviews.Content: This was my fifth trip to Vancouver, first time at the Opus. I'd stay there again in a heartbeat. It was a special birthday for me, so I spent a bit more than I usually do for my two nights there. When I arrived, they upgraded my room to a king-size bed, plus it was on the third floor with a door to an interior, tree-filled terrace, the only room like that. A generous and classy touch. While I didn't have time to use the terrace, the light and scenery were great. The room was nice-sized, tasteful decor, and the bed and bedding were super-comfortable. I love it when there are plenty of plugs to recharge cells and the like, too. The bathroom had a separate shower, and the vanity had plenty of space to place accessories. The staff was super-courteous, and I, like another reviewer, got courtesy cupcakes to mark my birthday (no champagne, though!). Breakfast was very good--due to a changeover in their pop-up restaurant, they were offering complimentary continental breakfast in the lobby, but TripAdvisor offered a free regular breakfast as part of the deal, so I ate a full breakfast of scottish oatmeal and brioche french toast, very well made. The overall impression was of a chic and "cool" hotel, but one that doesn't act the part, meaning very warm, welcoming, unpretentious and helpful. It's right across from the Canada Line subway to the airport, which saves both time and money--it took me thirty minutes from leaving the hotel to entering the airport, at 5:30 am. And Yaletown is very convenient to downtown and to Granville Island, among other places. The Opus is a hotel that completely merits its fine reputation. I will stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand OPUS Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kasihafrica
