Reviews.Content: Often times boutique hotels are pretentious and the staff makes you feel like you should have dressed better to stay there. This was not the case at the OPUS Vancouver Hotel, matter of fact they were friendly and treated you like royalty. Our room was clean and spacious - the gas fireplace made for some romantic evenings. It was an added benefit that they have bikes you can borrow on a 'first come, first serve' and they have a car which will drop you off in the downtown area. And you cannot visit the OPUS Hotel without tasting their BC eggs benedict!!

Reviews.Title: “A gem in wonderful Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: CtheK
Reviews.Content: A very nicely appointed hotel in a convenient part of town. The rooms are very modern but extremely cosy. Our room looked at the street and the entire wall was glass. A bit weird initially, but it worked well. Breakfast was delicious, although the service was a catastrophe. It was in the same palace that functions as a very well frequented and happening bar during the night and I think the waiters were still a bit dazed from the night before. Overall, still loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: aggiebeth01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The Canada line station is right across the road. This line goes to the airport. A nice walking path along False Creek is just a few blocks away. There are many restaurants around the hotel. The rooms are a nice size with great modern decor. The only windows in our room were in the bathroom, which was a little odd. However, keeping the sliding doors to the bathroom open allowed lots of light in to the room. The hotel lobby and restaurant become a pretty popular night spot. We were on the fifth floor and never heard any noise from it. Breakfast in the restaurant was very good with great service. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Most Hospitable Hotel: EVER”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny10
Reviews.Content: An adorable boutique hotel, staffed by the most hospitable people I have ever encounterd in any hotel or resort. So nice, so helpful, so genuine. They treated us like we were the only guest in the hotel, I have never been so impressed by an entire staff, as I was at the Opus. When I booked my room for my anual mother/daugher birthday weekend, I knew I was in for a treat. Though the hotel was sold out of suites the agent was very helpfull in reccomending a room that would work for us. When I told the agent it was our first time to Vancouver, he exclaimed "You are going to love it here!". It's true, we loved every moment of our stay at the Opus. Upon check in we found our room had been upgraded to the executive suite, complementary for our birthdays. We were greeted with cupcakes and champagne. My mom and I couldn't stop giggling, we could just not believe how nice everyone was. The staff was pratically triping over themsleves to be accomodating. Everytime we enterd the lobby they asked how we slept, or how was our walk or did we enjoy the restaurant, what were our plans for the rest of the day. Just phenominal attention to detail. They referred us to great restaurants with execllet service, and food. ie. The Keg and Rodney's Oyster House. The hotel is in an excellent location, lots of great restaurants and boutiques around. Lovely paths to walk, run or bike (they also provide complimentary bikes to thier guests). The Opus is across the street from the train station, so you can get anywhere else in Vancouver easily. The booking agent was right, I did love Vancouver, and the excellent service from Opus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “modern, well appointed suite, very nice for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: saikou
Reviews.Content: I booked a penthouse room for one night for a rare getaway with my wife. When we arrived we were upgraded to the junior penthouse suite, I'm guessing because it was only for the one night. The suite was very plush, oppulent, very comfortable. Our package came with two free pomegranate martinis. The standout features: - faux cat skin and very dark but bold colors all round - Gas fireplace in the wall between the bedroom and the living room, facing both - Bose audio with good speakers - Very large jacuzzi bathtub with floor to ceiling window and electric blinds - huge windows with sliding doors opening to a (very) small balcony - but nice to let in the fresh air All in all it was a sleek room, and very clean. The service was also very smooth, friendly, and not at all stiff - they seem to go for a younger/hipper mindset in their staff. Very close to Yaletown clubs and shopping. I don't normally spend this much on my own coin, but for one night it was well worth it. It's a similar sort of experience to the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a modern vibe”
Reviews.Author: CB07
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my teen aged daughter for a short visit. Front desk staff was kind, knowledgeable, and welcomed us with a glass of sparking wine. This ultra modern hotel is located in Yaletown, directly across the street from the Yaletown/Roundhouse sky train stop and within short walking distance from the attractions on the waterfront and shopping (shopping shopping) on Robson Street. Good bars and eats nearby. Breakfast was included in our rate and was hearty and of excellent quality, menu service with great cheer on the part of the servers. Rooms are clean and quiet with ultra modern decor; interestingly, our bathroom had a wall of glass overlooking Davie Street.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tim_sinclair
Reviews.Content: Amazing staff, comfortable rooms and proximity to downtown Vancouver are just a few of the things that make the Opus Hotel in Vancouver our preferred place to stay when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Treated so well”
Reviews.Author: JTVancouver
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Opus the night before my wedding with my bridal party and then the night of with my new husband! Pros: Decor, beds, ambiance, service, room amenities, quick action to requests, attention to detail Cons: Noisy location (Weekend in Yaletown is to be expected), cheapest rate was only available online not when I called reservations directly They really value service here and are very accommodating. When we came home each night there was turn-down service with chill music, ice and candy - the wedding night we got Pez and Moet! Overall enjoyed my experience here

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: Debbie090
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Great location near bars and restaurants. (i'd definitely recommend having a car though so you can check out places like stanley park easily) Cute rooms, that while on the small side, were very comfortable. Amazing breakfast (we stayed through the groupon deal and breakfast was included) Staff was amazing. They went above and beyond to assist and make your stay comfortable. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: davebellous
Reviews.Content: I'm in Vancouver regularly for work, and whenever I can I stay at the Opus. The service is impeccable, the rooms are fantastic, and the amenities in the room make the stay. I would highly recommend checking this one out. Love the rain-style showers and the main floor bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service!!”
Reviews.Author: 444caroline
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Opus catching a concert that evening and enjoyed biking Vancouver the next day. The staff was beyond helpful...they assisted us with our bikes, taking them off the rack, storing them and bringing them to us when they were needed. Also the restaurant was exellent...both evening and breakfast meals were superb. The rooms were very comfortable, especially the kingsize bed. I would definitely recommend this hotel, and with our Groupon coupon was very affordable as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: erik n
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Opus while in Vancouver for a wedding. The staff was excellent. From the booking and planning aspect they were very responsive and accommodating. Front desk and concierge services were great as well. Overall, the place is very stylish and we had a memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a central area. A little noisy at night.”
Reviews.Author: mrnick1234567
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights... Pros: Modern, trendy hotel. Huge room (401), lounge area with separate TV, bar area. Big bathroom with good shower. Nice touches like sweets and ice water left in the evenings. Swish lobby bar / restaurant. Friendly staff & concierge. Free bikes for exploring (cycle paths nearby along the waterfront). Free car service for drop off's downtown (they took us to our rental car pickup) Very near lots of bars & restaurants. 30 secs from the subway (one train to the Airport). 2 mins from the Aquabus to popular spots like Granville Istand. 15 mins walk to Waterfront for Ferries to the north shore, (or 2 subway stops). Cons: Our room was a bit noisy at night from trucks and people in the street - even with the window shut. Next time I would ask for a room away from the main street if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute vancouver get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: ninjoker
Reviews.Content: Everything about Opus was outstanding. Everyone was extremely accommodating and made us feel we were very much wanted to be there. A delivery of Pez dispenser to my 2yr old daughter was a nice bonus that she really appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “We were disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Pete P
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to comment on any hotel. Enjoyed the location of the hotel...very close to some excellent restaurants. Our disappointment was in two areas. The condition of the hotel and the service. The hotel is badly in need of some deferred maintenance. Walls and doors banged up...in need of a clean up. All staff appeared to be 'new' or not familiar with all aspects of the hotel and dining room/lounge. We tried it with a Groupon Coupon for 1/2 price so thankfully we did not pay full price.. We paid 220 for a premium king room plus 35$ for parking. We had just stayed in two Coast hotels on Vcr island (Victoria and Nanaimo) I realize location makes a difference and the Coast hotel is not a top grade hotel.. but dining room food and service was better than what we received at the Opus and in both cases we stayed in the hotel for all dining and drinks. Perhaps the hotel needs new management as it could be with an overhall a very nice hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Eh, it's okay. Won't be back.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller389
Reviews.Content: Thankfully, we got a Groupon deal for this hotel otherwise, it would not have been worth it at all. It's a boutique hotel that doesn't exactly know what it wants to be but I must admit that all the employees there were young and attractive but if you are looking for an elegant professional establishment I would stay somewhere else. Parking is all valet so a nice young good-looking man comes out and takes your car. The room was small. We got a deluxe room, I think, and it was tiny. It's not your typical floorplan because the bathroom was facing the street. If you did not pull down your blinds, it would be a nice show for everyone outside. Even though the room was small, it was clean. Overall, it's a nice hotel but way overpriced. You can definitely get more for your money staying elsewhere in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice ambiance, mixed service”
Reviews.Author: TwoforTravelSeattle
Reviews.Content: Three friends and I stayed at the Opus for a girls' weekend in Vancouver. The great location and lively ambiance made it a good choice for our group. However, at check-in, the manager at the front desk expressed considerable annoyance about our room arrangement, although I had discussed it in advance with a guest services representative. The manager even complained to me that we should have been charged more for the room, but that it was too late to add the charges. I found this unprofessional. He should have simply charged me or, if that wasn't possible, kept silent. Instead, he made our "welcome" experience anything but. With that said, the rest of the staff, particularly the valets, provided attentive, friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Opus was Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: NikiG_11
Reviews.Content: Opus was awesome, the staff was very friendly and helpful. 100 nights had great food and a wonderful crowd every night. I go to Vancouver every six months and will be staying at opus every time!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT EXERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: cotonete
Reviews.Content: Very warm reception Restaurant with a very good menu Hip room Nice gym; n:30 am Convenient to everything(subway, water taxi, restaurants, and bars) Complimentary bicycles a big plus

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent Opus”
Reviews.Author: NattyDeFirenze
Reviews.Content: Opus is a high-end boutique hotel frequented by notables from the fashion and film industries and youngish professionals in-the-know. It looks like something our of Wallpaper magazine: ultra-trendy, understated-modern punctuated with vibrant colours and a hip vibe. My room was spacious with a glorious soaking tub and a walk-in shower. The king-sized bed gave me the chance to try the TempurPedic mattress (sheer indulgence and a great night's sleep). All the amenities are high-end: the l'Occitane toiletries, larger bottles of liquor on the desk, the softest bathrobe ever. Yet for me the most important part of the room was the feeling I got as I entered after a hectic day of sightseeing: It was tranquil and I welcomed the feeling of privacy and quiet. I could get used to this. When I returned to my room at night, there was little card at my bedside that told me what tomorrow's weather would bring, along with a carafe of water. Where else would nightly turn down service come with an all-day sucker one night and a string of fizzy candy the next, instead of the ubiquitous chocolate? That told me that I was staying in a place that takes its service, rather than itself, seriously. And that really made a difference, because I'm so far off the fashion/trendy grid that it's a non-fashion statement in itself. So I was worried that I'd be treated to pretentious staff looking me over and making me feel like I didn't belong. Instead I was spoiled at and by Opus - starting with informed, cheerful and courteous staff and running the gamut. The David-Bowie-does-Andy-Warhol decor of the restaurant (complete with silver walls, sprayed-on graphics, crystal chandeliers and disco balls) was so retro is took me back to my grad school days in NYC. Breakfasts there are really worth it: lavender-honey yogurt, chunks of fresh fruit, and thick, toothsome multi-grained toast really got my attention. And it couldn't be more convenient: a few blocks walk to the pier to catch the Aquabus fro Granville Island market, walking distance to almost anything I wanted to see, and just kitty corner from the Yaletown-Roundhouse stop of the Canada Line to the airport. So you think I liked Opus? I LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Opus wins again!”
Reviews.Author: patferns
Reviews.Content: Opus has become my favourite Vancouver hotel for business. This time I was combining business and pleasure with the added challenge of being my first trip since hip replacment surgery. The staff could not have been kinder or more attentive. The dinner, breakfast and lunch at 100 Nights were each in their own way superb, and the arrival lunch in the Cafe just what we wanted. Of course we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait for another trip to Vancouver and stay at the Opus.”
Reviews.Author: andytscg
Reviews.Content: So I must say that our stay at the Opus was great. Upon arriving we were upgraded to a suite which had been almost $200 more per night, and they upgraded us for $50 per night, and the difference in room size was very nice. The furnishings were playful with purple paint on the walls. The bathroom had a great view facing False Creek and heated floors were a nice touch. The restaurant served great breakfast and the service was relaxed. The front desk was very helpful in making reservations, giving advice on sights to see and things to do, and the bellman were very courteous with giving us free rides in the complimentary 7 Series BMW the hotel provides. The hotel is definitely a different scene at night, as it turns into the hottest bar in town. Quite different than the peacefulness of the day. Prepare for ferrari's, rolls royce's, aston Martin's and others parked in front of the hotel and a loud techno beat spilling out into the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: adriasilvest
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much to the staff at the Opus. First class all the way! I was there on a business trip and the staff was attentive, helpfuland very friendly. The rooms were great. Perfect location , close to everything - will most definately be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel-Fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: kleighKansasCity
Reviews.Content: The Opus is a wonderful hotel, tucked away in the Yaletown section of Vancouver... Yaletown appears to be a hub of nightlife, restaurants, and is just a short walk away from a wonderful paved trail and sidewalk that goes around an inlet. The hotel itself is contemporary in decor...but done in a very tasteful and vibrant way. The room was lovely with clean fresh white linens on the bed which was very comfortable...believe ours was a queen size. The bathroom was incredibly unique and lovely. It actually was in the back part of the room, which is really the front of the building. There were floor to ceiling shades which when pulled up gave you a wonderful light into the room and a view of street goings on. The room also had a wonderful walk-in shower. The bathroom also had a floor heater which is a fabulous amenity. To accomodate a large bathroom in the front of the building and not waste space, they put a custom made vanity table that ran almost the width of the room. Ample space for everyone's cosmetics and toiletry products. Nice full length mirror. Housekeeping staff was very pleasant when visiting in the evening in offering ice or anything else. Coffee maker with Starbucks coffee is included. There were two robes in thecloset which we didn't use, but would be nice to wear. The hotel staff was very efficient and pleasant. We ate dinner and breakfast at the hotel restaurant, 100 days. The food was excellent as was the service. This is a great hotel with wonderful accomodations, service, and location. I will recommend it highly to any of my friends or business acquaintances visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The kind of Hotel Experience that makes a trip fun!”
Reviews.Author: Dylan_K_11
Reviews.Content: During a visit to Seattle with friends, we decided to make a trip up to Vancouver. I was willing to splurge a bit on the hotel since I was enjoying the benefits of couch surfing in Seattle. While deciding which hotel to stay at, I narrowed the decision down to the Pan Pacific Hotel and the Opus Hotel. The Pan Pacific had quite an impressive harbor view, but the Opus won me over with the interior decor and layout of the rooms. Once there, the level of service is what stole the show. The rooms were exactly as nice as seen in the pictures on this site, but what they could not capture was the warm, friendly, and personalized service offered by all the staff. The front desk/concierge helped us with making reservations at some of the nicer restaurants around downtown Vancouver. They had a driving service to various locations throughout the city. The valet/bellhop didn't even need to see our ticket, he already knew which car was ours... I could literally go on forever, but the main point to take away is that you will be treated like their only guest during every interaction with their staff. Exactly what you're looking for. Also, the Opus Bar downstairs just happens to be one of the most popular night spots in Vancouver at the moment. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: KarenA2011
Reviews.Content: I wanted to say thank you to the staff at Opus, especially Nathan for making our stay so comfortable and welcoming. Our room was used as the home base and touch point for a girlfriends staguette and she was made to feel like a queen. From our seamless check-in to the extra surprise welcome gift from the Opus team, Nathan and the service went above and beyond. I will always recommend Opus to friends and collegues who are staying in town and I can say with out a doubt that they will be taken care of beyond their expectations. A huge thank you for being a big part of making the weekend a success.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!! So trendy!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenCynthia
Reviews.Content: We loved the Opus Hotel's ambiance - it was so hip and contemporary - just our style. The bed was so comfy, bathroom was huge with a large shower, and the entire feel of the room and whole hotel was modern and beautiful. Their customer service and front desk service was so welcoming and inviting. They were extremely helpful and recommended a delicious Thai restaurant along with a fun bar we went to for drinks near there. Stay at this hotel and you won't regret it!!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it thinks it is...”
Reviews.Author: DrMatthewsUK
Reviews.Content: For what we paid two things really counted against Opus. Firstly, a hotel down the road offers free WiFi at $70 a night, so I'd expect it here. Secondly, our room was on the third floor above the restaurant. On the Friday night we were there this became a nightclub with loud music keeping us awake until 2am. The receptionist when I went to complain was very good about it and we were moved to the seventh floor on the next night and were given free WiFi(!) But still, if you're not planning on staying out partying to the wee small hours I'd give this hotel a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location and a very comfortable room!”
Reviews.Author: SOAP
Reviews.Content: The friendliness of the staff is the first thing that impressed me once I checked in at the Opus. A personalized card complete with peanuts and popcorn awaits you in your room upon arrival and the 600 thread count sheets is another added bonus. The rooms are spacious, designed with attention to detail. Full length mirrors, fully stocked fridge and mini-bar and very pleasant customer service. What else can one ask for? Opus has a great location as it's just across the street from the train station (Roundhouse) and literally opposite a Starbucks. In Yaletown everything is walking distance so lots of eateries. I was there on a short business trip and everything was to my satisfaction. Loved it and will return in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel Experience I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: JenLAMar
Reviews.Content: What a phenomenal hotel and staff! I have to say that Opus is in my top 5 Hotels in the world. Stylish, Spacious, Sophisticated and in the best location in Vancouver - Yale town. I was really impressed from the moment I checked in to the moment I checked out. The staff made the world of difference. Patrick and Rodney the front desk managers were so professional and accommodating with any request big or small. Troy our concierge was proactive to make suggestions on where to go and extremely helpful and informative. One of our favorite people at Opus is Adam. Make sure you ask for him when you arrive to help you with your bags. Opus has an amazing bar attached to it called 100 Nights. It’s the most exclusive bar in the city and Jack Scott the General Manager went above and beyond to insure our stay at the hotel and our time at 100 nights was the best we can have. The Gym was clean and convenient to use. The beds were really comfortable! The hotel also offers complimentary car service around the downtown area. Turn down service daily with a cute little sweet treat in your room when you return. Reasonably priced for such a 5 star hotel. I would suggest this hotel to anyone who plans to visit Vancouver. I would go back to Vancouver just to stay at Opus again. Every hotel should have this level of service. Good job guys.

Reviews.Title: “Back again this year - same great service”
Reviews.Author: federDubai
Reviews.Content: My family and I returned for 5 nights this July. We managed to get a good rate through Expedia for the suite and again we had an excellent stay. The service was as good as last year and still the best that I have ever experienced in North America. The valet parking was excellent and when my sister visited they went out of their way to switch our van with her car. This was not expected but very much appreciated. We only had one hiccup when our room wasn't serviced on time on one day. This was probably due to our very late morning departure. However, their recovery was great as one would expect by now. We stayed in the Opus lounge for 30 mins and they provided us with free drinks for the family. Even though we asked for a glass of juice, they brought us the entire jug. They gave us 2 updates on the status and promptly alerted us when finished. On another occasion I needed to scan some documents. The business lounge did not have one but the front desk was able to do it very quickly. The breakfast was very good, the location is excellent and the service was beyond expectations, again. -pf

Reviews.Title: “What wonderful hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Cal_1982
Reviews.Content: I stayed in OPUS whilst visiting Vancouver for the first time. Despite travelling solo, I felt confident making my way to the hotel on the train after seeking directions from OPUS staff, prior to my arrival. The hotel itself is lovely, with huge glass bathroom doors that gives the room a lovely bright and airy feel. Water jugs are filled up each evening and sweets are left beside it. Such a simple, yet meaningful personal touch. With its central location, it is very easy to get around and staff were always very happy to assist. They do a lovely cookie dough desert in their restaurant! G'wan give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in North America!!”
Reviews.Author: therduin
Reviews.Content: I spend one amazing night at the Opus Hotel this week! If you are looking for a different, stylish, sexy hotel, then the Opus is the best Option! The location is great as it's just accross the street of the Yaletown Canada Line Skytrain station that goes directly to the airport in about 25 minutes! the hotel is very well furnished, I love the Opus bar, PINK is the Opus color so it's very fresh! I slept in the balcony studio (nice view of the city), king size bed (very soft sheets), amazing bathroom with soaker tub and italian style shower... The BEST thing about this hotel is the staff!! They are young professional friendly staff that are genuinely helping us to spend the best stay ever! On the overall, it was my best experience in a boutique hotel in North America! I strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Too cool for school”
Reviews.Author: Kinezo23
Reviews.Content: From the slick shoes of the male staff and cool outfits of the female staff you know you're staying a trendy boutique hotel. The location is in the heart of Yaletown and steps away from the ferrries on False Creek. They definitely aim to please with fast and courteous service. The rooms are very nice with functional and updated furniture. The music selection provided is great. Turndown prepares the room and plays mellow jazz which is a nice touch. Restaurants nearby are great. Many are in the top 10 of Vancouver dining spots. Those looking for a cool hotel that's close to the action will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Truly made my stay in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Bmerguy
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Opus Hotel, we were immediately greeted by Valet who brought our bags right up to our room for us. The front desk was very pleasant as we originally booked for 1 Queen as there was none available when we booked. They ended up giving us a room with 2 Queens and were very accommodating. The rooms were AMAZING! Modern and very posh rooms. The bathrooms overlook Yaletown and are top notch modern. Floor to ceiling windows and all with a killer shower. The bar inside was very busy on Friday and Saturday. Being hotel guests - has it's advantages. Full access to the bar if you are a hotel guest as the line-up gets pretty crazy outside as it's a hot spot. From what we heard Ryan Reynolds had stayed there week before. If you go to the restaurant - dinner and brunch is amazing. Ask for Mike Arthur - amazing server and Host. The bar Manager Jim was a delight to meet and pour us some signature drinks. All the staff there I must say have a great attitude and love to work there and I can see why! The food in 100 Nights is amazing. The Dungeness Crab Cakes are to die for....along with the melt in your mouth Tomato and Burrata Salad. Once dinner is over - this resto turns into Opus Bar which caters to a very chique crowd. All 3 nights we were at this hotel we seemed to always partake in the bar atmosphere. Being steps from Yaletown - this location is killer. The staff is very knowledgeable on the area and are always willing to help. We immediately told them we needed our car to go to Grouse Mountain and the concierge upon pulling up our car already had directions printed out for us - without us even asking. Truly a 5 Star in my book! They also have BMW's which will drive you complimentary. They drove us to our dinner reservation in Gastown and it's things like this that make a hotel stand out and really make you feel like a celebrity. I can't wait to stay at Opus again and their other locations in Canada !

Reviews.Title: “My Second Home in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: DavoMama
Reviews.Content: We just love the Opus. We've been 6 or 7 times. I love the location, modern and hip feel of the hotel, great rooms, and awesome amenities. They even have a BMW 7 series town car to take you around. On our last trip, we used the towncar to take us to aquarium on a rainy Vancouver day. We've also taken advantage of the bikes on past trips and cycled our way through the city. The rooms are fun - bright colors, and just enjoyable. We brought my mom with us a few summers ago and she loved it too. The restaurant at the hotel has changed a few times - I like the direction it's going. Yaletown has some great eats. The staff can point you in the right direction. Definitely check out Chambar too. The hotel also treats your fuzzy 4 legged babies like VIPs. Also love coming up to Vancouver and staying here...

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this place!”
Reviews.Author: cuetxpie
Reviews.Content: The location alone is superb~ It's young and hip, and not crowded with a bunch of tourists. Not only does Opus has its own restaurant/bar, the surrounding area has a variety of food you can pick from: pub food, fast food, Thai sit-down restaurant, sports bar etc. There's even a convenient store next to the hotel. Across from Opus is the subway. Further down the street is a HSBC bank if you're short on cash or need to exchange some USD for some CAD. About 2 blocks down you'll be right at the marina, where there are bike rental shops, grocery store, coffee shop, and restaurants. The room @ Opus is very trendy. The decor is very vibrant/boutique-like. It's not huge, but definitely not a closet. Speaking of closet, there is one =) That is also where the safe & umbrella is located (which came in handy since it rained). There is a flat screen mounted on the wall. Beneath the TV, there is a CD/Radio/DVD player. The hotel even provides a selection of CDs for you to listen to. Also, for those nights when you are tossing and turning and there is nothing good on TV, the hotel has a collection of DVDs that you can rent to watch (for free). There are 2 sliding doors that opens up to a bathroom which has a floor-to-ceiling glass window. There is a copious amount of counter space. The coffee/tea and hairdryer can be found on the counter. The standing shower has a rain-fall type of shower head. All the toiletries (soap, shampoo, conditioner, and lotion) are from L'Occitane. But what I love the most about the bathroom is the bathroom floor. I know that sounds strange, but seriously, I do! The floor is heated. It's so amazing~ It might not sound like it's a big deal, but once you experience this type of luxurious flooring, you'll be raving about it too~ Overall, I love this hotel! Can't wait to stay here again when I'm back in Vancouver~

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike60878
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, clean and the staff is always helpful. The location to all of downtown Vancouver is outstanding. I will be back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fun surprise!”
Reviews.Author: bridget31
Reviews.Content: We actually got Opus through priceline - unexpectedly. At first I wasn't sure about bringing my kids there - too hip for a family like ours. I was so pleasantly surprised! They went out of their way to treat us with kindness and respect and the service was unmatchable. We used the mountain bikes, got a ride in the BMW to our dinner destination and had many service surprises (salt water taffy on the pillows). Being welcomed with a glass of champagne upon our arrival was pretty nice too! I loved all the staff! If Priceline let's us, we'll stay again!

Reviews.Title: “More Than a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ChristyJ123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, who live in California, were visiting family and friends in my hometown of Vancouver, and loved our stay at the OPUS Hotel. Everything about it was great, from the complimentary glass of champagne when we checked in, to the comfortable, stylish, quiet room, to the complimentary downtown car service. I would recommend the OPUS Hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: Tanya1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Opus for a corporate retreat about 2 years ago and when I wanted a personal weekend getaway I decided to book here. I like the hotel, the staff and service is excellent and location is great as well. The rooms are modern and nice, comfortable and have extras like bathrobes and iPod docks. I liked the bathroom of the room this time, no bath tub but the 'wall' was all window overlooking the street outside (blinds come down for privacy). My only negative is not the fault of the hotel, the street below is really loud in the wee hours as there are bars downstairs. If you are planning to be out for some fun yourself, this shouldn't affect you. But if you need a good nights sleep I would call and let them know so they can put you in a quiet area of the hotel. There is a good bar downstairs as well that gets busy and is fun, nice to have as an easy option if you dont want to wander out to find a place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Something is Missing Here”
Reviews.Author: execplatscum
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights at the Opus. We were on our way back from Thailand and stayed there upon recommendation from locals and the outstanding reviews here. Checking in was strange. We had a Trip Advisor coupon for a free upgrade but were told very apologetically that there were no other rooms available. We were then shown to our room #205... when we approached, it became quickly apparent that the room was not going to be good = Located directly on top of the "Club" and next to the fitness center. We asked the bellman if this room was any good and his lack of comment made us suspicious. He then said "Well its a Standard Room". I looked at my reservation and it clearly said I had booked a Superior Room so I went downstairs and discussed this with the Front Desk. They said they needed to check the reservation and then lo and behold, a Superior room on the 6th floor was made available. All this with strange smiles which led me to believe I was intentionally "downgraded" and the unavailable upgrade business was a little contrived. Overall this hotel tries very hard to be a "design, in hotel" the place to be for those with sophisticated taste.. the issue is the design is ok but a little dated ala ABFab 1990's and is lacking in warmth and charm which leaves you feeling a little cold. The front desk staff seem tense and uptight, in contrast, the BellStaff and Housekeeping really shined. If this hotel could loosen up and ad some warmth to their customer interaction, they could have a winner because in the end, the hotel has great potential. - Super Location - Nice Rooms - comfy Beds - Free Bikes for Exploring... The whole "Club" issue detailed here is a real non issue in my mind. The club which apparently attracts folks in droves, is really a melange of the hotel lobby and restaurant with a velvet rope to give the appearance of exclusivity but overall, could not see what the fuss was about.. In the end you sum up a hotel by weather you want to come back... in this case, I would say no. But then again, if they upgraded the staff and service, maybe.. I really wanted to like this place but cool is a very different vibe than cold.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: RFan408
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and quick which is appreciated when you're on business.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to stay in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: dawags1
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic little find. First of all the location is great, surrounded by great restaurants, shopping and galleries. It is a wonderful neighborhood just to walk around in. I booked thru Expedia and got a free upgrade coupon that they were happy to honor. The people could not have been more genuine and helpful overall. We were greeted with a glass of sparkling wine while we checked in and our bags were taken up to our rooms while we went to the cafe attached to the hotel and had a wonderful complementary cheese and salami platter. The hotel is very youthful, energetic and modern, but not overly loud or intimidating with pounding techno music like you get a W hotel. The rooms were so comfortable and the beds and showers were better than the Sofitel which prides itself on their designer mattresses and linens. Breakfast at the hotel restaurant was delicious and relaxed with a New York Times as well as the local Vancouver paper. They also have a very well stocked mini bar and will drive you to any destination in downtown Vancouver for free if you let them know ahead of time. I will definitely stay here again if I am back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: NeedaholidayUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Opus. I booked purely based on the comfort appeal and location and was influenced by cost (although no last minute bookings are that good!). The hotel is new, contemporary and has a young hip appeal. The decor carries that off well. The room was a really good size, huge bathroom, comfortable bed and nice balcony. Decent coffee machine in the room and fast internet access (at an extra charge). Loads of coffee bars, restaurants and spas within a short walk. I would stay again, but would hope for some improvement in the hotel staff - the focus on the young hip image and feel of the place made them appear just too aloof and bordering on rude.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sujaanator
Reviews.Content: My trip and move to Vancouver all started at the Opus hotel in Yaletown. This was by far the most amazing experience, and was the perfect place to set the tone and heartbeat for a city like Vancouver. I can't say enough great things about the facility, the staff, and the overall service at Opus hotel. When planning your next trip to Vancouver, treat yourself to an experience at this hotel. It's heavenly!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel with great vibe”
Reviews.Author: Lucythepug
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Opus Vancouver while on business and I always try to stay here in the future. The rooms designed in an modern, funky and cool way. Turn down service is a nice treat, too. The little cafe at the bottom of this hotel has great brunch and it turns into a lounge area at night with a cool crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Quite perfect”
Reviews.Author: RHOM
Reviews.Content: Although it is known for its hip vibe and its lobby does turn into a dance floor at night, my husband and I did have quiet nights on the 3rd floor. The hotel is conveniently located: Starbucks across, supermarket and pharmacies nearby, close to an Acqua-bus stop/pick up point. The executive suite has a kitchenette w/ a microwave and a reasonable size. Probably because we are not hip vibe people, the staff could not care less we existed.

Reviews.Title: “A Royal experience”
Reviews.Author: upsam
Reviews.Content: From the moment you pull up to this hotel you are made to feel like an important royal guest. As your car gets parked, refreshing bubbly or punch awaits you. Check in is a breeze and before you know it you are surrounded by a beautifully unique room. Tasty fun treats await you in your room:) Opus stands out from the others due to their attention to details. They go out of their way to make each guest feel luxuriously pampered. Anything you need is a fingertip press away. If you are not familiar with the area Opus hotel is in an amazing location. Just a hop skip away from the skytrain. Literally it is across the street! The special guest treatment continues by allowing you access to a chauffeur driven BMW or access to bikes to explore the city on your own. In the evening if you want to glam it up and go out for a few cocktails the lounge downstairs is a must. The restaurant and club "100 Nights" was very fun. Great place to see celebrities. Overall the Opus Hotel is a great place. I now understand the difference between this boutique hotel and other mainstream huge chains. At Opus everyone is treated like a someone. A truly lavish experience.

Reviews.Title: “Flawless”
Reviews.Author: Ndoodler
Reviews.Content: So glad to have stayed there. Awesome location and everyone is so nice that works there. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Check out, before you check in!”
Reviews.Author: off2
Reviews.Content: This is actually a really nice hotel. Just wasn't particularly my style. If you're looking for the "it" bar scene this might be the place for you. Very loud and crowded with twenty something's. We could hear the thump thump in our room. The bathroom doesn't have ton of privacy, but still really nice. They offered free bikes which was lovely and the little restaurant attached on the left was fantastic. Beds were comfortable and toiletries great!

Reviews.Title: “they were made to feel extra special and it was both noticed and appreciated”
Reviews.Author: jmhickey
Reviews.Content: My parents were celebrating their 50th wedding anniversary. The took a cruise from Vancouver and decided to tay a few days prior at the Opus Hotel prior. From the first moment they walked in they felt welcome - the staff truly went out of their way to make their stay special. Little touches matter, common courtesy, kindness are not dead at the Opus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location and lovely staff... felt welcomed from minute one..”
Reviews.Author: DZuki111
Reviews.Content: The touch of class from the Opus cannot be understated. It's wonderful. From the moment I walked in and was greeted with a smile and a glass of bubbly to the last minute I stepped away and had my car pulled up for me; the Opus staff was first class. The rooms were comfortable and the beds; wonderful!! I stayed here for 11 days and my favourite part was the candy on my bed at turndown nightly. Pez. Lollypops. Greetings with nuts and popcorn. I didn't try the restaurant, but it was pretty hoppin' nightly (especially the weekends). I didn't hear much from my 6th floor room, but it did seem like a popular joint. I was here for business and coming back each night felt like home. Oh. And there's a BMW car service. Again. Very classy. I think Lindsay Stevens for helping me with my reservations and getting a great rate for my 11 day stay. Thanks again Opus. I'll be back for vacation for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: dg4471
Reviews.Content: Great service; great location-in the heart of Yaletown, walking distance to everything including subway rapid transit to airport; large and comfortable room (with separate bathtub and shower) at a rate through hotel website significantly less than other upscale hotels in city center; complimentary bikes to use in an extremely cycling friendly city-would stay here again and recommend without hesitation to anyone looking for hotel in this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed with the great service and room”
Reviews.Author: 154943Trip
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the great service and the decoration of the Hotel specially the room clean and classy!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel,but under the expectations”
Reviews.Author: EmirBerke
Reviews.Content: At the heart of the nightlife. Its a design Hotel, but dont expect an unusual or a new design. The architecture is not up to date. Doesnt have a SPA nor Sauna, a small fitness room with no attendant. 100 night Restaurant is very popular for Locals.But the attitude and the approach of the staff is very arrogant. They are even shouting to the guests.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: 10travelbug10
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Opus in Vancouver was beyond friendly. Also, they were quite eager to ensure that we had a great stay and were readily available. While, the location in Yaletown couldn't be any more practical for great dining, the hotel resto has a great menu as well - with perhaps one of the most mouth-watering french toasts I've ever eaten. The decor is trendy and artistic and perfectly suited for urban lifestyles. An overall great experience at the Opus!

Reviews.Title: “A great boutique hotel supported by great service”
Reviews.Author: DavidatTarget
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our 4-night stay at this small, boutique hotel located in the heart of Yaletown. The staff, from our first interaction with the valet, through checking in, and room cleaning complete with turndown service, as well as ANY other service request we had, were professional, friendly and super resourceful. We were greeted with friendly smiles every time we approached the door or the desk, and we were always accommodated with exceptional service. We loved our room, although some might consider it a bit small, but as it was very well laid out and we were never at a loss for storage space. We found many great restaurants nearby, and as the city is very walkable, we also found many others not in the immediate neighborhood. It is a great location from which to explore the sculputres that are part of the Vancouver Biennale, too. If you tire of walking, the complimentary bikes are a great perk for a leisurely ride on the seawall. Additionally, the hotel is adjacent to a stop on the Skytrain, so you don't even need to rent a car if you are coming from the airport!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Business Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBondo
Reviews.Content: The Opus Vancouver knows how to treat a business traveller. I felt spoiled and was treated like their most important guest...although the hotel was full...with smiling faces to great meet at every turn. It was the most trouble-free stay that I've experienced out of any Vancouver hotel during my business travels and seemed like every detail was in-line with my expectations (I'm needy when travelling for business). I strongly recommend Opus Vancouver to any business traveller looking to be treated right.

Reviews.Title: “Employees outstanding, hotel average”
Reviews.Author: ronneedham
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is another of the billion hotels trying to be "hip." Been there, done that. There is more downside to this approach than upside. The employees (desk, concierge, etc) were outstanding. Helpful, pleasant, etc. Couldn't ask for better trained and better attitudes than they possess. The hotel. Eh. Decent rate for my stay so it was a decent value. It was in good shape and well tended. However, all the downside of "aren't we cool" existed here. Rooms a bit tiny. Bathrooms are "see through" with a sheer curtain. That's okay if you are staying with Angelina Jolie and you happen to be Brad Pitt. But had I been traveling with a shy companion (I wasn't, I was on business) I could see that person not comfortable at all having use the faciliities. The bar was "velvet roped" so when we tried to grab a drink around 9pm at the hotel bar we were told we would have to stand in line. Now, we were well dressed and had our expense account in our hands. Seemed like a bad call on their part. But, you know, they are trying to be Studio 54 in 1975. Irony of this: inside the hotel (yes, they put the velvet ropes outside for the bar entrance AS WELL AS inside the lobby area so you can go into lobby but not to bar...even as a guest)..again: Irony of this was that we simply waited 2 minutes until they were distracted in the lobby and simply stepped over the velvet rope. We walked in and had a drink and it was just another bar. It wasn't packed at all so the line outside of 10-15 people was clearly to give the impression of being the cool place, nothing more. The people were just as attractive at the 20 other bars around the corner. Just a joke to suck you in. But it bothered me enough as a guest that I wouldn't stay here again. If you are paying good money, and you are well dresssed and well behaved and can't get into the hotel bar at 9pm, well, I'm perfectly comfortable spending my money at other fabulous establishments. Just a warning. Some of my team stayed at the Fairmont and others at the Sheraton due to most hotels being sold out. I checked out both and would stay at either before I came back to the Opus. I prefer enjoyment and comfort, etc, over 'I'm cool, don't you think so?"

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there for my wedding night”
Reviews.Author: DirkFTW
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opus in the Executive Suite for my wedding night. It was a great way to end a perfect day. The room looked great (rose petals, chocolate strawberry's, and champagne were all set up and ready for when we got there.) my wife loved it. I would highly recommend anyone to stay at the Opus.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever.... Anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteNC45
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb, but it's the staff and their service that make the Opus incredible! Hands down, the best place I've stayed in years. David at the reception desk was particularly intuitive to my needs, offering a glass of bubbly at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver's Ideal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rashanda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in walking distance to Downtown Vancouver and local hotspots around Yaletown. It has the perfect restaurant, bar and social amenities for out of town travelers

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay Downtown”
Reviews.Author: BiC1185
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short getaway. Great location it was easy to find and near just about everything you would want to go to. Highly recommend the Lights Out Package. It gives you a coupon that saves you 15% on select local shops which equals brownie points with the lady.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sue_raymer
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Yaletown, The Opus Hotel has got to be the coolest, hippest, most comfortable hotel in Vancouver with the friendliest staff in all of Canada. You are greeted with a smile and a tall glass of either Champagne or juice and the service just keeps getting better. Please let me recommend the Crab Benedict for breakfast - image your poached egg and Benedict sauce on a crab cake! Every morning as we set out to explore Vancouver, our valet guy, Tobi, made sure we had directions, a bottle of water and when it rained, an umbrella, of course! We had the pleasure of watching the Canucks's game in the bar where they set up a big screen for everyone's enjoyment while they served snacks or even full dinners. The room was extremely comfortable with a huge King-sized bed and our turn down service always included a little candy surprise! We cannot say enough good things about this lovely hotel and especially the staff. Excellent + + (as they say in Canada), eh!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay in a Wonderful Town”
Reviews.Author: MBOC
Reviews.Content: Minimalist, high-design, trendy hotel for reasonable price. Part of the incredible discount we were able to secure in staying at this hotel is because Vancouver is quite low-key during New Years. So if you're able to get a great rate - stay here. Opus is a very nice and comfortable hotel, with a very helpful staff, in a great part of town. The car service (Porsche Cayenne) is very useful and the drivers informed and knowledgeable. This is a stylized boutique hotel, but don't expect anything extravagant or plush. Do expect the want-to-be-it crowd hanging out in the lobby and restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “We are always well treated at the Opus.”
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Opus for business for over three years and they always make us feel special. Staff is friendly and helpful and I especially like the glass of bubbly at check in.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS a must-stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: sbooned
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beyond our expectations from the uber cool room decor to the excellent service to the unpretentious, friendly staff. Loved the John Fleuvog black and fuchsia shoes worn by the porter. So looking forward to our stay at the OPUS in Montreal in a couple of months!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay, right in the heart of Vancouver's historic Yaletown.”
Reviews.Author: MJCalg
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from our stay at the Opus Hotel in Vancouver. Can't say enough about this place. Their customer service was exceptional. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, modern hotel in a prime location with attractive staff!”
Reviews.Author: peterroessler
Reviews.Content: The staff were attentive, efficient, and friendly without it seeming forced or insincere. I was in my room within 10 minutes of arrival and downstairs at the Opus Cafe enjoying a complimentary charcuterie plate within half an hour. The rooms are well-designed -- a very smart and modern feel. Also, the converted brick buildings in the neighborhood are full of charm and character and filled with great restaurants, cafes, and shops. I went to a tanning salon, got a great new pair of jeans, went out for a nice dinner, and made it up the street to a gay bar, all without breaking a sweat (excluding the sweat from tanning LOL). Finally, to my surprise, there was a bustling cocktail thing happening in the attached nightclub/lounge with a great house DJ! Even better, I couldn't hear any of it once I returned to my 4th floor room.

Reviews.Title: “it is a very nice hotel - i would stay again....”
Reviews.Author: OttawaGirl84
Reviews.Content: The staff are extremely polite and helpful. The hotel is funky, and fun - it has a hip feel to it.

Reviews.Title: “Location plus service equals great value!”
Reviews.Author: BarryCanada
Reviews.Content: In the heart of Yaletown the Opus is also across the street from the Yale Train which provides easy access to the waterfront and the airport so no cab is required to get to the hotel. The room was bright and airy and featured one of the best shower's in the world. All staff were friendly and helpful. They recommended a great restaurant and even provided a courtesy lift. I travel the world and this was a top ten experience. A real boutique hotel in that the design was modern and the service old fashioned.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: duffsden
Reviews.Content: I was traveling on business for a conference, I found the staff to be equal to or more friendly and helpful compared to any other place I have stayed. The room was clean and modern. While I got the idea the hotel may have been older, it had very "artsy" feel to it which I enjoyed. Actually, it is rare that I find business travelers discussing their hotel experience unless it was negative; several people that were in the hotel were discussing the unique nature and “experience.” I would recommend this hotel if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a romantic get away!”
Reviews.Author: Julgriff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live 45 minutes away from Vancouver and sometimes like to go downtown for the weekend. We have tried many spots and we love Opus the best. Its sleek, sexy decor matched with great sevice and location just cant be beat. Our expectations are defintely met, and usually surpassed on each visit!

Reviews.Title: “Opus is Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Ironqueen
Reviews.Content: The Opus experience is a must for anyone visiting Vancouver. In addition to its premium location in the heart of ritzy Yaletown, the Opus delivers an unmatched level of service and attention to detail. From the pleasant and extra attentive staff to the modern decor and luxurious (L'Occitane bath products) and thoughtful (umbrellas) touches at every step, this hotel guarantees an experience you won't forget.

Reviews.Title: “Group Booking”
Reviews.Author: RoryRichards
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a large block of rooms at Opus Vancouver for clients that were traveling from across N. America to attend a national press conference in Vancouver. I couldn't be happier with my choice as the feedback from my clients has been incredible. The staff at Opus treated them like gold and gave them a tremendous guest experience. The bar at Opus provided them a chic and popular lounge to have cocktails each night and the location of the hotel was fabulous for them to wander around Yaletown for shopping and great dining. We also engaged the catering services at Opus for our post conference reception and we were again blown away. Definitely an A + experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “The Opus Staff go out of their way to make you feel Special.”
Reviews.Author: Roninpoco
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our stays at the Opus, this was our third time there. The location is very central to the Yaletown shops and restaurants and walking along False Creek. We had the breakfast package and found the food to be excellent. The price for these rooms is not inexpensive, but I feel we receive the value and special treatment that keeps us coming back.

Reviews.Title: “The staff treated us as if we were the most special people in the hotel; it was a great visit.”
Reviews.Author: yxof007
Reviews.Content: I found the Opus to be a fantastic place to stay. As I had never been to Vancouver before, there were a lot of places we didn't know how to find. The hotel staff were very pleasant and always gave us good directions. They also made suggestions of things to see. The offer to take us anyplace we would like to go was extended often. The rooms were clean and carefully cared for. The view was exquisite. I would stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LynneE50
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with big service. Attention to the small details that make a big difference. Beverage offered at check-in to take up to your room. Turn down service at night. Nice touches. Rooms are uniquely decorated...fun and funky! Great location; close to trendy area as well as the big malls in downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: carjam12
Reviews.Content: My sister and I recently travelled to Vancouver for a wedding. Our stay at the Opus was fabulous. Kelly and Patrick at the front desk were very very accomodating and friendly. Being greeted upon check in with a glass of champagne was a very nice touch. We stayed there 4 nights. It's a great location, near all the best restaurants and just a couple of blocks from the water, a great place to take a walk in the mornings or evenings. Beautiful view, lots to do and see. Special mention to Toby and Arnaud as well, always friendly and very helpful. These people couldn't do enough to make our stay as pleasant as possible. Thanks to all, can't wait to come back in July...

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY - BEAUTIFUL HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: jeffisg1
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel in Vancouver is the place to be. Not only are the rooms amazing, clean, cool and comfy the hotel offers excellent food, the friendliest most courtiest staff in Vancouver Hotels who will go out of their way to make your stay perfect. I've stayed at many hotels in Vancouver and Opus is the top choice, it's always reasonable in terms of cost.

Reviews.Title: “Wowed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: johnbrody
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the service was great, helpful, and courteous. Nice touch with the champagne at the front door. The room was exceptional and very upscale. We had a great stay and we look forward to staying at the Opus Hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS Vancouver - excellent everything!”
Reviews.Author: samazda
Reviews.Content: I normally don't go so far as to provide written feedback to either the hotel management and definitely not on a review site about service since as it is a service industry, decent service is expected. However, the service and overall experience at Opus Vancouver was truly exceptional that I felt compelled to write about it. As a boutique hotel, it has all the niceties that I expect from a boutique in a major city: rooms designed with thought, cleanliness, better than average beds and furnishings, good local to restaurants and downtown life, etc. In terms of value, I felt it was a good value for all the special touches, amenities and especially the service. The small courtesy touches like delivered water and snacks at night and drivers willing to take clients to parts of town were nice flourishes to the experience. I had the standard room and have in the ceiling shower heads that gives you that full on deluge, which I love. However, the staff are the true standouts. From front desk/concierge, valet/bell person to maid and evening turn down service all the staff exhibited a consistency of professionalism, courtesy, friendliness and a willingness to assist no matter whether personnel was client facing or not. It is truly a wonderful and refreshing experience to have even the maid service displaying the same professional and smiling courtesy as the front desk. If you need anything, all of the staff is willing and able to assist, but I have to say Janelle at the front desk exemplifies customer service with personality! I can’t rave enough and recommend Opus Vancouver for business and leisure travelers! Side footnote: there is a OPUS Montreal and I stayed there for business hoping to have the same experience as in OPUS Vancouver. It's not the same and not sure why the level of service is not the same. Hoping Montreal will some day be on par with Vancouver's service.

Reviews.Title: “Our second honeymoon at the "Jewel" of Yaletown.”
Reviews.Author: lindasja
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our anniversary and decided to treat ourselves to a weekend in the city. We decided that the experience we were looking for was a boutique hotel, with its more intimate and personalized atmosphere. Friends of ours had raved about their stay at the Opus and knowing how particular they were, we felt very confident that this would be a memorable weekend. How right we were !From the warm welcome at the door to the amazing front end staff, we ere made to feel like returning royalty. Our room was beautifully appointed and such care had been taken in the presentation. What completely dazzled us was the bottle of wine and exquisite chocolate covered strawberries left for us in honour of our anniversary. Who does that anymore? Apparently, the Opus!! As if that wasn't enough, after a fun day of touring around our fair city, the lovely and gracious Leslie at the front desk arranged to have the fabulous hotel car take us to our favourite restaurant for dinner. All things must come to an end and after a tasty brunch in the hotel dining room the next morning, we reluctantly had to say goodbye to the Opus. I'm delighted to say we are now planning a stay at the Opus for another occasion this summer. Our daughter will be getting married and we have already booked rooms for her bridesmaids, also the bride and groom, along with recommending the hotel to our friends and family from out of town. We have no doubt they will all feel as pampered and special as we did and will be recommending the Opus to their friends.

Reviews.Title: “Most Memorable Stay By Far!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sincerely_paris
Reviews.Content: We went to the Opus Hotel for our anniversary. We were greeted by phenomenal staff who had our room ready with ice in the buckets and nice romantic music. We were given some recommendations to Blue Water for dinner which was also amazing. The suites are trendy, clean and amazing. Highly recommend to everyone who needs a great getaway to Vancouver in the heart of the trendy area in Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mjp23
Reviews.Content: Just spent two nights at the Opus Hotel, Vancouver. Main areas are inviting, rooms are bright....but the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff is most outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service in a very modern hotel.”
Reviews.Author: FirstATV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Opus for 2 nights and also held a small conference there for 2 days. The service at the hotel was absolutely exceptional. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful in all aspects. The door men and receptionists were very welcoming and quick with their service, the cleaning staff were very helpful for a handful of requests like extra wine glasses or ice in the rooms. The catering staff for our conference were very responsive and considerate checking in frequently to make sure there was plenty of coffee and snacks. Even the hotel manager who visited our room due to a noise complaint from another room, was very courteous when asking us to keep the noise down. The decor in the hotel was very modern and trendy, and the rooms had a very clean and contemporary feel to them. The bathrooms were very "liberal" with large glass windows facing the street or from the shower to the bedroom, which may not be comfortable for everybody, but in my opinion they were great. The rooms in general were exceptional, with a very spacious and comfortable feel. Located in Yaletown, the hotel was in walking distance to plenty of nice restaurants. We didn't need to travel very far to find a great place to eat or drink at night. Opus exceeded all my expectations, and there was nothing at all to dislike about it. I'd definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sunshine in a rainy city”
Reviews.Author: stephendoliver
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the opus for a couple nights in late march while i was in town on business. I was greeted by a very friendly reception, a beautiful room and a very nice and unexpected turn down service, not a single person in the hotel was less than hospitable and going out of their way to make you feel cozy. great location.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional!”
Reviews.Author: Borison
Reviews.Content: When in Vancouver, my company usually gives me the choice between Four Seasons and Opus, and if there is room at the Opus I always prefer them, even though the former is still a great hotel. Opus - best location, service and very smart room designs, but also it's smaller so it feels much more personal, which reminds me - please go to Four Seasons, so that there's room for me at the Opus, next time I go to BC!

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Ritzy!”
Reviews.Author: ashleyogloff
Reviews.Content: My husband and I won a two night stay at the Opus hotel and we loved it. The location is amazing, really nice modern area and the hotel itself is really beautiful. Great views of the downtown area with restaurants and shops all around. The room was beautiful and the bathroom even more-so. Bathroom has a large floor to ceiling window that looks through the room and out the window.... which we really loved. Classy lobby and professional staff, overall it was a really great find. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone looking to have a nice splurge weekend in Vancouver- you'll feel spoiled! Make sure you order breakfast in room the next morning, that was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Business meetings at the Opus - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: UsBizTraveler01
Reviews.Content: My company just completed multi-day business meetings with prospective clients at the Opus Hotel, and I must say that it was an incredibly pleasant experience. I mean, the Opus is no dive - it's a luxury, boutique property, and as an overnight guest, I expected posh rooms and excellent service. My concern, going into the event was the meeting venue and service. With but two rooms to hold events, my concern was that the focus of the Opus was more on ensuring a positive guest experience, with perhaps less focus and experience in meeting the needs of a business meeting. The stress of ensuring all went smoothly for our meeting counterparts who were traveling internationally didn't help. Our meetings kicked off well with setup completed and catering delivered as pre-arranged. Still, in the back of my mind, I had concerns. When I asked the Opus events manager how I should communicate any needs during the course of our meetings, the response was, "Oh, just call down to the front desk and they'll take care of it.". I must have visibly cringed. You tell me - would you expect to call down to the front desk of a hotel and get the desired assistance you need for a business meeting? I wouldn't. Our meetings continued, and with the pleasant and timely service delivered by the Opus staff (thanks Abby!), my stress lessened. It's the type of meeting you hope for - lunch mysteriously shows up when you didn't even hear them enter the room; coffee gets refreshed before you have a chance to ask; food tastes fabulous. All good. Then, on the final day of our meetings, we actually have an issue that needs to be addressed - original plans called for lunch outside the hotel (i.e., not catered by the Opus), but we needed more time to complete agenda items in our meeting, and really needed to have another "working lunch" catered. I picked up the phone in the meeting room, around 9:30AM that day, dreading the call to the "front desk", and knowing full well that odds were stacked against any positive resolution. The first 15 seconds of the conversation included me blathering as I tried to explain our situation. "Kelly" at the front desk waited patiently and then delivered the following response:"If appropriate, we can provide a full lunch, similar to what you've arranged over the last two days, with some variety so as not to seem repetitive. Same time?". My jaw dropped. I hung up the phone and looked at my colleagues in stunned surprise that I had just arranged a last minute lunch for six people (soup, salad, 3 different sandwiches, dessert, etc.) with the front desk of the hotel. Many thanks to Kristin and the event staff at the Opus for a flawless event. It seems rare that a venue and staff can contribute to the success of a meeting...but that's exactly what the Opus Hotel did.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed, contemporary hotel with lots of thoughtful extras”
Reviews.Author: Lozza1977
Reviews.Content: Great attention to detail (a 'real' hairdryer, iPod dock, well stocked traveller essentials), lush bathroom, large comfortable bed, contemporary if slightly masculine design, good breakfast, mostly nice staff - some were a bit too 'cool' - great business centre facilities, and excellent eggs benedict in the restaurant. If I wasn't aware of it before, the flamingo-inspired stools in reception, great attention to detail and chic masculine design indicated that Opus is most probably a gay-friendly environment! Only downside was that the in-room internet connection was costly so we didn't bother. Internet access was available for free however on the Macs in the business centre. Highly recommended - look about for deals. When we extended our stay they agreed to honour our internet booking rate but then couldn't believe we'd got the room at the price we did!

Reviews.Title: “Top of the list for best Boutique Hotels”
Reviews.Author: steinstyle
Reviews.Content: Hi, You will be extremely impressed with your stay at the hotel Opus. Their entire staff [ not just one individual ] were Top notch in hospitality. I travel over 125k miles a year = All over the US, Europe and South America. The Opus hotel and staff ranks at the top of all the hotels I have stayed at. GREAT JOB!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect birthday weekend!”
Reviews.Author: VancouverPeggy_s
Reviews.Content: I had a phenomenal weekend stay at the Opus! It's such a great hotel with the great staff who made us feel so welcome from the minute we walked through the doors. The food, drinks and especially the service at the restaurant and lounge 100 Days was top notch. I had my birthday dinner there with 15 friends and everyone had a great time. I'll definitely be dining and staying there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall experience I've had in Vancouver in a long time”
Reviews.Author: bianca_maria_t
Reviews.Content: Rooms were great. Staff was awesome. Food and drinks were amazing. Really liked the overall vibe of the hotel. I loved the turndown service which included mood music and a jug of water for the night! I will stay and dine at the hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, totally hijacked by a trendy night-club”
Reviews.Author: yoooreds
Reviews.Content: As a general review, the Opus is a great hotel. Smart young with very professional staff. The rooms are good, and with it's location in young trendy Yaletown, with great restaurants on it's door step, it's a very popular hotel for young/fashionable//media types on business in Vancouver. So why the "terrible" rating. Well the Opus is sadly a victim of it's own hype. The reasonably small bar/restaurant area, becomes a very popular bar/mini-club, with doormen vetting dress-code and keeping order as a 20-30+ crowd mill around in the queue outside. This would be fine if it were confined to just the bar, or I was looking for a loud hip night club. but I wasn't. I was returning from a restaurant with friends and colleagues, one of which was heavily pregnant. With the foyer area roped off we tried to ask the bouncer is we could perhaps sit in one of the many spare seats, no more than 15 feet from the reception desk. I then realised that we were no longer in a hotel at all. It had been hijacked from under it's own nose. We were forced to stand in a very busy discotheque, unable to get served or hear ourselves talk. we were excluded from our own hotel foyer. I wandered over to reception to ask why we couldn't sit in one of the empty seats, and the answer was that he was powerless, as this area was now a bottle only bar. after much fuss were were offered a seating area, in a dingy room, which felt like a back room at a wedding buffet. Come on guys. were residents at your hotel, we only want to sit in the foyer and finish our drinks, and allow our heavily pregnant friend to rest her wiery legs. I returned to my room fuming and unable to sleep due the daily noise from the club downstairs. "Wake-up guys" and reclaim your fine hotel, before the loud arrogant nightclub, hijacks you're good name.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service in a beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KWOOD13
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was stunning. We would stay again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “A class above”
Reviews.Author: TTRENTToronto
Reviews.Content: When I come to Vancouver there is only one place where I will stay, the Opus Hotel. The reason is simple, the level of service is a class above. All the employees make you feel comfortable as soon as you enter the lobby and from there everyone seems to be be one step ahead in anticipating what I might need. The rooms are so unique and modern, the location is unbeatable in Yaletown and the overall environment is not one of your usual hotel but for me like a second apartment. I have recommended the Opus to all of my friends and colleagues if you want to have a different experience than your usual hotel stay, then the Opus is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Stellar!!”
Reviews.Author: roxyk05
Reviews.Content: The service we received at the OPUS was top notch! The staff went above and beyond to ensure our stay there was memorable. This hotel is very luxurious and you definitely feel like a rock star when staying there! The rooms are funky-modern, very spacious, and come fully stocked with all the little extras that you would expect from a Vancouver premier boutique hotel. Being in the heart of Yaletown is an amazing as you have all the amazing shops and restaurants just steps away. As an added bonus you are basically across the street from the Skytrain Canada Line to YVR, and this would be the perfect hotel to stay at to start your vacation/honeymoon of to a epic start! Opus is a definite “must stay” in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, friendly staff, convenient location, trendy bar on site”
Reviews.Author: CheChoui
Reviews.Content: Stunning decor. Luxurious deep soaking tub and very spacious bathroom. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Funky candy surprise with each turndown service. Right across from a train station and bustop. Nightlife nearby and very popular bar on site.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, exceptional service.”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirl64
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Opus at the suggestion of a colleague, who said this was THE place to stay if you were going to Vancouver. I cancelled my hotel stay at another property, and booked this one. So glad I did. The service was exceptional. The front desk staff was amazing, the housekeeping staff refers to you by name, showers are great with nice water pressure. Everyone jumps up to greet you. You feel like you are welcome, no matter who is there to help you. I did not encounter one person who didn't have a smile or who wasn't helpful. They take great pride in their hotel, as they should. Rooms are very clean, location.. perfect! Can't say enough about my first, (but definitely not my last) trip to Vancouver. Thanks to the Opus team for making my trip enjoyable and memorable. Stay here... just not on the nights I want to go so I can be sure to get in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for restaurants & bars, nice design and good service”
Reviews.Author: Dawn93
Reviews.Content: The hotel is modern in design with great service. Our room was nice with fresh & modern decor - but otherwise nothing particularly out of the ordinary (I think we were in a standard queen room). The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom is in one corner of the room. It felt a bit pricey particularly as cheaper rooms were available at most of the other downtown 5* hotels and the the hotel does not have facilities such as a spa or pool. Could just be the strong $ though. We chose it for the Yaletown location which was great (provided you don't want to be right on Robson Street) as it is right next to the main strip of restaurants and bars as well as the roundhouse train stop which takes you direct to the airport. Its about 15m walk to Robson Street.
