Additional pros were the free internet access/business centre, good breakfast, complementary car service - they will drop you downtown, modern design and friendly service. The restaurant was under renovation so can't comment on that. Would quite possibly stay here again depending on the rate.

Reviews.Title: “stay here”
Reviews.Author: costand1
Reviews.Content: Really cool hotel with highly trained staff. Creative design - not as cheesy as the W chain. Right across the street from subway and walking distance to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: dcm79
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, with fantastic staff and service. The location is superb, and value for money is decent. I really enjoyed our first time in Vancouver, and the staff when out of their ways to be of assistance to us which really helped. I would have no problems in reconmending this hotel, or returning there next year when we will again br in Vancouver! Great Hotel, well deserving of its rank.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: rvh1980
Reviews.Content: If I could rate this hotel 6 out of 5 stars I would! Great staff, great location. I went up for New Years and it was my first visit to Vancouver, BC. The staff took care of all of us. Very clean hotel and in a great neighborhood. My friends and I ended up staying there for 3 days and never really left the area. I would highly recommend this hotel. It's staff is wonderful and made my friends and I feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Urban Stay”
Reviews.Author: Katykite
Reviews.Content: My experience at Opus was amazing! The staff was the nicest hotel staff Ive ever encountered, the hotel itself was beautiful and the rooms (I stayed in two different ones) were absolutely perfect, urban hip, comfortable and clean. The location was fantastic and so close to restaurants, bars, and entertainment. I have stayed at many Vancouver hotels and i would only choose Opus from now on. Love the concept and vision! Way to go Opus!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: Kellie002
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived, we received impeccable service ... from valet to front desk, the service was outstanding! Every employee that greeted made us feel special in every way ... the offering of a glass of champagne at the front desk when we checked was a wonderful and unexpected treat! Our room did not disappoint, very trendy, very hip ~ exceptionally clean, the decor was 1st class. For us, the Opus is located in a fabulous area of Yaletown, countless restaurants/lounges were only steps away. The staff at the front desk at checkout were warm and friendly and our overall experience has solidified, in our minds, that the Opus Hotel is a must on our next visit to Vancouver. ~~ Do checkout the "100 Days Restaurant/Lounge", we agreed it was not only hip, happening and bustling every night we were there, definitely one of THE places to be in Vancouver! ~~

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected - dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Astrobeemer
Reviews.Content: First, I tried to book the room using my iphone and their website is not iphone compatible. I then went on the computer and saw 4 different "non-refundable rates" all at different prices with no descriptions. I called the hotel to get an explanation on the different prices, I wanted to know why they were all different (ie, bigger room, more perks, etc) but the person in reservations did not know the answer. I then booked one of the non refundable rooms online using a debit VISA card and everything was good, got a confirmation. I even called to inform them I was bringing my puppy and to double check that everyhting was ok as they let me know that the card will be charged immediately rather than at check in, and the person on the other line said yes, and repeated all the specifics. When I got to the hotel, the valet was nowhere to be found, I parked in front, got the dog as well as our bags out of the car myself and went inside. There, I was informed that the card "declined", I told them it was not possible and called the credit/debit card company immediately. They told me that all was good with the card, but that the hotel was not set up to accept these new cards yet (it is a CIBC canadian card by the way). The bank suggested that they run it as a debit, and the person at the front desk at Opus was EXTREMELY rude, she did not even know how to ring in a debit card and had to get help from someone else. The attitude that we received from the woman at the front desk was shocking - she even raised her voice at us. The other hotel clerk was much nicer, calmer and was able to charge the card (after 15 minutes at the check in) with no problems. The valet who was quite friendly did come eventually and moved the car. After our glass of champagne (which was much needed at this point), we got our room key and we went up to our room with the dog and the bags (no bellhop). When we got to the floor we realised that the room was right next to the elevator, the abolute closest and noisiest room on the entire floor (remember we had a puppy....and naturally all dogs will jump and be anxious when they hear noises). the room was terribly noisy and our dog was quite stressed out (and we traveled with him before and did not have this problem). The room was quite clean (except for a small wet stain that smelled like stain remover) near the bathroom. the TV was old, the signal was horrible and the menu was so difficult to use that we got frustrated immediately. room service took quite a while, but the hotel clerk who brought it was very nice and friendly. We talked to someone at the bar who said that the hotel had complimentary service (which we did not know about), so we called the front desk for the car to take us to a restaurant near by, and she said the car is out...and did not know when to expect it back...ok..... We also overheard something about a complimentary coffee from another guest, so the next morning we ordered one single cappuccino but when we asked if it was complimentary for hotel guests, they rudely answered NO! we went online and found out we were supposed to order the latte....oh well... At checkout again we got attitude, rolled eyes and no smiles. Again, nobody helped with the bags... Overall, it is not what I expected. The customer service was touch and go. We would have really appreciated if the check in agent would have asked us if it was our first time there, let us know the perks....etc, but this did not happen. Overall, bad experience !!! Although at least it balanced out with the exceptional service and great experience we had at the Blue Water Cafe (also reviewed on tripadvisor)

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in Vancouver accommodations”
Reviews.Author: kpnsf
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several different Vancouver hotels before (mostly recognizable chains), and I'm so happy that a business colleague suggested I try Opus. I extended a 2 day business trip by another 3 days (flew my wife in) and we absolutely loved everything about this hotel. I spend 70% of the month on the road. Finding a hotel that makes you feel at home, as well as providing much-needed help for us "accidental tourists" is often times rare. Nathan at the front desk put together an amazing getaway for my wife and I to Victoria for the day - all of the suggested locations were a hit. Ivan in the restaurant not only took great care of me and the business colleagues for the two days we had meetings, he continued his great service to my wife and I over the next 3 days, serving up great food and suggested local haunts for us to visit. Room service, housekeeping staff - you name it, every person that works in this hotel was so helpful and pleasant without making you feel like they were fake. I will be back in Vancouver in the summer and I won't even consider looking at another hotel. Opus is the best value for a luxury boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, happy and hospitable”
Reviews.Author: bubbabilly
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Opus was wonderful. From the moment I drove up to the hotel entrance, I was greeted by very friendly and energetic employees who made it clear they wanted to treat me like a special guest - and that they did in gobs! Front desk staff were super, rooms were fantastic, and the ambiance downstairs in the lobby/restaurant was what one can expect in the heart of Yaletown. Truly a fabulous hotel that I would strongly recommend to anyone when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon In Van”
Reviews.Author: edcso
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel was one of the bright spots in our trip to Vancouver. Very Cool design and definitely great Service. We found Vancouver to be quite poor on the ability to truly give 5 star service, but NOT the OPUS Hotel. Very good service and made you feel important and worth the money paid.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: KarolineM
Reviews.Content: I read reviews about the Opus and almost had to tell myself to calm down as I tend to get over excited about hotels that I stay at. Usually, I'm let down when I walk into the rooms and realize how much touch up was done or how they only focused on the only one nice part of the hotel in the pictures. This was not the case with Opus. Everything about this hotel was clean, hip, and modern, just as the pictures portrayed and reviewers raved. The room we stayed in (Executive Suite) was a very inspiring purple color with vibrantly coloured furniture and decorations. All amnetites from the soaps, cds, bar, etc.. was very well thought out. I honestly can't think of anything that needs improvement. I love how this hotel is in happening Yaletown and right in front of the Canada line. Convinient and posh is hard to find. Plus, free valet/Canada Line and internet is just another cherry on this sundae since these additions usually cost $30 per service. LOVE the Opus, will definately be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - wonderful amenities, location and hip feel”
Reviews.Author: slsvancouver
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. Great atmosphere - very hip, cool and contemporary. Excellent service. Nice touches in the rooms - CD's, high end amenities and details. Contemporary decor. Excellent location in the heart of Yaletown. Lobby bar is very popular and busy with young, trendy clientele but once you are in your room, there is no residual noise (we were on the fourth floor). I am in the travel business and would definitely recommend this hotel to clients travelling to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “fun, chic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bellarama33
Reviews.Content: We booked the Penthouse and had a few friends stop by for some Christmas cocktails before heading out on the town - from the reservation to the warm welcome at check in to the prompt room service staff were wonderful. Bed was great and despite being in the hub of it all the room was quiet and peaceful - we slept late and enjoyed an excellent breakfast before leaving. Would definitely recommend for fun, service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great staff. Loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: wikle
Reviews.Content: great location, amazing staff, great room, great coffee shop next door, great bar/resto through lobby...........I can't say enough about this place. I'll stay here everytime I go to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff, uber cool lobby bar”
Reviews.Author: Bialecki
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Opus and the staff once again teated us wonderfully. The location is in the midst of fantastic restaurants and just next to the water & a great running path. The rooms are great. (They give old fashioned candy at turn-down.) The food was fantastic too. One warning: the lobby bar is very cool and very crowded and very loud at night. If you're an early bird, request a room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Groovy”
Reviews.Author: gpdLondon
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times. The hotel has been renovated, the bar is now much more urban and gritty if those are the right words...young crowd, well younger than me. Very beautiful staff, but pretty efficient. Close to good restaurants etc and in a decent part of town. To be honest I am probably not their target market - business traveller in his 50s, but it is a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful, very stylish and, above all, great fun.”
Reviews.Author: CGCOne
Reviews.Content: I've not been back to Vancouver since the Winter Olympics came and went but ever since discovering the Opus in the summer of 2006, it's always the top of my list. Achingly hip, but in a nice way, and now that the Canada Line practically stops on its doorstep, it's so easy to reach. If only London England weren't quite so far away...

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Opus for a really great time!”
Reviews.Author: HappyHoliday81
Reviews.Content: Airport to the Opus is a breeze with the metro. We hopped off, walked kitty corner & we were there. Great staff, lovely, quiet room and an excellent location. Within a couple of blocks we were able to walk along the waterfront promenade but we could have opted for the ferry which would have taken us over to Granville island.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MCR0269
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vancouver on business for a week. Every night as I entered the hotel I was offered a glass of champagne (which I, of course, was more than willing to receive). The staff were extremely friendly and really made you feel welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver rocks.”
Reviews.Author: dethmuffin
Reviews.Content: Cool place to stay, friendly and super effective staff. Excellent rooms in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Opus”
Reviews.Author: TonyTT_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very professional, fancy, and edgy cool at the same time. The use of their chauffeur driven BMW 7-series is an extra you will not find for the price. Everyone was very helpful and I highly recommend this hotel over the Four Seasons where I have stayed in the past.

Reviews.Title: “SPECTACULAR!”
Reviews.Author: JBK1966
Reviews.Content: From the moment we entered the hotel we were greeted with gleaming smiles and courteous professionalism. Sparkling wine offered at check-in, doors opened, bags taken before we had to look for a bell hop, an overall welcomed feeling. We felt as though the staff was genuinely happy we were there! The rooms were stylish and impeccably clean. The bed was a cloud sent from Heaven and the bathroom floors are heated! The restaurant associated with the Opus Hotel, 100 Days, was SUPERB!!!! Our server Ben was extremely competent and had a thorough knowledge of the menu. We had an amazing experience and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: TelfordDog
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Opus Hotel many times over the years. It is first class all the way. The new '100 days' restaurant/lounge is a very cool new concept. Apparently the restaurant will change themes every 100 days. The staff look after your every need are always very professional. It may be a little pricier then large hotel chains but the little extra is well worth it considering the ambience, quality of rooms and amenities and service. I highly recommend the Opus Hotel to anyone I know that is staying in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay at the OPUS in any city and on every trip if I had the opportunity”
Reviews.Author: vancouverlucky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming and the staff are all very attentive and responsive. As a frequent guest, I have spent over 50 nights here in the last year, I would heartily recommend the rooms, the ambiance and the location for any business or leisure traveller to Vancouver. As a hotel designer myself, I find the amenities just right, and the attention to detail and value for dollar to be exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect boutique hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: patferns
Reviews.Content: The expectation at a boutique hotel is that the experience feels intimate and personal. At Opus, the facility is excellent; and the staff is quite exceptional. I really felt I was being given personal attention, and advice, when requested, was invariably first rate. I travel the world extensively, and Opus provides the closest I have come to finding a "home from home". I cannot recommend it too highly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great service.”
Reviews.Author: Dream_BC
Reviews.Content: This hotel had great service day and night. Even the housekeepers would take a second to say hello and smile. The turn down service was appreciated and housekeeping standards were excellent. The only downside I found was the parking which is of course a premium for anyone with this fantastic of a location. Although valet parking was available at all times I sometimes needed more access to my vehicle (which is more like a portable office) then I was comfortable bugging them for. If you are here for pleasure you really don't even need a vehicle. Overall it was fantastic and I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Super deal”
Reviews.Author: Marc_1_70Florence
Reviews.Content: Amazing boutique hotel, greatlocation, very helpful staff and incredible party place (which does not help to sleep...). The price I paid was really reasonable, probably one of the best price/quality ratio I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, clean room, and a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Speedytravel27
Reviews.Content: The service was really wonderful--the staff was very helpful and friendly. All of my requests were met. I'd definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My Vancouver home away from home”
Reviews.Author: mahra
Reviews.Content: I've stayed a few times at the Opus now while on business in Vancouver and I couldn't imagine staying anywhere else. I know, that sounds like a cliché, but it's true. Same goes for my ratings - I'm not handing out five stars easily, trust me. I've had my share of not so great hotel experiences. To the Opus: aside from its great location in Yaletown and close enough to Downtown Vancouver, I can't praise the friendliness and helpfulness of its staff enough. Everybody I've had the pleasure of meeting there is constantly creating an atmosphere that is giving New York's Mercer, Tribeca Grand and Hudson hotels a run for their money. The Opus staff doesn't carry the "You should be thankful that you can stay at our hotel" attitude but instead is abundantly inviting and friendly. The rooms are quiet, stylish and comfortable and even have color schemes to chose from. The only color scheme that's not so cool is the latest incarnation of the hotel bar/breakfast area. Now getting remodeled every 100 days and named accordingly, the space looks like a youth center in the 70s and 80s, graffiti, empty spraycans and folding chairs included. But the next iteration is coming soon, so there's some hope left. All in all, I can't imagine staying anywhere else during my trips to Vancouver. Or Montreal, of course - although the Opus Vancouver has a definitive edge against its East Coast sibling.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Experience...as usual!!!”
Reviews.Author: hipspots
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Opus and the first time I have ever stayed at a hotel for a second time and was greeted by “Welcome back”. I thought that was a really warm and friendly touch! The staff always go above and beyond what one would think is the highest norm to be accomodating and are always pleasant in doing so. You can tell the staff is sincere and genuine in doing so. Need I say more about the location...in my opinion the best location hands down in the city if you want to have a Vancouver experience! In the heart of Yaletown, only a 5 minute cab ride from the Rogers Arena and other great places to go let alone a walk away from some of the best restaurants and bars in the city...and an elevator ride downstairs to one of the hottest spots in the city right now...100 days! Great establishment, with equally great food but even more than the atmosphere and the food...the staff was extremely congenial and authentic...everyone obviously loves their job! During years of travel, I have never encountered a hotel’s customer service as outstanding as the Opus Vancouver. You and your staff definitely hit it out of the park...well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “First class customer service in a stylish boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BigEC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Opus Hotel in Vancouver, BC and we thoroughly enjoyed our time there. In addition to a fantastic location in Yaletown, the rooms were beautifully designed, the beds were very comfortable, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was lively. But, what really made our stay at the Opus even better was the first class customer service. Everyone at the front desk and in the restaurant were friendly, courteous, and helpful. Not only were they professional but we could tell they enjoyed their jobs. The Opus Hotel staff are a shinning example of what top level customer service should look like and why I will be back to the Opus whenever I'm in Vancouver, British Columbia.

Reviews.Title: “personalized, professional, and highly enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: hollyjf
Reviews.Content: For the last two years my husband and I have had the pleasure of celebrating our anniversary at OPUS Vancouver. It’s a quiet time of year when there are not a lot of other hotel guests around as most people are visiting their families. But, as Vancouver transplants to Ottawa we come home at Christmas time to celebrate being with our families and our anniversary. On a snowy Christmas eve in 2008 my husband and I married in Vancouver. We stayed the night at OPUS Vancouver, which was an absolute delight! So much so, that we returned last year to stay and we stayed for three nights. Our stays at OPUS Vancouver can be characterized as personalized, professional, and highly enjoyable. From the attention to detail in the rooms, the friendly and professional front desk staff, superb cleaning staff, and charming chauffeur we were truly taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional hotel in ideal location in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: EasyRider99
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Opus before and expected an exceptional experience and I am very pleased that my current stay was again exceptional. The great experience started at Vancouver Airport where I was able to hop onto the Canada Line directly to the Yaletown station and the Opus was up the stairway. Twenty minute ride and the Opus will credit your room for the Canada Line fare both ways. Previously, a taxi would be required or my company would pick me up which would cost an hour in heavy traffic. I had no problem with early check-in due to an early secondary meeting at 11AM. Bellman and check-in were courteous and prompt. The Opus is ultra modern and each room has its own character with distinctive designer appeal. The rooms are very clean and all the furniture is very comfortable and there is a desk with internet access. Housekeeping is very friendly and accommodating. There is turn down service with towel service if necessary as well as treats left for snacking. The restaurant staff are very knowledgeable about the food which is reasonably priced and truly a combination of food and art to create an enjoyable eating experience. The Opus has a very popular lounge and is known as the place to be in the evening. If you prefer to try other restaurants or pubs in the area, Yaletown offers lots of variety and many restaurants that have received culinary awards or ratings. Concierge and desk staff are very helpful from offering umbrellas for rainy days to assisting with taxis in and out of the hotel. I was permitted late check-out without a lot of fuss due to a late meeting time. Overall the Opus is exceptional, reasonably priced and should be a first choice for the Yaletown area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at Opus Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: Staci124
Reviews.Content: I just had a terrific stay Iat the recently had at the Opus. From the time I checked in until the time I left, the service was excellent! I was checked in by Patrick and Kelly, who gave me such a warm welcome. It was especially nice since I arrived with no luggage (United did not deliver until the next day). Kelly made sure I had all the necessities plus directed me to the closest pharmacy, as well as to the great nearby restaurants. Alejandro was so kind to get me multiple chargers to try for my blackberry phone, and found one that worked and hence, I was able to have cell coverage! Jeremy brought my bag up as soon as it arrived. The other extremely nice touch is champagne on arrival – especially appealing after my long day of travel. The other room amenities – water, candy, etc are also very nice too. Overall, a great stay - what a warm and welcoming staff! And, located in a charming neighborhood!

Reviews.Title: “Brought our dogs”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvler
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as we always wanted to stay right in the heart of Yaletown and this is the only hotel that is actually in Yaletown. In addition they allow you to bring your dogs at no extra charge which is pretty cool (we brought 2). I booked the room over the phone and was able to get my parking included and I "upgraded" to a larger room for $10 extra. I would say this was still the smallest room I have stayed in out of the downtown Vancouver hotels. Pros: Free dogs, great location, free valet parking, considered trendy, friendly door staff Cons: Rooms seemed slightly dated (old couch, old smaller flat screens), no pool, lounge bar was full of people who thought they were cooler than they were, value for the price is not as good as other options (Hyatt, Marriott, Sheraton, Delta). Overall it was fun to stay there, but they need to upgrade the furniture and get king sized beds if they want to keep their prices as high as they are. I would recommend it for someone looking for a smaller hotel, but if you are concerned about price, it isn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service ... excellent location ...”
Reviews.Author: LeafsNation
Reviews.Content: Opus was once again provided me with a great visit to Vancouver. Being in the heart of Yaletown is great - lots of excellent bars and restaurants close by ... the service is always top notch ... roms are clean and more spacious than most boutique hotels ... and suprisingly quiet given the location ... looking forward to my next vist .....

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Ruckus96
Reviews.Content: Our family weekend in Vancouver was a wonderful experience because of the over-the-top friendly and professional service at the Opus, Vancouver. We were greeted with lollipops for our children and treats for our dog waiting in our room. From Room Service to Front Desk, everyone was incredibly courteous and helpful. The weather was wonderful and the hotel's location allowed us to enjoy Science World, Yaletown, Granville Island, the beach, and some of Vancouver's finest restaurants. Thanks Opus!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: hephaistionch
Reviews.Content: Checked in early and of course room was not ready - nice drink was offered from front desk, half an hour later I got another room in the same category which was ready - flexible and qualified staff I have to say. Fun rooms - ipod connection, CD player with cool CDs from the house, nice food in the restaurant with super service and a crowded bar at weekend nights - everybody from Vancouver seems to be there...if they are cool and attractive...super friendly staff....a true experience I have to say...

Reviews.Title: “Great service in a perfect Vancouver location”
Reviews.Author: DaveandLisaButler
Reviews.Content: Fantastic little hotel. Great rooms, wonderful friendly staff who go out of their way to help, and right in the walking district of Yaletown. Great restaurants are all around you and the Rogers Centre is a 5 minute walk for a Canucks game or a concert.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, great design, flawless service”
Reviews.Author: bangalicious
Reviews.Content: The Opus is a stylish hotel around the corner from all of the happening restaurants of Yale town. Think W on a more human scale with more personable service. Robson and its shopping (and the accompany tourist hordes and noise) is a few blocks away and within walking distance, but removed enough so that you instead feel like a well informed local. You can also walk to the subway or down to the water to take a water taxi to Granville island. My room on the 5th floor was well laid out and comfortable. The unusal glass front bathroom was novel and made the room feel fancy and designed. Sounds weird at first, but during the day, the glare from the outside does not allow people to see in. The turndown service thoughtfully pulled down the privacy shades (there's both black-out and semi opaque roller shades) for me so i didn't have to figure it out. The turndown service also left novel and thoughtful minipresents like pez dispensers every evening-- great touch! Towels, L'Occitane toiletries, and single-use Starbucks coffee was dutifully restocked every day. Oh and I really enjoyed using the rainshower! Seriously can't say anything negative about this place, The lobby had a comfortable lounge area with a variety of seating types. This was perfect for both meeting clients for coffee at the table, and for having a leisurely drink after a long day of work. The lobby design was striking and simple--totally NOT cookie cutter or chain hotel at all. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place, definitely stay here”
Reviews.Author: jcrofskey
Reviews.Content: I'd been recommended to stay here by a friend and everything they described was right. This is a great spot in a happening part of Vancouver and so close to everything I wanted out of my trip. I had traveled from Australia so it was great to settle in and have a post flight shower and nap before hitting downtown. The concierge recommended great restaurants and I loved being able to walk everywhere. Close to the water taxis for a wander around Granville Island too.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, friendly boutique hotel in an excellent location in a great city”
Reviews.Author: felipeordonez
Reviews.Content: Let me say up front that if you like "traditional" hotels such as Four Seasons or Fairmonts, the Opus is not for you. On the other hand, if your taste runs to the likes of W hotels, then you will like the Opus. Located in Vancouver's Yaletown, close to dozens of restaurants and within easy walking distance of the shopping precinct of Robson Street, the Opus is a modestly-sized hotel that is rather self-consciously trendy – the bar and lobby seem to be something of a "scene" in the evenings. The rooms are generously-sized, with comfortable beds, but those facing the street have a quirky feature: a bathroom that has floor-to-ceiling windows; to be clear, the bathrooms are on the outside, so you have to roll down the blind to use the toilet or have a shower. I rather liked the arrangement, but some people will feel uncomfortable with the "privacy" aspect. The restaurant area was undergoing reconstruction so I my comments would probably already be out-of-date, but when I was there I found it overwhelmingly noise, open to the packed bar area as it was. Service at the Opus is outstanding: a friendly, smiling young front-of-house crew along with helpful and flexible housekeeping staff. Room servicing is impeccable. A cute and unusual feature is the shoes the male lobby crew wear: black brogues with a "saddle" of bright pink/purple leather. Stunning and different. And if you're really taken with them, and have a a wad of spare cash, you can buy a pair for yourself. By the way, the Opus is located within walking distance of some great Thai restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Wonderful Business Amenities, OK rooms...”
Reviews.Author: scout661
Reviews.Content: I had begged my parents to stay at the Opus hotel for our stay in Vancouver. When we arrived, the staff was warm, gracious, and thoughtful. We were offered Apple and orange juice, plus water, all complimentary. We had requested a False Creek view. The first thing I noticed was that the hotel looked a little worn. It was labeled as the most hip hotel in Vancouver, but it was all but deserted. The bar was empty. We got into the elevator, and went up to the 2nd floor. When we came into the room, there was a big paint chip on the wall, and it looked like the bedroom hadn't been re-painted in years. My mom, who gets slightly annoyed by these things, immediately called the front desk and asked if we could be moved to another room. We were moved to the one right above the old one. The pain chip was gone, but the room still looked older than I thought it would be. Another problem was that though we had asked for a false creek view, we instead looked out onto a apartment building. Other than these few problems, our stay was great. The complimentary lattes were wonderful, and the business center was the best I've ever seen. Overall, I would definitley go back, but be warned, its not as hip and trendy as everyone says.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy hotel with a very personal touch”
Reviews.Author: ElettraStuttgart
Reviews.Content: Good hotel in a perfect location in order to reach by bycicle or foot all major places in Vancouver. Extrem attention to guest's requirements. Friendly personnel. Unfortunately, during our stay we could not sleep the 1st night due to several fire alarms generated by drunk people in the bar: Upon a long trip this was of course annoying.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS makes my day”
Reviews.Author: billbradenphoto
Reviews.Content: The hotel's prime location in the heart of Vancouver's business and unique West Coast attractions, plus proximity to the fabulous new Canada Line, made it my choice. It's a quality place, smiles and courtesy all around, and even for Vancouver, delivers value for money.

Reviews.Title: “when in vancouver.....”
Reviews.Author: Ian000333
Reviews.Content: For me there is only one hotel in vancouver, it starts when the taxi pulls up to the curb and I'm greeted by name, follwed by a seamless check in. My visits from beginning to end are flawless and the staff are always able to accomodate my every need and whim. Nothing is a problem, everything feels effortless and genuine. Thank you Opus, I'll see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, other reviews don't exaggerate”
Reviews.Author: CrazyIvan2k8
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the OPUS for one week and had a really pleasant time. Friendly and helpful staff, nice rooms and a great location. I can recommend their restaurant "100 days", too. I would choose the OPUS again for another stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: sydnie21
Reviews.Content: Here is what I wrote to the hotel. We are all in customer service and one of the women in our party comes from a family who owns a hotel chain in the states. The service was beyond exceptional. I personally am a hotel snob and I have been fortunate enough to stay at many Four Seasons, St. Regis, properties around the world as well as other properties that have a reputation for service. Your service is exceptional!!!! I am truly thrilled with our stay. Our service around Canada was very hit or miss, however this hotel was incredible. Thank you, thank you for an amazing weekend away!

Reviews.Title: “Fortunately it's substance over style”
Reviews.Author: Liilak
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant four-day stay at this hotel. I must confess at first I was a little sceptical as I am not a big fan of the so-called boutique hotels that have spawned like mushrooms in the recent years All the definitions of the place as "stylish", "trendy" or "cool" just fueled my suspcions. Fortunately, I was quickly proven wrong: granted, the place clearly opts for the "stylish", with male workers clad in pink T-shirts with matching pink and black shoes, but the quality of the rooms are definitely high. Our room had all the facilities in a very modern and, I dare say, beautiful setting, with a huge window overlooking the enviable lofts of Yaletown. The staff was very efficient and corteous, although I must admit I found the female recepcionists to be nicer than their male counterparts, maybe it was just a coincidence or simply my impression. The hotel's location is great for exploring Vancouver on foot, and Yaletown itself is a good place to hang out in the evening, though a bit pretentious for my liking so we usually opted for the adjacent West End. Don't miss the nearby Elbow Room for breakfast, though. The only downside I can think of is that the place can get a bit noisy due to the popular hotel bar, which usually gets pack during the weekeds. However, this is just a minor setback in what was a very pleasant stay at the Opus, and in lovely Vancouver as a whole.

Reviews.Title: “Last stop on our honeymoon was fabulous at Opus”
Reviews.Author: Larrybird033
Reviews.Content: We loved it here! We were greeted by cute and cheery staff upon arrival. Our room was clean, cozy with funky/retro styling and details While settling in we received a complimentary bottle of wine and snacks in honor of our honeymoon. Turn down service included water, ice and a package of Necco wafers on our bed (made all the more charming because we are from Boston). Also loved the L'Occitane amenities. Hotel location is great. We walked through the vibrant neighborhood (given recommendations and directions to various places by staff members) and biked throughout the city. We had hours between checkout and our departure for the airport at 9pm. The reception staff was incredibly warm and helpful, offering a room to rest in prior to the flight or a shower in the fitness center. Can't say enough great things about this place.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: metw0
Reviews.Content: i arrived late and was welcomed warmly. the room was beautiful and well appointed. every employee i came in contact with was professional and extremely helpful. my car was always at the door when i asked and they always offered directions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: tbey
Reviews.Content: This hotel really lives up to all its great reviews. Totally surpassed my expectations. Wish I had stayed longer. And I will certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect start to our trip to British Columbia”
Reviews.Author: Nicols_Altrincham
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in early August with two teenages (14 and 17) after a long haul flight from the UK. Rooms were delightful (trendy, but comfortable as well). Loved the Japense style bathrroms), service was outstandingly helpful and friendly. Enjoyed the chilled out bar areas. Location perfect in the heart of Yalestown.

Reviews.Title: “A special and fun weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: jconan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went into Vancouver for the weekend to celebrate his birthday. We booked the night at the Opus Hotel at the recommendation of our son-in-law. From the moment we got there we had fantastic service. From the valet who parks your car, to the people at the front desk , to the waiter in their restaurant, all were friendly and courteous. I had booked one of their packages with breakfast and late check-out. When we got there we had prompt service from the valet, we then went to check-in, the two young ladies at the front desk were helpful and efficient. When my husband mentioned it was his birthday, after a few minutes of consulting each other, they upgraded us to the Penthouse Suite for the same price as our regular room!!! That made our weekend extra special. The room was outstanding, done in an Art Deco-modern sort of look. Very much to our taste. One of the features I liked the most was the huge jacuzzi tub overlooking Yale town. We had breakfast in their restaurant the next morning, very good food and excellent waiter. The staff always making sure you were good and if you needed any help with directions or needed suggestions on where to go. The hotel is very clean, quiet and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who wants more of a boutique hotel with personnel service. 5 Stars!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Trendy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2Maxima
Reviews.Content: Great location, fabulous staff, super comfortable bed. Only thing that could be improved is the quality of the TV the rest was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Yaletown Gem”
Reviews.Author: aserediuk
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Opus twice now and both experiences have left us more than eager to return. Our last visit marked an anniversary - two years (almost to the day) of our last stay at the Opus. The Opus is in an excellent location in the heart of Yaletown, easily accessed from most major routes and the new Canada Line nearby makes travel around downtown Vancouver even easier. There are plenty of nearby restaurants and shops, with Robson only a short walk or even shorter ride on the Canada Line away. As a boutique hotel the Opus does not disappoint and the extra's (champagne on our check-in and fun candies delivered to our room several time throughout our stay) combined with the various perks, such as discounts to nearby Yaletowen stores made the stay even better. The car service, when available, is an added bonus to make a special outing even better. As with most upscale hotels taking advantage of the extra services is where value can be found. We will be definitely be staying at the Opus again.

Reviews.Title: “Optimally located, luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: LLinNYC
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for our first night in Vancouver because is literally right across the street from the Canada Line which connects to the Airport. It is more convenient to take that line from the airport into the city than anything else. Also, this makes Opus the perfect location for going anywhere else in Vancouver. I also liked this hotel because it is luxurious but young. Our experience certainly lived up to this expectation. They met us at the check-in desk with sparking wine and other non-alcoholic beverages. They took the liberty of vastly upgrading our room. The room was _incredibly_ nice. Opus even gives each room a free latte in the cafe downstairs along with iMacs with free internet service (wireless costs in the rooms). Anyways. these are all the luxurious details. I am just reliving them as I write this. I wish I was back there now. :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vancitytrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Yaletown at the Opus in September and had the most wonderful time every. The room was HUGE with flat screen TV's, new everything and a view of downtown most people dreamed of! I would highly recommended staying at the hotel, enjoy yourself!!

Reviews.Title: “A great small hotel for a romantic get away”
Reviews.Author: Nigel1970
Reviews.Content: everything was fabulous- from the two young men who took our bags and parked the car to the bartender who suggested several places to eat in the area- the room was great, we upgraded to a slightly bigger room with a bigger bath- tub big enough for two- Ordered a few things from room service and the service was fast and very courteous- I really liked the shelf just inside the door to set a room service tray on- it allowed one to have something delivered and still maintain a sense of privacy. Every time we left and needed advice or directions the staff was great and spot-on with their suggestions. Overall, we will probably be back-

Reviews.Title: “We always feel welcomed - and hip!”
Reviews.Author: BZimonja714
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel because it's got everything we need. Great beds and baths, great food, great location in the Yaletown area of Vancouver - and a great staff! We enjoyed having a cocktail in the lobby and meeting other guests!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent,caring service in the Opus hotel, Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: vandorlo
Reviews.Content: Central location opposite the Skytrain station, short walk to the sea wall, boutiques, restaurants. Lovely boutique hotel. Small details like heated floor in the bathroom, free bottled water, turndown service, shoeshine, and complimentary car service to downtown destinations added to the pleasant experience. The service was exceptional. One of the best in Canada. The staff was friendly, helpful, informative, courteous. I highly recommend it. Vandorlo

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: lmirabella
Reviews.Content: It was everything that I had hoped for. The location was fantastic, restraunt and bar was great, the staff was top notch! I have recommended the Opus to 6 of my friends who have had the same great time! Cant wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in trendy Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: maxiek
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel is in a perfect location in Yaletown, easy walking distance to all the best restaurants and local haunts. If you have to go farther than what is within walking distance, the subway or buses are immediately accessible, and the hotel offers a complimentary car service, as well. We were able to use the car service every night we were there to take us to our dinner destinations. What a treat! The rooms are smartly decorated, and although, very uncluttered, offer you all the essential amenities. The staff couldn't be more helpful, friendly, and courteous. I highly recommend staying at the Opus on your next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back there anything!!”
Reviews.Author: ElisabethM28
Reviews.Content: Everything was great!!! I had the BEST service at this hotel!! All the concierge and front desk were so nice and helpful!! The rooms are super clean and very nice + trendy! location great, everything was perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “I wish I could live at the Opus!”
Reviews.Author: Sashalupe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at the Opus 3 times and every time have enjoyed an amazing and comfortable experience. The staff is kind, the rooms are swank, and the beds/pillows are AMAZINGLY cloud-like. Some of the bathrooms have heated tile floors- a very special treat even during warmer months. It is also a short walk away from several wonderful restaurants, not least of which is the spectacular Rodney's Oyster House just around the corner. You can borrow a bike from the hotel, take a nice, leisurely ride through Stanley Park and end the afternoon at Rodney's low-tide happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “If you love the Boutique Experience, don't miss this one”
Reviews.Author: cate1896
Reviews.Content: Just recently I had the priviledge of staying with the Opus Hotel. I have stayed at many boutique hotels in my travels and was looking forward to spending some time in the hip area of Yaletown. From the moment the door was opened for us, attention was paid to every detail from check-in to check-out. The front desk staff were unhurried and seemed to enjoy their job (something you don't see a Hilton) and offered champagne during the process of making sure we had the ideal room for our stay. There are four, I believe, different styles of rooms and the one choosen for us was incredible. The bathroom alone was so pretty and unique to say nothing of the ammenities that came with it. CD's are left for you to enjoy as well as candy on your pillow at turndown. Our bed was a dream in itself and made it difficult to leave in the morning. The Elixir bar and restaurant are terrific but if French food is not your thing there are the most incredible restaurants and bars in the area. I have always loved Vancouver and the Opus Hotel is my new place to hang my hat upon my return. Five Stars all the way!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Already feeling very dated”
Reviews.Author: H_Alst0n
Reviews.Content: I wish I'd trusted my instincts with this one. The location is good (especially for easy airport access from the underground right across the road) and the staff are friendly and attentive, but the place is beginning to feel quite dated and frankly I'd trade my flamingo-pink armchairs in the foyer for the good solid feel of some understated wood any day. If you're design-obsessed this place might still do it for you - if not I'd book yourself into something that tries a little less hard. It's pretty pricey too, but I guess that goes for most of the hotels in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: LATraveler73
Reviews.Content: From the moment I entered the front door the staff was welcoming and gracious. At check in I received a complimentary glass of sparkling wine to help me relax after my flight from Los Angeles. As soon as I got up to my room I received a call asking if my room was to my liking. Needless to say it was. The room was very spacious and my favorite part was the bathroom overlooking Davie Street. If you are headed to Vancouver this is the place to stay...close to everything and you mingle with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, hip hotel with great customer service and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: susiem083
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the OPUS for the last three years and have enjoyed the service and location. Hip bar and good bar menu. Some of the rooms may need a "slight" sprucing up.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: CLaurenMac
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Vancouver for business and had the pleasure of staying at the Opus Hotel. I couldn't have been more pleased. Even though i was traveling on business the hotel was so wonderful and the staff was so helpful that it made it feel like i was on vacation! I arrived on a Sunday almost at midnight and the staff at the front desk were so cheerful and offered me champagne. What a great treat! The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable with new stylish furnishings. I usually hate hotel beds because the duvet covers really creep me out. The ones at the Opus were so clean and wonderful that I had the best sleeps. The soaps and shampoo's in the room were also very high quality. They had turn down service at night and left a tasty candy on your pillow each night! The business centre was also very high tech with 2 large Mac computers. It was also a real treat because they have a airport check-in kiosk where you can print your boarding pass for Air Canda (and other airlines but i can't recall which ones) before you head to the airport. The hotel is in the nicest location. It's right accross the street from a Starbucks and only 1/2 a block away from great bars, restaurants, a blo dry salon etc. I'm heading back to Vancouver with my husband this week and had already booked ourselves in at the Wall Centre. Now i'm sad because it will in no way compare to the Opus! You can't go wrong by staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: trendybusinesstravel
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at OPUS. The staff were exceedingly helpful and the ambiance was great. It was the best turndown service i have ever received at a hotel and looked forward to coming back to my room after my conference ended every day I was there. The fitness room is sparse, but adequate. The hotel has also established relationships with area businesses that are really great to take advantage of.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Man Feels Like a Star in Vancouver at Opus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mccleave
Reviews.Content: What an experience! From check in to check out and everything in between, I couldn't have asked for anything more. Here's some of the highlights: - Service (bell service, front desk, housekeeping, food and beverage) was impeccible. Everyone remembered my name! - Room was amazing with floor to ceiling windows - in the bathroom ;)! - Whimsical turn down amenities like a Pez dispenser. - Complimentary transfer to my meeting in a BMW 7 series. - Happening lounge with great cocktails and fun appetizers. - In the heart of the best entertainment district in Vancouver. Wherever there's an Opus, that's where I'll be staying, Steve

Reviews.Title: “Visiting Vancouver? Stay at Opus!”
Reviews.Author: Rascal_in_Utah
Reviews.Content: I found Vancouver as a destination in general seems to be filled with extremely friendly and outgoing people. There is certainly no shortage of that at the Opus. The hotel has an very Professional Staff (and as an added bonus it appears they hire directly from some ”international modeling school”??? Seriously, the hotel has an extremely high concentration of beautiful people…everyone from the Valets/Bellmen in their Pink Polo’s to the Cocktail Servers in the restaurant)… I found the Hotel to be very Business Travel Friendly while at the same time maintaining its fun personality. This is not just another “box with internet access”. Opus has a superb location and is walking distance to pretty much everything (except Alaska, its farther than it looks on the map). Most of my events were held at the Convention Center which took about 7 mins on the underground (clean, safe and super easy to navigate) located less then 100ft from the front door of the hotel. I have definitely added this to my short list of great hotels for both Business and Pleasure travel and look forward to visiting again soon! - Rascal “Enlighten Rock Star” http://www.opushotel.com/concierge-billy.html

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the "extras"!”
Reviews.Author: Carol1085
Reviews.Content: Lots of choices in Vancouver but The Opus makes me feel like my buisness is valued. Love the extra touches- the great service, chocolates on my pillow, and this last time a gift card to a local upscale clothing store. The restaurant in the hotel is French and friendly - a lovely combination! Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beat Our Already High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: GigCouple
Reviews.Content: We were greeted with champagne and boxed gift card to Holt Renfrew on our arrival. Wow! Opus set the relaxing and fresh tone immediately! The room on the seventh floor might have been on the small side but the colors, decor, linens, and ambiance more than made up for it. A double sink in the bathroom would also be recommended. Where the hotel really shines is the vibe and feeling created in the lobby and lounge that permeates throughout. Service is swift and friendly without being overbearing. The attention to detail also justifies my ratings. The choice of CD's in the room, the coffee service, and the little extras--the paper, the incredible breakfast offered as part of our weekend package, and the unique lighting in the elevators/hallways--break this hotel out from the cookie cutter competition. My wife and I also enjoyed the Yaletown location--perfect for people watching in the adjoining restaurant or strolling about in the morning and again at night. I have never been impressed enough to write a review before despite staying in some of the best hotels around the world--Opus simply outperformed all the others. Very impressive. We are already planning a return.

Reviews.Title: “Funky decor and wonderful atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: deblog
Reviews.Content: We unexpectantly were able to spend on night at the Opus hotel in Vancouver BC. What could have been a disappointement turned into a wonderful evening. The decor was funky and lots of fun. The room was very comfortable and pleasant. It was not your typical hotel room and it really made us feel special. There was even ice in the ice bucket so we didn't have to run around looking for the ice machine. The staff was friendly and very accomodating. We had a great meal at Elixir and drinks at the bar. Throughly enjoyed oure stay and will put Opus on our "to stay" list. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “The ideal Vancouver hotel”
Reviews.Author: painted_10
Reviews.Content: We selected the Opus by chance because of one photo of the exterior which hinted at a different kind of hotel experience. The Opus/Vancouver exceeded our expectations. Most important points were the helpfulness of the staff, the quality of the rooms, and the location. After visiting other parts of the city, we were glad we had chosen a location in Yaletown. Although I would have liked free wifi in the room, which a growing number of hotels now boast, the business center was an effective alternative because I didn't need to spend much time each day on internet activities. The valet parking was efficient, but we would have preferred to come and go as we wanted. We ate at the restaurant once, but found so many outstanding restaurants in the area that we did not the Opus meal offerings competitive in terms of quality, variety, and value.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: federDubai
Reviews.Content: We travelled with 3 adults and 2 children (6 and 3 years). I must say that we picked this hotel after roaming the reviews on Trip Advisor. This was the only top ranked hotel with no bad reviews. They were all right. The customer service was the best I have ever had in North America. However, it was also the best when compared to the Asian locations. Service was impeccable. To put it into perspective, we joked at how many seconds it would take to fulfill one of our requests - eg more tea, sugar, plates, etc. Phenomenal service, location and room decor was great. Our children loved it and we had a great time. Valet parking was superb and the I can do attitude was the best we have seen. Our standards are high and this hotel met all of them. WILL absolutely come back again. -pf

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location in a fantastic city.”
Reviews.Author: tonyerwin
Reviews.Content: Loved the Opus hotel. The modern rooms designs were nice and very trendy. The staff was great and the location is fantastic if you want to see the sights of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Always have a special place in my heart”
Reviews.Author: annabellyeo
Reviews.Content: My (now) husband and I love the Opus. We ended up staying there randomly one night when we were still dating and that's where he proposed to me. We had so much fun and didn't want to date to end so we stayed there all weekend even though we both live in Vancouver. Since then we've had a few birthdays and anniversaries there and we're never disappointed. The service is great, it's central to all the Vancouver hot spots, and you get good value for your room with the price you pay. The room service food menu isn't the greatest (and neither is the food), but they have the funky Elixir bar downstairs. Would totally recommend it to anyone *tip: pay the extra $30 to upgrade from the standard room. The room is much bigger and you get the heated tiles in the bathroom. Room 301 also has a fireplace in the room as well as a private patio/garden area.

Reviews.Title: “I couldn't have asked for more...”
Reviews.Author: scongdon
Reviews.Content: Catching the sky train from the airport, I couldn't believe that the hotel was so close to the Yaletown stop; 22 paces is not an exaggeration. Checking-in was flawless and quick, the staff very courteous. I was greeted with a choice of orange juice, champagne or water. What a great start! The room was light, airy, clean and tidy, again I was greeted with a note and a small gift. All of these small touches really make the difference! During the stay, the staff were nothing but friendly and helpful. Just ask them anything about the hotel or area, they will assist you as best they can. My waiter for my first breakfast presented me with a map complete with handwritten areas of interest completely out of the blue. What more can you ask for!? Oh by the way, the west coast eggs benedict is highly recommended. By the time I went to check out (also flawless and quick) I really didn't want to leave. I'll be back in Vancouver asap and if I need a hotel, this is where I will stay, the location is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable, friendly, & well situated”
Reviews.Author: SFOCDN
Reviews.Content: If you want a stylish boutique hotel with a comfortable residential feel and all the amenities you would expect from a Four Seasons this is the place for you. On top of that the staff there have that naturally friendly attitude you find in Canada. Opus is located in a trendy neighborhood in downtown Vancouver, close to the water, bicycle and jogging paths. And best of all right next to the subway station which gets you to the airport in 20 minutes. Lots of restaurants and bars right all around. Nice gym. And get this they still give turndown. Also they have a complimentary BMW car service for trips downtown. Heated bathroom floors & L'Occitane bathroom products. I booked on their website and got a good rate that included free internet and free local calls.. I really appreciated the size of the hotel. at 100 rooms, you get awesome service and they remember your name.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fabulous and convenient”
Reviews.Author: nimpkish
Reviews.Content: Opus surpassed my expectations - while in Vancouver on business I picked this hotel for its proximity to downtown and also to the commuter train station (which was just across the street). From the moment I arrived I was greeted by friendly staff with outstanding footwear (they wear a special edition of Fluevog shoes - ask them about it, they're snazzy) and was offered a choice of champagne or mineral water or ... I forget what the other choice was because I was delighted to be offered champagne while dealing with the check-in process. The evening turn-down service features fab stuff like Pez or similar fun candy instead of your run-of-the-mill chocolate. The furnishings in the room are super comfortable and good quality, with the interior decorated in bright, funky colours instead of the usual white or beige of many establishments. I was dining out with colleagues so I didn't have the opportunity to try the restaurant or bar but they looked inviting and I would definitely stay here on my next trip to SuperNatural BC. They've spoiled me for other hotels because now I'll always expect champagne upon my arrival.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: bghm
Reviews.Content: first visit to vancouver. we stayed for two nights, left most of our bags while we took an overnight trip, came back for two more nights - got our same room back, completely seamless. great location near shopping, restaurants, water taxi, bike rentals. staff very knowledgeable & helpful. rooms very comfortable and well designed. only caveat - some room colors more soothing than others.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations for our 1st Vancouver trip.”
Reviews.Author: hmgrower
Reviews.Content: 1st impression: great location and extremely helpful and friendly staff. Easy to walk to a number of cafe/bar/dining locations, and a waterfront walk, and the train to airport. Very clean and quiet, comfy room. Highly recommended and would return. Very good breakfast in restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Funky”
Reviews.Author: TofinoConcierge
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I felt completely welcomed and treated like a star!!! This is truly one unique and funky hotel. The rooms and their decor are so great and make for the perfect escape after a crazy day of business in the hot city!!!! I look forward to my return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel - They pay attention to details!”
Reviews.Author: RTC1979
Reviews.Content: This hotel is consistently great. My husband & I often stay here when we have late nights out and the little things they do are what impress us the most. Most recently, I checked in, dropped off my things & headed out for dinner. When I got back, curtains were closed, ice bucket was filled, water was filled, they had put on some light music and there was a lollipop on my bed!! Rooms have a great snack fridge with anything you might need - snacks, liquor, tylenol, even a sleep tshirt if you forgot one :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Vancouver to stay at....”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly3555
Reviews.Content: Love the Opus in Yaletown. It is in a great location! I can walk to all the best shopping and dining spots in Vancouver. At the Opus, I am always treated with exceptional customer service. Everyone at the Opus is always polite and smiling. They will go out of there way to make you feel welcome...I always have the best sleep to, most comfortable beds..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaBenji
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at this hotel. The best feature is its location. It is located in a safe, clean area with plently of restaurants and bars to choose from. There is a great coffee place right next door called Agro Cafe. We are from Melbourne and love our coffee and this met our approval. Also loved the fact that we could take the train from the airport to Yaletown. After our long flight from Melbourne to LA then on to Vancouver, getting out of the train station and seeing The Opus right opposite was fantastic. The room was a good size for a hotel room with a nice, roomy entrance, good size wardrobe and the room was painted a funky red. The bathroom was also stylish. We had a Superior room with 2 double beds. We also loved the free internet with 2 ports in the Business Centre. Staff were friendly enough but certainly not outstanding. We asked questions and they were happy to answer but nothing particularly special. The only disappointment was the lobby bar. From reading some reviews, we expected that this was going to be the place to hang out. We found it incredibly small and lacked atmosphere. In fact, the only time it was busy was when it was booked out for a private function so we had no access to it anyway. All other times, after returning from dinner, there was never anyone there so we just went up to our room. Overall, really glad to have picked this hotel for our 5 night stay. It is stylish and in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff, super friendly, great location!”
Reviews.Author: RonaldMalden_NL_
Reviews.Content: We have been staying in the Opus for 2 nights at the end of a roundtrip in BC. There was a warm welcome with a glass of champagne or a bottle water, valet parking ( CAN 29,- per night) and a porterservice. The hung up our coats in the closet

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service”
Reviews.Author: berebit
Reviews.Content: The front desk was amazing at giving us suggestions and helping us plan our activities while we were there, especially Kelly. Very knowledgeable and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, large clean room”
Reviews.Author: Rolanne
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights at the Opus Hotel with a friend and our two teenage daughters. The hotel is located within walking distance to shopping, great restaurants and the water taxi’s. More importantly we felt safe walking around at night. The staff is outstanding. They were friendly, cheerful and very helpful. Very nice hotel and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy small design hotel”
Reviews.Author: gurujay
Reviews.Content: Friendly helpful staff made our stays a delight. They remembered us on our return and had put some of the things we had left behind back in the room. I recommend this place but it isn't cheap- nor should it be.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've stayed in for years”
Reviews.Author: suzannepanter
Reviews.Content: After being on the road for three weeks in North America and staying in some quite frankly horrendous hotels, the Opus was an amazing surprise. The staff there were wonderful, so helpful and friendly, the rooms are very comfortable, the restaurant good, the bar popular but not overcrowded. It really is the staff that made the stay so great. I would highly reccomend this hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver, I would never stay anywhere else now!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vancouver Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: slw123
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in Vancouver. Great location, very clean, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: dubyfl
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel in Vancouver is the best part of my weekly business trips to Vancouver. After long days at the film studio there is nothing like coming home to this well-appointed, friendly oasis in Yaletown. Attentive, friendly staff, fabulous restaurant and bar and a great location make this my favorite Vancouver home-away-from-home. I highly recommend the Opus, Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “You want a great hotel experience... your go to Opus Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MontrealBoys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Opus Vancouver for a business trip in May. Overall hotel experience was exactly what I was expecting with this tip of hotel: friendly staff, great location, great ameneties and foremost room cleanliness. If you go to Vancouver... may the Opus your destination. Finally, for anyone LGBT reading my comment; I understand the hotel is gay owned.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays I have had in years”
Reviews.Author: JCRuth5577
Reviews.Content: Opus is the perfect stay for business or leisure. The hospitality was incredible, and the decor and atmosphere was both comfortable and elegant. I will definitely stay at Opus every time I visit Vancouver, and will now most likely do the same in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a Smile”
Reviews.Author: pjeffrey4
Reviews.Content: My 3 night stay in Vancouver was outstanding due in large part to the service and hospitality of the Opus Hotel staff who were tend to my every need. Next time I travel to Vancouver I plan on staying here with its convenient location and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “So cool it made our family feel cool by extension”
Reviews.Author: SaraJ91
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus with our toddler boys in June and had a great experience. The location, right across the street from the Skytrain, was perfect. The room was comfortable and colorful, and the little touches--cd-s, dvd player, coffee maker--were all very nice. Although the Opus is perfect for hip solo and couples travelers, it was very family friendly and the staff couldn't have been more welcoming! I wish I had a picture of my boys rocking out to the dance music in the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean with attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: diane10981
Reviews.Content: You can't help but be impressed by this hotel, from the moment you walk through the door you are made to feel welcome. Their attention to detail is brilliant and the room has everything you need and more. Every evening when I return the room it is cleaned to a high standard and the location is great, virtually opposite a Skytrain stop on the Canada Line which goes from the airport to the waterfront, ideal.

Reviews.Title: “truly the best staff of any hotel i've ever stayed in. And i have traveled a ton”
Reviews.Author: debiscookin
Reviews.Content: cant wait to go back. GREAT. The service was amazing, anything i needed they provided. Great restaraunt suggestions, everything was just realy nice. ended up in a squite and had friends in, which was great. thank you

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL CHOICE FOR A STAY IN VANCOUVER! GREAT STAFF, GREAT ROOMS, GREAT EXPERIENCE!”
Reviews.Author: LoudmouthTV
Reviews.Content: The Opus is a very cool, contemporary boutique hotel with great rooms, bathrooms, great luxury amenities all designed to make your stay as comfy, relaxed and unique as possible...with zero attitude! The staff all seem to enjoy working here which creates a really great hotel experience for the guests. The doormen greeted us with big smiles everytime, the front desk staff were happy and very helpful, and gave us great advice of places to go, things to do and ways to get around. My sister & I were in a deluxe King room, which was spacious and had a great bathroom. We were looking for a hotel that would allow us to explore the city and the location was perfect! The area is great for restaurants and bars and the hotel bar and restaurant Elixir has a cool scene in the evenings. The subway station is across the street & links to the airport in one direction, downtown and the water ferry the other direction. A short walk takes you to the waterfront promenade and to small water taxis over to Granville Island & Market. The free bikes provided by the hotel, complete with helmets / locks were a nice bonus, allowing us to explore stanley park. I would highly recommend breakfast at the URABN FARE market, a few mins walk from the hotel down towards the waterfront. Filled with locals and offering great coffee and a taste of life in Vancouver. Compared to our last visit (we stayed at Fairmont packed with tourists) the Opus Hotel experience was warm, intimate, peaceful and allowed us to experience the real Vancouver, not just a place where people hop on a cruise ship! We will definitely stay here again and I recc to couples, friends and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great location, great staff...... just a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Twinksgxhc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of our road trip the hotel made us feel very welcomed when we arrived. The hotel is just on the edge of Yale Town - which has a large number of great restaurants, bars etc and also the rest of downtown is in easy walking distance or make use of the free hotel car that will drop you anywhere downtown. The hotel is right opposite the train link and takes 22mins from the airport and is very efficient (and cheap!) The hotel also has bikes it lends it guests - and the cycle path round the coast to Stanley park is 200 yards down the hotel from the hotel, Vancouver has one of the best city cycle systems I have seen. The business and fitness centre were also great as was the cocktails we had in the bar one evening. If you are looking for a great hotel, in a great location that has a boutique style and feel to it (nice touches in the room such as iced water and sweets on the turned down bed) then your money would be well be spent here!! Staying in Vancouver - then stay at the Opus! just a shame there are not more of them worldwide.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous~!”
Reviews.Author: GV1963
Reviews.Content: The doormen looked hip, the registration desk staff were so friendly and accomodating, the decor was fabulous, the room oh so comfortable and the amenities were boutiful~!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Scott93
Reviews.Content: Great location in Yaletown, Excellent service, Great contemporary rooms. If the price is in your budget this is a fantastic boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond!”
Reviews.Author: love2travelcanada01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a one night stay in Vancouver, our first time to the city. Our stay was complimentary with a voucher and included breakfast in the morning and the use of bicycles. From the moment we walked in we were treated wonderfully. Two young women and a man were at the front desk and were cheerful and very helpful! Our room was modern and cozy, with a big soaker tub. Perfect hotel right downtown. We experienced a minor problem on our bike ride with a broken seat and mentioned it when we got back. The woman at the desk was very apologetic and offered a cocktail at the bar for our inconveneince, which we declined. After a half hour there was a knock on our door with a fruit platter, a note of apology and to come to the lounge for a drink. Needless to say-outstanding!! We were looking for no compensation and the staff went above and beyond to ensure our satisfaction. We had a lovely evening at the lounge with a great bartender. The entire experience was perfect. Thank you! We can't wait to come to Vancouver again and stay at Opus!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service anda great room all with a 'special feel'”
Reviews.Author: Ellementum
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Opus hotel in Vancouver and have to say that from the moment I walked through the front doors nothing could have made my experience better! The customer service level was off the charts positive (I also witnessed another guest checking in and they received the same high level of service.) The room was fantastic, and had a very boutique feel to it. From a fireplace to 'rain' style shower, the Opus seriously looks at ALL of the little details and makes their guests feel appreciated. I'm definitely looking forward to staying at the Opus again in the neat future.

Reviews.Title: “Best Under 50, no kids hotel in North America”
Reviews.Author: woods1966016
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel, outstanding staff. Simply nothing short of excellent. Location is fantastic in the heart of Yaletown. Dozens of terrific dining and bar options within a short walk. Younger crowd; be prepared for beautiful people under 30, but that's a good thing. No rave party here; urbane, sophisticated, simply terrific. Staff is 100% on the spot and nothing to say but that. Will RUIN you for other places to stay in Vancouver. We won't even consider another hotel now.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KathrynJenkins
Reviews.Content: The Opus is a swank, fun hotel. The room was very comfortable and the service was supurb. I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Opus Hotel facilities and staff exceeded our expectations in every way.”
Reviews.Author: glenkalmar
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Opus Hotel. The staff were friendly, courteous and helpful. The room was spotless and comfortable. The Elixir Restaurant staff were friendly and efficient and the food was delicious. We will recommend the Opus to our visitors from out of town and we will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vancouver Fix”
Reviews.Author: breadnerd
Reviews.Content: I had another fantastic stay at the Opus in Vancouver. The purpose of my trip was a combination of business and leisure (so to say a big city fix;). The Yaletown location of the Opus is perfect, first of all due to the new RAV line across the street, so easy access to public transit, which will get you straight to and from the airport as well as downtown; second of all the choice of great restaurants and bars in walking distance. I also had a great Martini at Elixir - the bar below. The room itself was quite small, however extremly cosy and posh. I loved the wonderful job the housekeeping department did, leaving a decanter filled with fresh water daily and a creative treat such as chocolate, lollypops or candy. The Service in the lobby was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in an unusual style, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AndreaMexicoCity
Reviews.Content: I went for a week in March, to visit my student daughter. I didn´t want to stay where most of the downtown Vancouver hotels are, in the shopping area between Robson and Georgia. Opus hotel is not only in a nicer, more peaceful area near the sea - Yaletown- , but it is facing the new train station coming from the airport, so it is inexpensive and incredibly easy to get there and depart. I liked that a lot. That train also takes you easily to different parts of town I didn´t know before. The hotel has a strikingly unusual decoration, and though it wouldn´t be of my taste I liked it. The room, while on the small side, its large window facing a nice street, was new, well appointed and fun, as the rest of the hotel, particularly the lobby and bar. Food in general wasn´t cheap but it was attractive, breakfasts quite nice in terms of food and atmosphere. Everybody in the staff was very helpful and charming. I didn´t like to pay for the internet, but they said that´s how it is (though in the Holiday Inn it is free!).
