It is a hotel to come back to: boutique sized, cozy, reliable and upscale in its style and location. Busy, trendy and noisy bar on weekend evenings! But why not? Noise didn´t reach the room anyway.

Reviews.Title: “What a boutique hotel should be like”
Reviews.Author: evilittlesquirrel
Reviews.Content: Excellent small boutique hotel in central Vancouver. Well designed and well appointed rooms, very helpful staff, great location.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Boutique Hotel in North America”
Reviews.Author: Brianrg
Reviews.Content: Staff, rooms, atmosphere and prices all 10 out of 10! Attention to detail is outstanding. Lots of up grades have been offered when you stay regularly...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, friendly staff, first-rate service”
Reviews.Author: Janine2010
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a room at the Opus so we could spend a few days in the city after a weekend in Whistler. Not only is the location perfect (right by the water, loads of good restaurants and a Canada Line train stop), but the hotel itself is a chic and unpretentious place to call your home away from home. The staff were exceptionally attentive and kind, and the food and drinks were top notch (we had both breakfast and cocktails/tapas at Elixir). The room was functional and laid out in such a way that it felt like we had our own little apartment in Yaletown, and we had zero noise issues despite the fact that our window faced Davie Street and we were only three floors up. We felt comfortable and well taken care of during our entire stay, and there's no doubt I'll be booking a room there the next time I'm in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: MiniGS
Reviews.Content: My daugher and I had a wonderful time at the Opus Hotel in Vancouver. We experienced exceptional, curtious and knowledgeable service. The location is great in that the Canada Line train is across the street and you can take the train from the airport directly to the hotel. The restaurants in the area are wonderful, it is difficult to select where to eat. Starbucks across the street is a bonus as well. Would definitely recommend this hotel. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Opus Hotel makes business travel feel more like a vacation getaway!”
Reviews.Author: jcapp
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel design, staff and amenities make for a truly unique hotel experience. The staff is always friendly and can tailor your experience to meet your needs. The daily candy/treat drop-off is always something to look forward to when the business day in complete. When night falls the Yaletown location is perfect. Great lounge and restaurant on site, along various other bars and restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: jrvrad
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Opus twice in one month while I was on business in Vancouver. Based on a friends recommendation, these were our first visits to the Opus hotel as we usually stay at the Fairmont and Four Seasons chain. The Opus Hotel exceeded our expectations in every way! The hotel exudes funky/hip elegance and luxury not seen at any hotel we have stayed at in Western Canada. All of the staff that we dealt with were extremely friendly and helpful and were not pretentious in anyway. The hotel is in the heart of Yaletown with great shopping and a number of great restaurants near by. The hotel is a 2 block walk to the Vancouver marina/waterfront and is a short walk to GM place and BC place. There Yaletown skytrain station is right across the street from the hotel with easy access to YVR and the rest of Vancouver. The rooms at the Opus were stylish and comfortable with iPod docks, LCD/Plasma TV's. The beds were very comfortable and the bathrooms were amazing, almost Spa like. We made use of the fitness and business center at the Opus. The business center is outfitted with Herman Miller chairs and big screen Mac computers. There is also a direct link for printing boarding passes for many of the major airlines. The food at the Opus Hotels Elixir restaurant was fantastic. They have a great wine list and the service was second to none. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we were treated very well and they have great amenties”
Reviews.Author: natalieportmoody
Reviews.Content: We were given a gift certificate to stay at this hotel for one night. You would assume we would might not be treated as well as a paying guest, but that was not the case. The service was excellent and we really enjoyed all the amenities, such as the business room which is stocked with everything you need, including free internet and a airport reservation kiosk. The fitness room was very nice and we loved the little extras that the room offered, such as robes, starbucks coffee, real cream, beautiful bathtub and shower. We checked the prices for this hotel and were amazed that the prices were not as expensive as we predicted. Another plus to staying at this hotel is it's location. You can pretty much walk to to all the great restarurants and pubs etc.

Reviews.Title: “Service - service - service ! !”
Reviews.Author: Byron1932
Reviews.Content: From the valet at the front through the receptionist at check-in to housekeeping who efficiently changed the duvet for a blanket (at our request) it was an excellent experience. The area is almost like a small village and the sky train terminal just across the street makes the entire Vancouver easilly accessible. The leisurely diner was done with grace yet panache - they knew that they were good.

Reviews.Title: “The Opus Hotel oozes trendiness”
Reviews.Author: rich_ch17
Reviews.Content: Great service, great location - within short walking distance of a huge number of restaurants, sea taxi, and much of downtown (e.g. Robson St.) is within a 15 minute walk. From the moment I stepped in this hotel I was overwhelmed with its chicness, from the bar in the lobby populated by trendy young people to the stylish hotel rooms. The service (check-in desk, valet, restaurant wait staff) was excellent throughout. The hotel room was a bit on the loud side (but nothing that kept us up) during the night, but that's to be expected from the location. The hotel room was good, but nothing special, and the hotel doesn't offer that much in the way of amenities. If you're interested however in atmosphere and location, this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: OlympicPartner
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure and privilege of staying at the Opus for nearly three weeks, during which time the staff went above and beyond the regular call of duty, ensuring that the entire experience was spectacular. The rooms are great, the food excellent, the location convenient; the staff are extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Upscale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DenverOriole
Reviews.Content: Great location, great hotel, great staff! Really wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent boutique hotel. Well located, great rooms, very helpful and cheerful staff”
Reviews.Author: AOD3
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions. The hotel is well located and the staff are helpful and friendly. The rooms are well equipped and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Cameron-Lola
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the regular rooms that face the street when prepping for our wedding, and spent our first night in the penthouse...I wouldn't say the penthouse was worth the extra $$$,, the regular rooms would have worked just perfectly. Good lounge and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool yet Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Broodly
Reviews.Content: Quick two day business trip - love the hotel and the location - literally 50 steps off the new tram to airport - staff are excellent - I made one very minor comment about something in hindsight that is seems petty but the staff responded immediately. I will hit VCR again in approx. 2 weeks and this is my new home.

Reviews.Title: “sweet little hotel in the best area of town”
Reviews.Author: sum0san
Reviews.Content: service and staff were excellent. hotel is located in the best area of downtown with plenty of pubs, restaurants, and shops to appease any appetite. also right on the new olympic line so easy access to airport, casino, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - love the Opus, will definitely return - great staff, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: IndyTravel10
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love the Opus - there for a business meeting in Jan. 2010, and will definitely go back. I travel all the time and have been to lots of business meetings in Vancouver and have stayed at lots of hotels there. The Opus is on top of my list now (just ahead of the Wedgewood). Here's why: 1) Location - love Yaletown, v. convenient for downtown Vancouver (wouldn't mind being closer to Stanley Park, but life is all about trade-offs), but really LOVE the fact that it's just across the street from the new Canada Rail line (Yaletown station). Great restaurants nearby, great shops, great spas. 2) Service/staff - everyone is friendly and helpful. I'm a bit concerned they're drugging those folks because, boy, from housekeeping to maintenance to front desk to waitstaff, etc. etc. EVERYONE was helpful and friendly. 3) Really comfortable beds and room. If you travel enough you know - you remember the comfortable beds, and this is one. Turn down service every night - lollipops and PEZ instead of chocolate. Rooms with dock for ipod (and if you'd rather have a different dock, some friendly person will help you with that). 4) Cookies. Just try the cookies in the Elixir or meeting rooms. 5) Great vibe. I'm a fan of the W-style of funky, hip hotels - but, more often than not, that comes at the cost of exceptional service and comfort. But the Opus was cool without being too cool - service like a Ritz Carlton but style like the W. As a business traveler, that's a really, really good combination.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Vancouver. great staff, great Sleep. great time.”
Reviews.Author: silverkins
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Opus Vancouver. i was there on business. Having a warm, friendly greeting at reception with great recommendations for restuarants. They really made my night, after a long day of travel. All my needs and expectations were met. The front desk clerks were supper friendly and extremely helpful. My room was small but extremely cozy. Very modern. I highly recommend the Opus Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: magneson32
Reviews.Content: When i first stepped into the opus hotel, i was like "Wow" this place is elegant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. When i got to my room i was blown away by the modern design it was a breath of fresh air compared to other hotels i have stayed in. I would recommend this place to anyone traveling to Vancouver who loves to hit the night life or is just looking for a beautiful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, awesome location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: RonaldPagan
Reviews.Content: We stayed our anniversary night at the Opus and had a wonderful time. Took their car service for an excellent dinner, returned had a glass of wine, and lounged in the huge soaker tub and took in the great views. The staff was all very friendly and professional and the rooms are aesthetically complete and relaxing. Well worth it as a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Had a fantastic stay, staff were really friendly and helpful and the rooms were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: annieb37
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Opus for 5 nights in Jan 2010 for business. The Staff I have never found staff to be so helpful and friendly! As I stayed 5 days I got to see quite a few reception staff and can honestly say that they were all very friendly and helpful. I took my hair straighteners from the UK to use and although I had an adaptor they didn't work. With a quick call to reception I realised I needed a voltage converter (to go from 220v to 110v) and one member researched online where I could find it locally and how much it cost! Also, came out of my room to see maid hoovering and she quickly stopped and apologised for the 'noise' even though it wasn't noisy at all! My fridge wasn't working so with another quick call down to reception, someone came up within a few minutes to take a look. It was all working by the time I came back later that day. Went to a l local restaurant around 10 mins away by car but instead of booking a taxi for us, one staff member drove us in a very nice BMW!! My colleague and I had to leave 5.45am one morning to catch the coach to Whistler but as the restaurant didn't open until 6.30am, they kindly prepared a wonderful breakfast for us to take away. Coffee, juice, fresh fruit salad, granola with yoghurt and fresh banana nut bread! The Rooms I stayed in a standard room which I absolutely loved. Decor was red and I didn't realise that the rooms had different colour schemes until I looked online today. There was a cd playing when I arrived and some sweets/candy on the bed to welcome me! The heated floor in the bathroom was the icing on the cake! Each night when I returned to my room, the duvet was pulled back and again, music playing on the player. I also loved the L'Occitane tolietries they supplied. The only thing I can think of to make my stay better would be to have softer towels and maybe some slippers to use but apart from that it was great!! All in all a wonderful experience and I even missed The Opus when I flew on to LA! I look forward to staying there again when I'm in back in town.

Reviews.Title: “A trendy treat in Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: canuckaflux
Reviews.Content: This place was a little tricky to find as construction for a new sky train station had blocked off the entrance (which is probably now nothing to worry about). I think that's part of the appeal though as it's subtle and trendy like the Drake in Toronto. I was there just before the Juno Awards so a lot of music industry people were seen coming and going which adds to the chic appeal. The room itself was tiny but beautiful and truly unique. Yaletown is wonderful, trendy, and central to everything in downtown Vancouver. It's the a great Vancouver experience, it's not huge but beautiful - you pay for alot of aesthetics and everything is clean, chic and hypercool.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel with beautiful rooms, polite staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: WPS-76
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus Vancouver for two nights in July -- breaking up a return trip from Alaska to Chicago. We were warmly greeted by the front desk staff -- and shown to our "standard" room. The hotel room was normal in size, nothing huge -- but well decorated. The bathroom was amazing -- big, lots of light, lots of mirrors. The front desk staff was super helpful throughout our stay, suggesting bars and restaurants both in the neighborhood and beyond. The hotel location is perfect - we were able to walk to Stanley Park and we really enjoyed exploring Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but trendy, great ambience, wonderful location, lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: jilldempsey
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite boutique hotels. I've also stayed at OPUS Montreal. OPUS Vancouver is a fantastic mix of decor, location, nice taste, accomodating staff, and overall great feel. I love coming time and time again to stay in a different room - since they all have a unique personality. Kudos to the staff for all the nice touches. One of my favorites was the cd mixes available in the room. Nice picks.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bim1234
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded to a corner suite as I was entertaining some customers to a hockey game and drinks before. The staff are amazing, the location is great and the rooms are beautiful. I travel and stay in Hotels 15 nights a month and this is the top pick for me.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: raelarder1976
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus hotel for 3 nights at the end of Dec. The hotel is in a great location - if you arrive at YVR just hop on the Canada line, get off at Yaletown and cross the street to enter the hotel! The SkyTrain allows easy access to all of Vancouver so it's great to have the station so nearby. The hotel itself is very hip and has friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are a nice size although the window into the shower/bath from the bedroom did cause us much amusement! The business center allows free internet access and printing. If you're looking for a good restaurant nearby try 'rtl' (Regional tasting lounge) on Mainland street - great tapas! Only downside is that Yaletown is busy and the road was a little noisy...

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful start to our holiday”
Reviews.Author: traveller141162
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Opus after a 14.5hr flight from Sydney at 9am in the morning and were welcomed by wonderful staff, we were upgraded and given an early check in which meant that by 10am we were enjoying a long luxurious bath and watching the city life go by. The rooms and staff were excellent i would highly recommend this hotel. Since the opening of the Canada Line you can get from the Airport to Yaletown station in under 15mins, the Opus is just across the road....Its so convienant when you have luggage and don't know your way around the city!

Reviews.Title: “Experience You Can't Get At Chain Hotels”
Reviews.Author: moviebiz
Reviews.Content: I love the Opus. I work in the entertainment industry and most of my colleagues stay at the same (so-called) 5 star hotel. I came upon the Opus when that hotel sold out during one of my many trips to Vancouver. I will never stay anywhere else! The Opus offers a personal touch that other hotels don't offer while having all of the ammenities you'll find anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service with a trendy comfortable atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Molly_Leaf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful with very modern and extremely clean rooms! Hotel staff/service is among the best I've seen ! I've stayed at Pebble Beach and the Ritz Carleton before and the Opus staff was superior to both of these places. I hope the Opus opens more locations across Canada and the US and the industry could use some competition! Great place, great food, great people!!

Reviews.Title: “Genuine, friendly and fun!”
Reviews.Author: Lothar500
Reviews.Content: I've had the pleasure of multiple stays at the Opus, and I can say that the staff have always been great! From the bell service to the front desk, everyone there are always ready to give you a hand, even when you don't ask. The majority of the team have been there for a while, and they're still happy! You know that when someone has been at a job for a long period of time, and still has a (real) smile on their face, it means that not only are they being treated well, but they take great pride in their work. The rooms are fun, with some great, funky design layouts, and the nightly turndown service has that added touch with both a carafe of water and a touch of something sweet left for you on your pillow (such as a chocolate covered marshmallow lollipop). The lounge and restaurant are great, with a solid drink menu, well versed staff, and very tasty food, from the appetizers to the mains. Even on the slow nights, the team there will always take care of you, but also expect the possibility of a little star gazing, as many from the film industry like to stay at the Opus. There's always somewhere to go within walking distance, and the staff will never hesitate to recommend a place to eat (and they can almost always get you a table at the busiest of spots!). Plus, their BMW shuttle service to downtown will add to that special touch that the Opus is renowned for. I have to say, it's the only place that I will stay when I go out to Vancouver. The only downside to the hotel is that there aren't more places like this when I travel elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great service in a great location”
Reviews.Author: lazyninja
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a long weekend for my husband's birthday. They had a special of pay two nights, stay the third free, and it was recommended by some other friends, so we decided to give it a shot. We stayed in a deluxe king room. When we arrived, they quickly came to take our luggage and valet the car, the check-in was prompt and courteous. The hotel itself is very nice and classy. We got up to our room, and they had set out a couple cupcakes on the desk for my husband's birthday! It was a nice gesture. The room is very nice - modern and clean. I liked the bathroom that had a separate shower and tub and nice amenities. The shower was awesome - with the rain shower head, water pressure was great, unlike many other hotels. The room definitely seems to be well maintained. The staff was always a pleasure - very nice and friendly, offering suggestions for dinner, drinks, shopping, giving directions. When we called for anything, they were always prompt. The turndown service was great- always left a little treat of some sort in the room and music playing. The only few things that I would consider a con are: the valet was an additional $26/day, and there was no self-park option (you could go park yourself in the pay lot nearby). At night, even though we were on the 5th floor, we heard a good amount of street noise. The bathroom lighting wasn't that great for makeup application, nor was there a close-up mirror, so I had to awkwardly lean over the sink to see closely. The full-length mirror would have worked, but there was no light above it. So until this changes, bring your own vanity mirror. It would also be nice to have the toilet separate from the rest of the bathroom, but, like other hotels, space is constrained and I can understand it's not really feasible without taking something else away. But none of that would keep me from staying there again. It's in a great location, very close to some awesome restaurants, shopping and the walk up to the park is beautiful. For places not within walking distance, they shuttled us over in their BMWs. Again, everyone was super nice and accommodating to all of our requests. We had a fantastic long weekend, just what we had hoped, and will be coming back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of the city.”
Reviews.Author: mjking33
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The rooms are modern, comfortable and appointed in a way that shows that the staff thinks of the little things. The staff was very courteous, helpful and friendly and helped a first time vistor to Vancouver feel welcomed. In addition, the hotel is right across the street from the subway station and very close to a number of shops and restuarants.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel with Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: mdwsttrvl
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've ever stayed at. From the start I knew it was going to be a good trip. As soon as we pulled up in front of the hotel the valet came out to greet us, and we were shown inside. They staff was super friendly, and check-in only took moments. They emphasized that if we needed anything we should be sure to let them know. When we arrived in the room we they had music playing, and the room smelled very fresh and clean (but not in a chemical kind of way). The room was a little bigger than I expected from the pictures. It was very stylish and modern, and had plenty of nice touches that I enjoyed, such as a shelves in the closet, and they left carafe of fresh water each day. The hotel is located in a great area, we were within walking distance of lots of great shopping and restaurants. I was very impressed at the speed of service, whenever we called for our car it was always waiting for us when we got down to the lobby. Housekeeping was also very good. We usually sleep in and miss housekeeping, and at Opus they just left a card under the door letting us know to call for housekeeping when we were ready, which we did and we always came back to a freshly made up room. The Opus Bar is a great place to hang out. One evening (a Sunday) we were looking for a place to just hang for a while and get some food and drink, so we went down to the lounge area. The waitress was very friendly and fun, she recommended some very good drinks, and we ended up staying for a couple of hours. The waitress was very bubbly, and genuinely seemed like she was happy to be part of our dining experience, and as it was early on a Sunday night they weren't very busy, so we ended up talking with her for a while. They have a great small-plates menu, so we we're able to order several items to share. This was a great experience, and we can't wait to go back. Next time we're in Vancouver I can't see staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: Girl52
Reviews.Content: You walk into Opus Hotel and you feel like you're home. The staff is so kind, they pay attention to small details and they are always so helpful. The location of the hotel in Yaletown is perfect. First, when you arrive from the airport, you can just hop on the Canada Line and you're there in about 30 minutes. There's so much happening in Yaletown - but if you want to step outside of that neighbourhood, it's a short distance away. The rooms are very tasteful, very modern and very comfortable. Bonus, the Elixir Restaurant is so good! I'd go back to try everything on the menu!

Reviews.Title: “seize the opportunity, this is an amazing hotel, with impeccable customer attention”
Reviews.Author: RAndermatt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at 5 star properties around the world, and this is the hotel is head and shoulders above any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But Class”
Reviews.Author: TurbodogToronto
Reviews.Content: A Vancouver friend had recomended staying at the OPUS Hotel. Traditionally I stay with Fairmont hotels on business, but the OPUS Hotel brought a new level of class, sophisication, and comfort. The entire stay was perfect; the rooms are first class and the amenities in the neighbourhood are great.

Reviews.Title: “A definate YES for the Opus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: only4diamonds
Reviews.Content: My business partner and I, together with our spouses stayed at the Opus Hotel in Yaletown this past weekend. From the moment we arrived until we left the next day we were treated to exceptional service in a truly decadant hotel. The location in Yaletown was perfect for our planned night at the Hockey Game and dinner at Cioppinos, and what an awesome place to stay for the night. The room was large and beautifully decorated with top of the line amenities. The staff were friendly without being outrageous and we were lucky to secure the in house car to deliver us to the game. I will highly recommend this hotel to friends and associates, well worth the cost and even better when you take advantage of one of their special deals.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressive”
Reviews.Author: fego
Reviews.Content: Checked in for two nights at the end of August. From the moment we entered the hotel lobby, we were treated as if we were the only guests in the hotel. The hotel is a mid sized boutique establishment, with some nice art decco touches. The rooms are well appointed, of a good size with all modern conveniences one would expect from a hotel of this calibre. One interesting point if not unusual is that the bathroom faces the street with a clear glass window, (don't worry blinds are provided!). The front desk were very helpful in terms of recommending restaurants, providing advice and giving directions. The restaurant and bar was comfortable and efficient, with good food being served. Our stay was during the time AC/DC were in town, so the hotel and surrounding area were extremely busy, this in no way took from our experience at the hotel and service remained at a high standard. On the whole a great experience in a well run establishment, I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb vancouver boutique hotel.......i would love to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: kobie123
Reviews.Content: From arrival to departure, our experience was fantastic..... all the staff were super friendly, helpful and very professional (I think they like their jobs!). Special thanks to Angela Toffolo and Shelley Lyons!! our room was amazing..... those beds were sooo comfortable.... the bathroom was a knockout!! .... (looking out on Davie Street!) The location was within walking distance to the "pickle boats" to Graveille Island and fabulous restaurants....

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at Opus for 4 months, wonderful long term arrangement”
Reviews.Author: Freak77
Reviews.Content: I found the Opus almost perfect. The staff was uniformly friendly, the room was clean and other than some construction noise was very quiet. I travel a lot for my work and have a very short patience for service and cleanliness issues. On some weekend nights the downstairs scene was intense but I always got through to the elevator and my room on the 4th floor was a corner and serene.

Reviews.Title: “friendly”
Reviews.Author: Bertmontreal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is almost above one of Vancouver's new subway stations, on the line which connects directly to the airport, which is very handy. The staff were friendly, greeted guests as they came and went, had good tips and advice. A very friendly, casual tone. The in-room hotel guide is very informative about what's interesting and worth seeing/doing in Vancouver. And I loved the friendly turn-down service at sundown, and especially the kooky gifts which I found each night on my pillow. I'll return there for sure on my trip to the Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning anniversary weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: seancanada
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our anniversary by staying in one of the Executive Suites, and had a thoroughly enjoyable experience at the Opus. The staff were prompt, good-humoured, and the room itself was clean and comfortable. Not one of the less expensive places to stay in Vancouver, but if you can find the means, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: SeichanG
Reviews.Content: The Opus hotel is located in the center of downtown Vancouver. The amenities are great...valet parking, nice bed, complimentary bottled water, etc. The best feature about this hotel though is the Staff! They are all very friendly, helpful, and efficient. I was there just for one night for a business trip and needed restaurant recommendation. The front desk staff was great. She gave suggestions based on our requested price point and location (walking distance) and tell us about the type of cuisine and printed the menus for us. The next morning, she remembered about it and asked how dinner was. I had an hour before going to the airport, so I left my luggage with the front desk and asked them to get me a taxi at 11 AM. I came back to the lobby about 10 minutes prior to 11 AM and the staff, immediately upon seeing me sitting on the lobby, asked if I wanted my taxi earlier, got my luggage out, and got me a taxi pronto! I am just impressed on how friendly the general people are in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “awfully swanky, but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NICOLEandJACOB
Reviews.Content: we spent thanksgiving weekend (2008) in vancouver, bc and stayed 3 nights at the opus hotel. we felt very uncool amongst the super-chic but immensely enjoyed the time we spent relaxing in the room. there is a fireplace for ambiance, a dvd player for our netflix, and a great big bath tub for floating in. i forgot my toothbrush and the front desk clerk gave me one, thanks. the party scene in the lobby/bar/restaurant is very busy but we couldn't hear it from our room. overall a very pleasant stay and we would return to the opus.

Reviews.Title: “Very sweet stay”
Reviews.Author: Drakesmom
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Loved the room. Very nicely decorated made it like an apartment instead of a hotel. The bed was AWESOMELY comfortable. Loved the floor to ceiling windows and found myself making the embarressing mistake of keeping blinds open at inopportune times (like when I went to the washroom) There are apartments at the same levels on sides of the hotel. Make sure you don't become these tenants show for the day. Construction was happening for us on the morning of Sept 26 at approx 7 am which involved jackhammering for an hour straight at least. Was NOT a nice way to wake up on a Saturday morning after taking in the wonderful restaurants and lounges around the area until late into the morning the night before. We were not told about this and was a disappointment. The lounge area very nice, and loved our appys and drink choices. Great selection. The restaurant area turns into a full on bar at night with velvet rope line service and men in suits with the ear radio devices. Great concept for income at a hotel/restaurant. Smart owner!! Had a nice walk in the area the next morning and a wonderful breakfast 2 blocks to the water at the Provence. High end hotel, so prices are high. Be aware of this. Yaletown is tendy, sheek area, so this ain't the Holiday Inn by any means, not by style or price. Enjoy the uniqueness, but be aware you pay for it. Would have liked a roof top pool for this type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great service, excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JJL74
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly, courteous and efficient. Our room was unique, large and had everything that we needed/wanted. The location is close a wide variety of shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Opus”
Reviews.Author: Zamis10
Reviews.Content: I went to the Opus with my fiance on her birthday and was extremely happy with the hotel/room and service that we were provided. I would like to thank all the staff for a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel to hold a meeting.”
Reviews.Author: Glenn99Vancouver
Reviews.Content: I just held a regional meeting (28 people) at Opus Hotel in Vancouver, BC and everything was fabulous. The sales and marketing people, catering people and other hotel staff members were all very professional and anticipated our every need. Additionally, Opus is conveniently located in Yaletown across the street from The Canada Line Yaletown subway station. It takes only 25 minutes from Vancouver International Airport to the Opus on the new transit line. Much faster, more convenient and less expensive than a taxi. Also great shops and restaurants all within a few steps of the Opus Hotel. The Opus Hotel is a great place to stay whether on business or pleasure. Glenn (L'Oreal Canada)

Reviews.Title: “Awful, lying staff”
Reviews.Author: maidenvoyager
Reviews.Content: What kind of people allow a couple on the HONEYMOON to check into a hotel room right alongside road works that begin at 6.30am, but tell the newlyweds that there is minimal work, and nothing starts until 9am and would be finished by 5pm (i.e. theb hours you’re not in your room anyway)? The staff at the Opus are those kind of people. We were staying in Vancouver as part of our honeymoon, and thought that the Opus looked good. There was no mention on its website of any work being carried out, such as a new underground railway station being excavated right outside the hotel. Despite our concerns, they reassured us that it would not disturb us, and placed us in a room right next to the works, on the first floor (they would not give us a room away from the work, and the view of it was like a bomb crater). When the work began at 6.30am, with drills and shouting and banging, I actually cried. Yes, these people were responsible for making me cry on my honeymoon. My husband was so disappointed and blamed himself. We checked out that same day, but had to have a major fight with the staff to get the money back for the rest of our stay. One word for these people; despicable.

Reviews.Title: “terrific staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelinLondon
Reviews.Content: the canada line construction that took place out front of the hotel is now done, yaletown is more entertaining than ever and the opus hotel continues to be the preferred hotel for anyone visiting vancouver wanting a special experience - hip without being painful, great staff rather than seemingly inconvenienced wannabe actor/models...all good.

Reviews.Title: “Even Better the Second Time”
Reviews.Author: MB747
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus a few years ago just after it opened. We enjoyed our first stay although there were some service issues that still needed to be worked out. Service has improved dramatically and is now at a solid international 4 star level. It's still not 5 star (which the hotels claims to be) but the staff is helpful and friendly (and many are also very good looking). Our superior room had all the expected "boutique" amenities: large flat screen tv, ipod docking station, wifi, nice bath products. I've taken one point off of my grade for this hotel because the mattress on our bed was only ok (it was too soft and squeaked a lot). The sheets were terrific. The Yaletown location is great. Lots of interesting shops and restaurants within 5 minutes walk of the hotel. Easy access to anywhere in Vancouver. The hotel is across the street from new subway line that goes to the Airport (Yaletown Station). The subway will get you to/from the airport in 20-25 minutes (faster than a cab). The Opus is an excellent choice for anyone planning to spend a few days in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail in everything. Gorgoues Hotel! Great service! Lots of charm”
Reviews.Author: BcHopskipjump
Reviews.Content: Fast efficient service, incredible classy lounge and rooms. Beds and pillows you sink away into heaven with! Modern decor. This is truly a beautiful stylish boutique hotel. In the heart of trendy Yaletown and Just minutes to walk to the waterfront. Front desk very helpful, professional. Patrick at the front desk was extremely efficient and helpful in checking in and helping out with places to go near by. Highly recommended. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “feels like home”
Reviews.Author: missmiew
Reviews.Content: great staff that are always so helpful great breakfast at elixir comfortable beds

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic style, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: voldenuit
Reviews.Content: Travelling to and from NYC to Vancouver in 36 hours meant I needed an easy, accommodating, and relaxing place to stay. Opus fit the bill. Prepaid option meant a lower room cost, saving the client money. Hotel is small, so the staff and service is attentive and fast: check-in and check-out took less than a couple minutes. Room was large, and bathroom was huge! Accessible and easy to figure out wifi (not free, however), and room was quiet, facing an interior courtyard. Hotel is a great location (Yaletown), within a 2-3 minute walk of a variety of restaurants, many with outdoor terrasses. And, despite the small size of the hotel, it also had a 24/7 fitness room with running machines (among others). All in all, I would return to this hotel anytime for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style and Service”
Reviews.Author: davemito
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business with an extra day tacked-on for pleasure and had a great experience. Location is great in the trendy Yaletown neighborhood. You can walk to most attractions including Stanley park in about 30 mins. The hotel is stylish and comfortable and the staff is extremely friendly and will do whatever they can to assist you. The one things they could change would be adding free wireless internet to the hotel but I did use the business center which was a nice free service with easy printing to print boarding passes or anything else. The best part of my stay was that the hotel has free bikes available which allowed me to explore the highlights of vancouver in the best way possible at a relaxed pace.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Cool spot and Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: janehodge
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Opus was great. We loved our room and the BED! Excellent location for our girls night out - we shopped and dined in Yaletown - which is where you want to be. We had breakfast at Elixir (the french bistro in the hotel) and it was perfect. I will definitely return - perhaps try out the gym next time I go!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Canada Day”
Reviews.Author: Z_R_2012
Reviews.Content: Just got home from a 1 night stay at the Opus for my 2nd time. This is the first time i've left a review. I read a couple of reviews about construction in the neighborhood and i was concerned initially, the first time i stayed there wasn't any going on, quite a few years ago. I called the hotel to check and was advised that work was mostly finished. When we arrived there was no sign of construction however it was late. The next day i could see on the next block that there was some road work going on but certainly nothing that bothered me in any way. It appeared that there was just some new street lights being put up. Big deal! Otherwise we had a great time at the hotel. There was Canada Day festivities including a parade at the waterfront near Canada Place which was awesome. The hotel and staff were great. I stayed in a suite that had 2 beds, 1 was a fold out sofa bed that my daughter slept on. The hotel had a gym, business center, restaurant and room service. I would, and have recommended to my friends. The Opus delivered for me twice now. This hotel is different from other hotels i stayed at. It has it's own personality. The staff are real people that don't talk to you like they are robots or more importantly, like people who are just doing a job. They really seem to enjoy what they are doing. Refreshing actually. Enough said.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet inspite of ongoing roadworks! Well done!”
Reviews.Author: Dublinlass
Reviews.Content: A recent stay at the Opus was very pleasant not least because we were given a complimentary upgrade on arrival. Good hotel with an interesting location and very helpful staff ( even at 6am when one is leaviing to catch an early flight). Very good Thai restaurant across the road where we got a great window table at short notice!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Boutique Hotel worth staying at everytime!!”
Reviews.Author: JPitch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the exact thing to make an incredible vacation even better. The staff was incredibly friendly and went out of there way to be as helpful as possible. From the moment we arrived in the cab, everyone was extremely helpful and friendly and made every effort to make us feel welcome. The room was very modern with the most amazing shower and bathroom I have ever been in. I would book with Opus again everytime I go back to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely stunning, hip, sexy and perfect for a romantic weekend.”
Reviews.Author: escapade_artist
Reviews.Content: Went to Opus for a sexy weekend and couldn't have picked a more perfect place to stay. The suite was very sexy and comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and lovely with what is probably the best shower I've ever experienced (and I stay at a lot of hotels) and the atmosphere throughout the hotel is chic. The cocktails in the hotel bar are fantastic (especially the Asian Pear Martini) and the restaurant, Elixer, is superb. Great downtown location, you can walk everywhere and its close to the water. I can't wait to go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay, nothing to match it.”
Reviews.Author: drvjs
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Opus Hotel whilst visiting my sister in Vancouver. The Opus was in the perfect location, in the heart of Yaletown with an array of lively and buzzing bars and restaurants on the door step. My stay was split into two (with a visit to Whistler in between) so I was lucky enough to experience two different rooms, both fabulously designed but with very distinctive styles - my favourite was the 'blue room' with a glass panel between the luxurious marble bathroom and the bedroom. I could therefore sink into a bubble bath and look through into the main suite and watch my favourite programmes on the flat screen TV. What really made my stay at the Opus so perfect was the warmth and hospitality I received from the staff and the attention to detail / special touches. As well a room clean each morning, when I returned in the evening I found my bed had been turned down, soft music playing (a selection of CDs available in the room), chocolates on my pillow and mineral water on my bedside table. Staff were extremely helpful in printing off maps and noting down bus numbers that would get me around town to visit local attractions. They also provided a bicycle so I could go on a cycle ride by the sea and enjoy the parks. A truly great stay, would thoroughly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “This is a gem of a boutique hotel that combines superb service, sophisticated style and excellent amenities.”
Reviews.Author: jsinger37
Reviews.Content: Whenever I stay in Vancouver, I always stay at the Opus hotel. With an incredibly welcoming atmosphere and staff, I feel right at home even though I am away. I travel on business a lot and it is easy to say that this hotel surpasses the competition in its style and value. Their price is worth the extremely comfortable and spacious rooms, tastefully decorated and conveniently comfortable. The beds are really cozy and are a huge plus to this hotel. I cannot stay in a hotel with an unacceptable bed and this establishment ensures that my ZZZZZZ's are easy to achieve. The bright and spacious bathrooms are equipped with amazing showers (something I value extensively) and are gorgeous. The bathroom even looks over the street, which also provides quiet nights as the bedrooms are insulated. A unique combination of modern and eclectic, this hotel couldn't be more rock and roll, which adds a third dimension to a Vancouver experience. Location is ideal, centrally located in the coolest neighbourhood in the city. It is right near the breathtaking Vancouver harbour. Overall, this hotel is a fantastic choice. Combining value, comfort and lots of cool, I couldn't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “what more could you ask for in the heart of the city?”
Reviews.Author: salmon05
Reviews.Content: The Opus hotel is a superb hotel right in the heart of Yaletown. I enjoyed the close proximity to the seawall and all the restaurants in the area. I would love to stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “Posh, relaxed stay in the heart of Yaletown”
Reviews.Author: catesmarty
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Vancouver about 2 weeks ago to visit my sister and get my urban fix. Thought we'd stay in a hotel for a night to endulge in some luxury even though she lives there. Had always heard good things about the Opus but hadn't stayed there before... I was travelling solo, took a cab from the airport and was at the hotel in about 25 minutes. By the time I paid the cab, the attendant had already taken my bag to the front desk. I was impressed. Checked in at the front desk, was told my sister had already checked in was waiting in the lobby bar. The attendant took my bag up to the room and I met my sister in the lobby bar. Room: Room had a cool vibe, not the usual hotel decor. Modern, lots of dark wood, white, and chrome. Room was small but roomy enough. Had enough closet space to hang clothes. One wall was windows with a small balcony. The bed was very comfortable especially since they didn't have the usual huge cheap pillows which kill my neck. Quality sheets and duvet. Bathroom was modern and roomy, L'Occitane products were another plus. the glass shower with a sheer curtain was cool. If I was there with my husband, it would of totally rocked. You can pull back the curtain and view the person showering from the bed, interesting, maybe not so much with my sis, but not a big deal. Had turn down service before we left for dinner. Had a great sleep and was amazed how quiet it was, especially since it's right downtown (we were on the 7th, top floor). FYI: Room also comes with 2 ipod docking stations, so don't need to bring your ipod speakers. Business Centre: I had to use the business centre during my stay, on Saturday before check-out, since I was doing a distance education course, something was due. Bus. centre is on the 2nd floor, which I liked. Not placed in the lobby in a small room. Card entry was required, room was large, with 2 spacious desks. Room was even equipped with printers. No password was required, so it was very comfortable just like I was at home, which is important I think when you want to deal with your work/school responsibilities and get back to your vacation. Service: We were impressed by the service, it was professional and extremely efficient. We had to call down twice during our stay. Once, we requested more coffee (house brand is starbucks) which was brought up to our room in about 2 seconds it seemed. Second time my sis was wondering if they had morning paper service and was then asked which one she would prefer out of three choices, nice! Best things about the hotel are it doesn't feel like a hotel (small size), decor, service, and location. Area: Lots of cool boutiques, restaurants, and bars in the area all within walking distance of hotel. Sea wall is about 2 blocks away which is also an awesome perk.

Reviews.Title: “All you want of a hotel; class, style and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: MarkNL
Reviews.Content: The unpretentious and friendly approach of staff to their guests makes this hotel stand out from many famed hotels. This combined with an eye for aesthetics, all details done well, great bar and location make this hotel a great place. I fully understand their top rating by Conde Nast. Getting one of the larger rooms is recommended for longer stays, we were in one of the suites with our 5 year old son and that extra space worked well for us all.

Reviews.Title: “well located downtown hotel with quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: okanogandude44
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the " room with a difference", its quality and cleanliness. The staff were very efficent and very friendly from the time of booking until we checked out. The location to the main downtown area of Vancouver was excellent without feeling you were staying in the busy downtown area of a major city.

Reviews.Title: “very chic”
Reviews.Author: jettsgal
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night at the opus hotel recently. Very cool rooms, not big, but big enough. The bathroom was big and the shower was great. Bed was super comfortable. Downside was the curtains don't block out all the light, I like to sleep in a dark room, but the blinds/cutrains here were very light. Also, you can hear everything outside in the hallway and the surrounding room, the walls mist be quite thin, I could here the wheels on someones suitcase as the rolled it past the door the next morning. We had a drink in the bar downstairs which was a cool crowd and a busy place for a Friday night. The front desk staff were friendly and helpful and the location was very much smack in the middle of trendy yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel ever! Artistic and creative!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel2010010
Reviews.Content: Loved the decor. The artistic and creative way the hotel plays with lighting. Energetic, helpful and friendly staff. We loved the waterfall shower. The turn down surface was a treat. Loved all the extras. The fact that the Hotel has so many unique designs and extras made it stand out from all our other stays. Restaurant's a block away. Great walking area. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky and comfy at the same time”
Reviews.Author: Leslie319
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last weekend for our anniversary while we were in town to see Coldplay. We have two little dogs who were very welcome and nicely treated. Our room was very clean, especially the bath, with the exception of the carpet. There were some mystery stains which is always a little gross at a hotel but you seem to find that in a lot of places. We were upgraded to a mini suite type of a situation for only an extra couple of bucks, which was nice. There were huge windows and tons of space. Bed was super comfy and I had a hard time waking up both mornings. My only real complaint about the look of the room was the wall color. The entire huge rooom was painted egg yolk yellow. Not very peaceful, calming or romantic. Rather garish, actually and it was a distraction to the rest of the vibe in the place. Very quiet hotel. We didn't hear our neighbors conversations, tvs or anything. At night they have a DJ spinning in their lounge and it is deafening when you first walk in the front door, but by the time you're riding up in the elevator, it has faded and not even a beat makes it through the walls into the guest room. The staff was very helpful. We never waited for our car, anything you asked for was given with a smile. We were given two great restaurant recommendations- once for dinner at Vij's (which we found out later is the #1 pick on Tripadvisor) which was phenomenal and again for a diner for breakfast which was also very good. Overall, good time and we'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “fab fab fab!”
Reviews.Author: coalharbourgal
Reviews.Content: my sister was visiting for the weekend so we booked a room at the opus in yaletown for a little sis girl time. when we arrived the staff were very friendly. our room was uber clean, spacious, and the l'occitane beauty products and sound system with cds were two pleasant surprises. the mattress was just what i look for at a hotel: firm with just a touch of give. and the decor was just my style: sleek, modern and clean without feeling cold or sterile. the walk-in rain shower was also great! i've read other reviews about this hotel about noise but it was whisper quiet for us all night--and we stayed there on a friday night. the globe and mail delivered to the room on the morning and starbucks coffee were great ends to our stay. a 12 pm checkout is also welcome, as we didn't have to rush. drinks in the lounge were also great after checkin and while i didn't eat at elixir i have before, and the food is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Friendly and Courteous Staff"”
Reviews.Author: amigostravel
Reviews.Content: We love the fact you could forget about your vehicle and stroll through a wonderful mix of residential, retail and scenic areas to great restaurants, shopping, theatre, sports venues and the beach. The BMW chauffeur service is a fun bonus!! On each of our stays we have enjoyed the friendly, courteous and helpful staff from the door man to the evening "turndown" staff.

Reviews.Title: “This small boutique hotel is a gem”
Reviews.Author: spud100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a pleasure to stay at. The service is top notch and very friendly. The room I had (a deluxe studio) was spacious and had a great bathroom with a large soaker tub. Good bed with duvet and comfortable pillows. It's location is close enough to downtown to walk to the main shopping areas. It's an urban hotel surrounded by buildings so it doesn't have a view. It's in the heart of Yaletown only a block or two from some of the best restaurants in the city. I stay in hotels a lot, and this is one of my favourites in Vancouver. I would unhesitatingly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “love the hotel love the people”
Reviews.Author: fredbVancouver
Reviews.Content: it truly is like coming home. the staff know you by name and treat you like family. i always tell people coming to vancouver...stay at the opus, you'll never want to stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Consistantly Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Deepguava
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Opus Vancouver for several years, the last trip was by 30th stay with them. This hotel is consistantly fantastic - the staff are excellent, all of them, from service through to management. These people are professional and always go out of their way to ensure you have a great stay. The rooms are super comfortable yet modern and the hotel itself attracts a great mix of professionals, creatives and vacationers - so there is always interesting conversation in the lounge, lobby or elevator. The restaurant is great, as is the small European-style cafe attached to the hotel. Again, quality is always great and as i said the staff excellent. The gym is also very functional with everything you need to get a great workout in at pretty much at any time of day. The location is stunning - right in Yaletown and two minutes from the sea wall and great restaurants and night life (even multiple yoga studios if you're into that) - you can't go wrong. I'm such a fan of this place I've recommended it to many collegues and friends over the years when they are in Vancouver, and every one of them have nothing but great things to say. One last point - we've had several events at this location utilizing their confernence space and the events have always been a huge success. The catering is very very good, the bar staff really friendly and professional, and the sales team that run the conference centre are really helpful always going out of their way to ensure you and your event guests are taken care of. I seroiusly can't say enough good things about this place. It's the only place to stay in Vancouver. This from a guy who travels a serious amount. Also be sure to check out the Opus property in Montreal - it is also excellent from all accounts. Brian

Reviews.Title: “All The Comforts of Home with "They Treat Me Like A Rock Star" Service!”
Reviews.Author: NYBillyboy
Reviews.Content: I love the location of Opus, smack in the middle of Yaletown with it's great restaurants and shops aplenty!. I'll be the 1st to admit, I have stayed here more than a couple times. But with every visit, I am amazed by the level of service, attention to details, and subtle room improvements that seem to be constant at this jewel of a boutique hotel. All of which keeps me coming back for more. Being a business traveler, I know the difference between being marked as a "frequent visitor" or when the service is truly Genuine. Here it is Genuine. When a waitress YOU don't remember recalls your breakfast favorite, (that is no longer on the menu) and has the chef recreate it for you...THAT'S service! When a front desk person remembers you like cookies and milk before bed, and sends them up, unasked ...THAT'S service. Fantastic turn down service that is more than just a mint on your pillow and a folded comforter. I am just a middle aged business traveler, who wants clean and quiet, and access to fine dining . Here you get that times 10, plus a bit of .....Didn't you once play the drums for Aerosmith? AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Modern, young, hip hotel scene.”
Reviews.Author: bswitte
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived at the Opus, I felt like the staff was there to take care of me and only me. I drove up and there was already someone outside waiting to greet new guests. He offered to help with our bags and start the check in process. The modern style is comforting, clean and very unique. After checking in I went up to my room and found that they had upgraded me to the top floor with and great view, and little terrace to get some fresh air and a King size bed. The bed was extremely comfortable and made for a great place to relax after a long day of walking around. My favorite thing about the Opus is there commitment to pamper their guests, and the friendly staff. And after that long day of walking around Vancouver, you get to come back to your room turned down. With the lights dimmed, music playing softly and a chocolate mint on your pillow and sets you up for either a relaxing sleep, or a romantic evening with your special someone. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our experience at the Opus Hotel. I will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “BEYOND LOUD (DISCO IN LOBBY) & ROOMS WORTHY OF STAYING IN ARE TOO EXPENSIVE.”
Reviews.Author: jk7662
Reviews.Content: I have to say - I was so excited to stay here. It was rated one of the top 500 best hotels in the WORLD. But after staying here – I find that VERY hard to believe. First night we spent walking around and out to dinner. Got back to the hotel around 9pm and soon discovered the pulsating music below. Didn't quite realize how loud it was until we turned off the lights to sleep. Let's just say this - I didn't get to sleep until 4am and was a basket case for the only day I got to spend in Vancouver. We told them - they seemed surprised as if no one has ever mentioned this to them. They moved us to a room on the 6th floor in the back and we got a sound sleep that night (although I still took two Benadryl just in case). You can stay here unbothered if your room is higher than the 4th floor and in the back. We were on the 4th floor initially and you can clearly hear the words to the songs and the conversations on the street. Funny thing: The room service attendant asked if we wanted earplugs - so they obviously know about it! Also - the rooms for less than $500 are not worth staying in. The room they moved us to was a suite which costs $550 but is not huge by any means. We reserved a $250 - which is normally around $300 - and it was like a coffin. So all in all - I guess even though they were kind enough to move us - I give it a "poor" rating. Which sucks because it's the only hotel in Yaletown. Oh well.

Reviews.Title: “UNIQUE AND TRENDY BUT THEY CHARGE YOU BY THE TIMES YOU BREATHE”
Reviews.Author: jorgecortes
Reviews.Content: We were going on a cruise to Alaska and had to stay in Vancouver for a couple of days... I got an excellent deal through Westjet from Mazatlan, Mexico at $76.00 dlls one way with no lay overs. The seats were narrow but who cares for that price! I was so excited when I got this "no brainer" deal throgh Orbitz! it was $111.00 USD per nite plus taxes. I have heard so much about the Opus Hotel that I could not resist and I booked it. As we got here there it reminded me of the W hotels and a couple more in Mexico such as Habita Hotel. This means they are trendy and new. All their staff is young, clean cut and good looking no need to say that they are SO very good at what they do! They are very professional and it is a pleasure to be served by their staff. We were even sucked up a room upgrade for $40.00 CAN for a Courtyard Superior Room and it was nice, not that big in space but nice! It had its own fireplace and a decoration to die for. The only little thing is that EVERYTHING is so overpriced, even higher than Westins, Sheratons, Hyatts and Fairmonts. Room service was good, very good food but pricey. We had the first night we ordered a Ribe Eye and a plate of Scallops and we didn't get even drinking water or a tray of bread and butter... for over $80.00 CAN I think we deserved at least the bread and butter... Next morning we had an Eggo Sandwich and Eggs Benedict... again noto even toast and marmalade... for $50.00 CAN The key for them to make money is that on room service they charge $3.50 CAN plus 15% gratuity and I was not impressed. Their excuse is that the restaurant is separately operated. The valet parking is $26.00 CAN per day!!!!!!!!! Internet is $14.95 CAN per day!!!!!!!! Therefore, my "NO BRAINER" for $222.00 USD for two nights became after everything was charged to my credit card into almost $600.00 USD for my entire stay... So this little boutique hotel is very nice and every dime is worth it! however, be prepared to spend per breathe.

Reviews.Title: “One of my worst nights in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChrisSeattle_wa
Reviews.Content: Booked one Sat night in Vancouver at this hotel. It was one of the worst nights I have had at a hotel. Room was OK, lobby and staff were OK. Valets were great. But we got booked into rm 205. What a nightmare. Techno House music all night long until 330am. We were right above their night club. Ridiculous! I love House Music, dig night clubs, and have been known to see the sun rise - but as a hotel guest, I prefer to have a choice to enjoy these experiences. I dont know how anyone who could ethically book someone into this room. Its not fair to guests to be a night club and a hotel - or at least not fair to those guest staying above the night club. That is just not right. There are plenty of other hotels in the city - I would recommend those. If you have to stay here, stay away from the second floor. What a miserable experience and one I had to pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat Customer - glad to be back”
Reviews.Author: RanleighReview
Reviews.Content: I always stay at Opus when I travel to Vancouver for business. The location in Yaletown is terrific. You can walk to many areas of Downtown Vancouver. While the hotel has been dealing with outside construction for the new sea train for many years now, it has not hindered on their style and service. Elixir restaurant serves an excellent breakfast, rooms are quiet and perfectly clean. Love the bathrooms, beds and all amenities. You will not be disappointed to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky”
Reviews.Author: Guncho
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for work and was very impressed. Modern upscale hotel, not the place for families. Pros - Excellent location in trendy Yaletown, beautiful modern rooms and friendly helpful staff. Cons - Not really a con but make sure you lower the floor to ceiling blind in the bathroom! As I didn't pay for it, I couldn't really say whether it was good value or not.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amayzak
Reviews.Content: I will be staying here every time I visit Vancouver from here on out! Exceedingly friendly staff from valet to the ladies at the front desk, *HOT* decor in the rooms and bar downstairs, and immaculately clean rooms with L'Occitane products in the bathrooms. Davie & Robson St. are a short walk away, Yaletown restaurants and shopping are within blocks, and despite construction on the street below, the room was very quiet. Well worth the money we spent; highly recommended for young, hip travelers.

Reviews.Title: “cozy, intimate & modern boutique hotel - taste of Vancouver lifestyle”
Reviews.Author: mattnamanda
Reviews.Content: I've been to Vancouver many times, mostly to stay with family. But my stay at Opus was for business and I loved the small botique feel this hotel had. Small lobby w/very friendly staff. Little lounge just off the right - a very happenin place in the evenings. The rooms all have different colors with modern decor. Bathrooms have full length windows as your main wall - watch out b/c they are not full tint and neighbouring buildings can see in! (choose what you want to do with that!) But everythign is very modern and bath fully stocked. Rooms come with CD player and CDs based on 'moods'. All the basic (but premium) amenities . They also have turn-down service; they turn on lights, pull down blinds and prep bed for you in the evening (they come in your room if you're out). Its right in Yaletown, the posh shopping district full of fab shops and restaurants. Coffee shops (yes, Starbucks across street), supermarkets, cafes, restaurants and shop all within 5 mins walking distance. The super-quick Sky Trains aren't too close, but public bus transit is close. Outside of Yaletown, the main Granville/Robson shopping district is about 6-8 blocks away (approx 10-15min walk). There was some construction just outside hotel for road next to it and its been there for quite a while (not sure what they're doing), but I wasnt bothered by any noise at all. This was a great place - plan on going back for future business trips.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: Crayak
Reviews.Content: This hotel did exceed all of my expectations. Even though the street just outside the hotel was a complete mess because of construction, the staff made sure this is one of the finest hotels you can stay at. I had a room at one of the top floors, and the quality of the rooms were perfect. Even the view was nice. Complementary bottled water, ear plugs and chocolate. The room even had a coffee maker that you could use as you pleased. The food and breakfast at the restaurant was impeccable. At night the restaurant was turned in to a club that was quite popular and with nice staff. I did not pay for the stay my self, so I do not know much if the rooms were expensive. But there is a $15 for internet for a day, and you have to pay for the breakfast. But the service is rather good, so I would guess that it is completely worth your while. All in all I have to say that if I ever are to visit Vancouver again, than this is the place I am going to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, convenient & luxurious boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: L0nd0ner22
Reviews.Content: The Opus is stylish and swanky and an absolute treat. The decor is gorgeous, and the rooms are fantastic. We were first given a room above the bar, and as it was a Friday night the person who showed us our room was worried about the noise, and secured us an upgrade to a suite. The bed was vast and supremely comfortable, the bathroom delightful with a massive shower and spa bath (and a large window into the bedroom which was a bit quirky) and lovely L'Occitaine products. The mini-bar was amazingly well stocked, but we had a drink in the trendy bar instead so had no need of it. It's very central and I would definitely stay there again, if I could afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Opus = #1”
Reviews.Author: adair7
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for work at UBC and had a fabulous stay at the Opus. Every interaction with the staff was excellent, the service was great, and everybody put 120% into making my stay pleasant. I was there during elections and was willing to stay in Canada and at the Opus for 4 years had the elections gone the other direction! Although there was some construction at street level during my stay, the hours of work did not interfere with my stay or my sleep. The rooms are wonderful with nice natural light. The rooms are quiet and have good temp control that did not dry out the room and did not keep me awake. I traveled about 1/2 the year throughout US and Europe and the Opus stands out as one of the best places I stayed in 2008. I look forward to my next trip to Vancouver so I can be treated with the great accommodations at the Opus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful People & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: esqEsq
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Boutique hotel with excellent staff -- the right combination. No pretentious people; all very nice and helpful. We were delayed in arriving due to bad weather. Property permitted cancellation of room even though we were within the no-cancel-without-penalty period. Very gracious. We would certainly stay here again. Hotel is in fashionable Yaletown -- close to everything, and in particular, near great shopping and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Pokus”
Reviews.Author: ejain
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel for a single overnight stay because of its convenient location, and because we didn't want to stay in a cookie-cutter hotel room. The room we got was nice and modern. The layout was somewhat unusual in that the bathroom is along the outside window (perhaps not a bad idea given that the hotel isn't in the most quiet part of town). The construction that's going on around the hotel made us circle around the block before finding the entrance. Check-in (on a Thursday evening) wasn't so pleasant as we had to shout over the load music from the hotel's bar. Fortunately our room (on the fifth floor) was quiet and we didn't need to use the supplied ear plugs. There were a lot of useful (and some less useful) convenience articles in the room -- some of which are being sold to you at ridiculous prices. Don't appreciate having to pay for Internet access (and parking and breakfast) either. On the other hand the soap was free... I was surprised to find an iPod/iPhone dock/alarm clock which came in handy. The staff was very friendly, no complaints there.

Reviews.Title: “exellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicknesta
Reviews.Content: i have stayed at the opus several times. It is a fantastic hotel and I would recommend to a anyone looking for a boutique hotel in Vancouver. The rooms are great and the bathroom is fabulous expecially the shower. The location is great. i Would highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “noise, rude staff, poor design, no real windows!”
Reviews.Author: aliceinnyland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were booked into this hotel by a travel agent as part of business trip. We were meant to spend two nights, but only lasted one. After reading about the Canada Line construction, I emailed the hotel to ask (nicely) for a very quiet room. I got no response; when we checked in, late and exhausted from traveling, and I once again asked for a quiet room, the desk clerk was really rude. The room he assigned us was next to the elevator, painted dark blue, and long and narrow. The bathroom was at the end opposite the door, separated from the room by opaque sliding glass doors. The only window was at the end of the bathroom--behind the sink and the mirror. If the blind was open, all bathroom activities would be open to the street and the offices across the way. Otherwise: no natural light. The space was creepy and depressing, even with all the lamps on, by day and by night. The bed was barely a double and without the most basic support (it had no box spring--seemed to be a trundle). The furniture was modern, but it was already worn-looking. To plug in the laptop, we had to crawl under the desk. There was a huge gap under the door that let light in all night--not to mention noise. The Canada Line dig is RIGHT beside the front door to the hotel, and below the windows. This wasn't a huge problem for us, since we were up early for work commitments anyway, but we left as the construction started up, and I can assure you that (contrary to the desk clerk's assurances) the noise is loud, and not just limited to trucks moving in and out. Access is also complicated, since Davie St is shut off directly below the hotel. There seemed to be no Oroom service except breakfast delivery. The foodservice seemed to be limited to the scary-looking, neon-ridden bar/restaurant on the first floor. When we came back at 11:45 am, our room had not yet been cleaned. The only good thing I can say about the opus is that the shower was great. That's not a good enough reason to spend your money there, in my opinion. We travel a great deal, and we are big fans of modern design and clean lines. But we ran screaming to another hotel after that first night--and happily paid a penalty for the privilege of getting the hell out of the pus. Our new hotel, i will note, came equipped with windows.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: leeloovancouver
Reviews.Content: From the moment valet took our car keys to when we got them back from valet, must say it was the best hotel experience I've ever had. The staff's level of excellence was bar none. The moment we entered the suite, felt very comfortable and like we'd arrived to a friends home. When we returned late afternoon after some shopping, we pondered how to get our bottle of champagne chilled. There, on the bar was an ice bucket - freshly filled with ice: impressive! The complimentary car service was hugely appreciated as was the preferential entry in to the super busy lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Disco”
Reviews.Author: foodshoestravel
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Opus. Firstly, because of street construction there was a delay with the valet. When we checked in one staff greeted us then when we had a request the staff asked a superior staff for assistance and that staff member was on the telephone and kept us waiting. Not very professional and very aloof. We dropped our bags in our room, unpacked and left to enjoy the city. We arrived back to our room at 11:30 pm and got ready for bed. We watched a little television and when we turned out the light at midnight - DISCO time! Because our room was on the second floor and facing the front street we were directly over the bar. I listened to the music playing loudly for about 15-30 minutes when I couldn't tolerate the noise any longer. I called down to reception and asked when the music would stop and they told me 3am! I was stunned. I asked why were not informed about the noise factor when we checked in. I told this person that I could hear Michael Jackson's lyrics clearly through the window and still this person offered no help. A few minutes lated our phone rang and it was the night manager . He said he came up to the second floor and could also hear the music. He offered us to be moved to an upper floor. I said, seriously, "you want us to get up after midnight, repack and move now!!! We did not move, and said we would resolve this tomorrow. The music stopped at 3:15AM. In the morning under our door was a card with apologisies and a voucher for breakfast. I spoke to the day manager and expressed my disappointment with the night staff and also the fact that the hotel does not inform their clients of the bar/disco directly above the second floor. She said the bar/disco is very popular. I asked if the Opus wanted to be classified as a Hotel or a Bar? I said that this matter was unacceptable and she offered her apologisies. BIG DEAL! The comfy bed did not make up for any of the discomforts we experienced and I have told everybody I know NOT to stay at the Opus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: atorontotraveller
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly for business, and have stayed at numerous hotels. The Opus has become my gold standard for a hotel stay. I was there for two weeks, and the service was consistently, without any exceptions, fantastic. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable, and greeted me by name each day. The character of the hotel is lively and a nice departure from chain hotels. The location is fantastic! The Opus wasn't cheap, but the experience was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect evening”
Reviews.Author: mcartis
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Opus on the night of our wedding and couldn't have been happier. They checked us in early so that my wife and her bridesmaids could spend the day there preparing. We arrived back after the wedding reception to a plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne to cap off the perfect evening. The staff were very helpful and professional. We fully recommend this hotel to anyone looking to travel to Vancouver. The location is great and the room was very nice. Thanks a lot.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: barlow8
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel in every way ,extremely helpful staff friendly employees making it a very enjoyable stay An hotel which I shall return to Probably the best hotel in Vancouver,It deserves its enviable reputation PS it serves wonderful food It is a much overused word but it has the WOW factor

Reviews.Title: “fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travelman245b
Reviews.Content: i love this hotel, I have never seen a rooms with this style and love for details. It was great. Service was excellent. The Gymnastic room was crowded with machines and with no charme, and for the price I have payed, I would expect an breakfast included, but i can really recommend it. perfect for singles, couples...

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for the experience and the NOISE!”
Reviews.Author: WestKen
