Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus for one night, and for anyone looking to book in the coming months (or year) I would double check that the massive construction project taking place directly on the doorstep has completed (they're building a tramline to connect the airport with downtown, and this will run right outside of Opus). Although assured that no one who stayed in our room had ever complained of the noise (we were on the 7th floor), we were woken up at 7am by jackhammers that sounded as if they were in the same room. Breakfast in bed was late and cold, which just made our moods that morning worse! For over 400 CAD per night, I think it's overpriced...the amenities (Frette bathrobes, CDs in the room, ipod dock) don't make up for the small room and noise. The staff were, in general, nice and helpful though. We won't be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: keke22
Reviews.Content: We were any hotel's worst nightmare on arrival. The first room we got had a bath - not good for my husband so we asked for a different room. We returned to the second room after lunch to declare the bed too small and finally ended up in a 3rd room with separate shower and bath. Through all of this the staff were unfailingly courteous and we ended up in a really good room at minimal extra charge. As for the location! Well, we loved Yaletown. The restaurants were great, the ferry was within walking distance and there were lots of great little boutique shops all around. The work on the new railway link nearby is ugly but not intrusive. The hotel was a good base for sight seeing and my husband used the hotel's free car service to get him to a business meeting in double quick time. Too cool for school.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgettable experience”
Reviews.Author: Talbott
Reviews.Content: Incredible experience Staff was very well informed and extremely helpful Best location for best restaurants and shopping Ammenities were just about anything you could want I want to go back just to stay at theOpus Great food and bar

Reviews.Title: “Trying to walk the fine line between cool and pretentious”
Reviews.Author: LtDan
Reviews.Content: I'm torn. On one hand I liked the Opus for its convenient location, comfortable room and friendly staff. On the other hand, I could barely stand the pretention and wannabe-hipster vibe. I appreciate interesting design, and I'm all for a hotel trying to fit its neighbourhood, but...elevators bathed in red and blue floodlights? C'mon. I've stayed in plenty of hotels, like the Gault in Montreal or Le Germain in Toronto that ARE cool, without resorting to parlour tricks like that. I appreciated the function, comfort and design touches (like the Aeron desk chairs and raindrop showerheads) of the hotel but I found it hard not to snicker at all the awkward attempts to be funky. Two issues I had: 1) if you stay on the 2nd, or even 3rd floor, expect street noise. We live in downtown Toronto and are used to it, but on Saturday night at 2AM there were literally people outside our window having screaming contests. Ask for a high floor. 2) Charging $14.95/day for an internet connection is ridiculous. For a hotel that claims to be cutting edge, that's some pretty 2002 thinking. If you stay here and you need to check your email or do a web check-in, just go down to the business centre on the 2nd floor. It's free. I would happily recommend the Yaletown neighbourhood to someone visiting Vancouver, but I don't know if I'd recommend this hotel to most people. I like boutique hotels, and recommend them often, but this isn't one. Nearby: Yaletown's a great neighbourhood to stroll around. You can borrow bikes from the hotel, or rent them at the bottom of Davie Street, and bike along the waterfront...or walk, or rollerblade. It's easy to get to the other side of downtown as well, with all that entails, or to get to Stanley Park & the seawall, etc., etc. Restaurants: the restaurant in the hotel seemed ok (we only had breakfast there) but the hotel bar itself was trying desperately hard to be trendy. If sitting on bean bag chairs and drinking cocktails bathed in purple light is your thing, then this is the bar for you. If not, there's a great brewpub around the corner on Mainland, or lots of nearby places in between those extremes. Same goes for food...you can easily walk to anything from a sports bar to thai to italian to a Rob Feenie restaurant, or take a cab to everything else. Vancouver's limitless when it comes to good food. Also, Yaletown has just as many coffee shops as other Vancouver neighbourhoods (if not more) and there's a great grocery store near the foot of Davie Street.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: journeys4me
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just lovely. We liked absolutely everything. Room was bueatiful, modern, cosy, well equiped (plasma tv, ihome, mini bar very well stocked with a vairety of drinks and snacks, l'occitane toileteries). Stuff was very friendly, nice, helpfull. There's free internet , free bikes, lovely lounge/bar area and the location is great for exploring the city. After a whole day of hopping around the city, we coulnd't wait to get back to the room :) we really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Other than the yellow, we loved it.”
Reviews.Author: WhistlerManchester
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this hotel except the yellow paint colour in our room. Other than that the room was very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious. We were upgraded to make sure we we were in a quiet room as we requested when we booked. There were real rock stars eating breakfast at the same time as us. The shopping and restaurants right outside the door are great. The gym is bijoux but clean and has a good outlook onto a corner where you can watch all the groovy locals go by. Most importantly the staff were friendly and helpful in everyway possible.

Reviews.Title: “You will 'not' wish you had stayed on Robson!!!”
Reviews.Author: torracym
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Hotwire. When you book through Hotwire the way I did, you don't know the name of the hotel until AFTER you've paid for it!!! But I was willing to run that risk, because I could just not make my mind up with what hotel to pick downtown! I was concerned with some of the reviews/remarks that I read about the construction going on on Davie Street where the hotel is located, but, believe me, I am a light sleeper, and it was fine! I had a room that faced the street perpendicular to Davie. DON'T stay at a Holiday Inn, Westin, etc. Stay here-you can stay at a Holiday Inn, etc anytime!!! I was a flight attendant for 6 years, and am more than qualified to recommend hotels-trust me, you will not be disappointed! Nice L'Occitane (sp.?) toiletries, heated floor in the bathrooms!, free bottled water (2 a day!), free use of internet computer in the business center, no ice per se, but they provide you with a full bucket of ice as part of their turn-down service! A lot of nice little touches that make a difference, and that you wouldn't see too many other places! And the bus/public transportation is very easy-correct change only when you get on the buses, but your bus ticket has an expiration time, so it's good until that time. And if you miss a bus, they're quite frequent-usually every 15 min. or so, so even though the Opus is not on Robson, don't be discouraged about public transport-between customer service at Translink, and the staff at Opus, it's quite easy to get around!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: c-dizzle
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Opus Hotel for 4 nights recently. We got upgraded from a standard Queen room to a King room which was nice. The room was spacious, loved the decor, bed was comfortable, pillows could have been better. They change the sheets every day unless you place a card on the bed to notify that the sheets don't need to be changed. Bathroom was awesome, loved the shower and the L'Occitane toiletries. Complimentary water every day was great. We were only on the second floor of the hotel and the construction of the Canada Line was right out front, however we didn't really notice the noise too much and didn't need the earplugs! However on our last night which was a Thursday night there was a DJ in the bar area downstairs and this did keep me awake until after 2am, so if you are staying over a weekend I would suggest a higher room in the hotel to avoid the loud base music thumping. The service we received was fantastic. We utilised the complimentary hotel bicycles for a lovely morning cycle around the seawall and Stanley Park. I would recommend this. It was very easy to get from the hotel to the cycle path. The location of the hotel is great. Loved Yaletown and the boutique shops and so many restaurant choices all within a few minutes walk. We didn't pay for the internet in our room but just chose to use the internet in the Business Center which was free, if we needed to check anything online. Used the gym as well which was adequate for our needs. Fresh apples here as well, very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service at the Opus!”
Reviews.Author: carrie416
Reviews.Content: I went to stay one night at the Opus hotel while waiting for the rest of our travel party to arrive in the city. We were forewarned about the construction occurring beside the hotel for the Olympics, and had requested a room on the side of the hotel away from the noise. Not only did the hotel do a great job accommodating this request - they upgraded my Standard Room reservation to a Business Executive Suite at no extra charge!! Needless to say, my travel partner and I were ecstatic! We also highly enjoyed the secure elevators (which will only access floors using your keypass). Great safety measure in a metropolitan city. Around 20 minutes after checking in to our suite an settling down, the wonderful Meaghan from the front desk was kind enough to provide us with a courtesy call to ensure that all our needs were met. 10 minutes afterwards, the friendliest staff member came to our door to deliver water, ice, earplugs, and offer turndown service. I have never met nicer people in the hospitality industry who genuinely seem to love their jobs. Well done! The suite itself was high high high above expectations, in terms of finish, decor, and just general quality of furniture. Everything was squeaky clean and very orderly. The design element was consistent throughout, and impressed me (a frequent traveler) very much. The bathrooms were stunning and the stand-up shower was definitely my favourite part of the room (aside from the most comfortable bed in the world). A word of advice to those who are picky with pillows - the Opus has fairly high pillows which can be an issue if you are used to lower ones at home. But the beds themselves are awesome! The lobby itself was also very well decorated - the only issue is that the concierge desk is right next to the open bar concept. When there is a reception there (as there was when we arrived), it can be very loud and hard to check in and hear what the concierge is trying to say. We checked out at noon the next day, and sorely missed the hotel and all its beautiful amenities for the rest of our trip. Thank you to the wonderful staff at the Opus for starting off our trip on a most positive note!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended stay”
Reviews.Author: califtrav
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we escaped from a B&B in town. Great hotel, new, upscale and modern. The rooms are small, we ended up going into a larger room due to this. The lounge is fun and the area is great. The have all amenities I like in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of Loud!”
Reviews.Author: Revival160
Reviews.Content: Really liked the Opus, aside from all the construction that it seems to be situated right in the middle of. Hotel is nice - rooms are very comfortable. Aside from the construction noise which starts around 6:30 AM, the only other downside for me was their early 90's Internet policy. $18 per day for Internet service in your room! If you are a boutique hotel specializing in service, Internet should be included in the cost of your room. It's 2008 people. The lobby bar is great for music, drinks and atmosphere almost any night of the week. And hotel guests get access even if there is a line up outside. Locating right in the heart of Yaletown is ideal too - lots of bars, restaurants and shopping within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Rough Around the Edges”
Reviews.Author: RainySeason
Reviews.Content: We chose the Opus for a long weekend vacation because we prefer a modern decor and found the tripadvisor reviews encouraging. Overall we found the experience to be OK. Pros: Modern room design Pretty bathroom Turndown service with water and chocolates Yaletown location-- shops, restaurants, grocery nearby Mostly prompt pleasant service Comfortable bed and bedding Free internet access in business center Cons: Worn and stained carpet, bedding, and furniture Overly elaborate and intrusive mini-bar and other overpriced items scattered about-- with the 1st night's turndown service I carefully examined the water and chocolates to verify there were no "open this and we charge you $" stickers. A glass wall separates the bathroom, toilet and all, from the bedroom. There is a curtain you can pull but privacy and noise contol remain an issue. Vibe is painfully, self-consciously hip, especially in the Elixir bar. Yaletown is small, so once you've seen what there is, it's a long walk to other areas In-room internet access is $15/day, parking $25/day So while Opus succeeds on many important points, it would be even better if worn elements were replaced and the iitems for sale in the room were eliminated or reduced. It's hard to relax when you're surrounded by sales tactics.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful style and location”
Reviews.Author: Tanchan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a weekend getaway at the Opus with our two small doggies (a miniature Schnauzer and a small terrier mutt). We had stayed there once about 3 years ago and still remembered it fondly... we'd been looking forward to this visit for several weeks. The Opus didn't dissapoint. It's an exteremly stylish boutique hotel in one of the most fun parts of Vancouver. We felt like rockstars the entire weekend. It's practically next door to some of the best restaurants in town and also quite close to several parks along False Creek. Other things: The Olympics: Vancouver is scrambling to get ready for the 2010 Winter Olympics. A new Canada Line transit station is being built right next to the Opus. This will be extremely convenient once completed, but it's a bit inconvenient for now... Davies street is cut off just past the Opus and you have to walk through scafolding to get to the Roundhouse area. Didn't notice any construction noise however, probably because it's mostly underground. Neighborhood: We love Yaletown! A super trendy neighborhood with great restaurants and cafe's. Often, hip neighborhoods like this in metro areas can be equally snooty and uninviting, but we found Yaletown to still have enough grungieness to make us feel welcome. Internet: So here's one knock against the Opus. For a hotel in this category, I think it's really unacceptable to charge for Internet access. They charge a little over $15 CND per day for wireless. That's just stupid... it should be free. Unfortunately, I couldn't find any open wireless connections to get around the charge, so I just accepted it. Sigh. Travelling with pets: Opus is *extremely* accomodating to guests with pets. We've been there twice now with our two doggies and we've been treated very well both times. One note: Their official policy is that you're not to leave your doggies in your room without you, but they'll look the other way as long as they are well mannered. Also, the Opus is about 2 blocks away from some very nice waterfront parks. The nearby David Lam park was stocked with doggie bags during our visit. This became our morning and evening routine with our pooches. Ice: There are no ice machines in the Opus. However, you can call guest services and they will bring ice to you. That wound up becoming a little annoying on our second day there when we arrived back to the hotel after a long walk and had to wait 15 minutes for them to bring up ice to us. Of course that's also another opportunity for you to tip their staff. A small annoyance.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS is Exceptional...”
Reviews.Author: XclusiveTraveler
Reviews.Content: For the last 3 years, I've spent more time in hotel rooms than I have in my own bed. That being said, no other hotel I've visited during my recent travels has impressed me more than Opus in Vancouver. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, the comforts and ambiance of Opus are not only appealing, they're incredibly welcoming...in a uniquely urban-chic package! The staff was wonderful, everybody had a smile on their face and seemed genuinely happy to part of Opus...it made a difference. LOCATION: The hotel is located in Yaletown, a hot-spot for fine dining, hip bars, and Vancouver's "see and be seen" epicenter. Opus is right in the heart of the scene, and when the sun goes down, Opus' bar and restaurant (Opus Bar, Elixir) become what appeared to be the best place in Vancouver to be. Lots of great shops, restaurants, and services surrounding the hotel. Close to most everything you'd want to get to in Vancouver, for business or pleasure. ROOM: - Very comfortable bedding/down comforters - Stereo system, including CDs!!! (my room had Lenny Kravitz, U2, and an couple of compilation disks...great!!) - Flat screen tv - Lounge Chair/quasi sofa - Desk - Beautiful bathroom - Great reading material (city guide, luxury travel magazines, pop-culture books...great!!!) - Chocolate wafers provided with turndown service BUSINESS CENTER & WORKOUT ROOM: After getting comfortable in my room, I decided to send a couple of emails and go workout. The business center has a couple of computers, a printer, and even an airline check-in kiosk. Use of the computers and wireless in the business center were complimentary. Nice room, lots of space. After the work emails were sent, I went across the hall and used the workout facility. Treadmill, free weights, and a great view of Yaletown. Small room, but it had everything you really need. For those who enjoy a good run, the area is GREAT for that. RESTAURANT/BAR: I didn't have a chance to eat at Elixir, but I had a couple of drinks in the Opus Bar on a busy Friday night. There was a live DJ, yes...a live DJ. The scene was a mix of 25-40 somethings, dancing, chatting, and having fun. I'm typically not one for this type of setting, but I had a great time and really enjoyed myself... NET-NET: - GREAT HOTEL/ROOMS - GREAT STAFF (amazing!) - DETAILS....DETAILS...DETAILS...Opus has hit a homerun with regards to paying attention to the big and small details - I Can't say enough...great place!

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel - not so much the specific room”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugMississauga
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Opus previously and really enjoyed our stay which is why we decided to return again this time in Vancouver. The only complaint I have, is that the room was above the bar area, which, on a Friday night became quite boisterous and loud as the night wore on. Other than that, love the funkiness of the hotel (including the bar) and the great Yaletown location.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Luxery”
Reviews.Author: Darryl46
Reviews.Content: I spent a night at the Opus recently and was looking forward to it as I have had several friends and collegues recommend it. My expectations were high and I was not disappointed. As a business traveller I see my fair share of hotels and after a while, even the best ones seem homogenized. So it was to my great delight that I found the Opus Hotel to be a unique and funky property with amazing service. It's hip decor seems to transcend time. At one moment you're in the lobby at the post modern check-in desk, and then just a few minutes later, enjoying drinks and dinner in a wonderful French style bistro. The rooms are just as cool, decorated in vibrant colors (mine was chartruese!), and filled with tiny ammentities that make the most jaded traveller sit up and take notice. I personally enjoyed the latest cultural magazines (not the usual "Guides and activity brochures" here!), and the relaxing CD's included in the room that turned me on to some new artists. As for the service, it was attentive, professional and not the least bit "put on". I had some great chats with some of the staff that made me feel like I was hanging out with new friends, not the hired help. I can probably best sum up the visit with a quote I found in the hotel from another guest. To paraphrase, "I felt like my cool friend had just gone away for the weekend and left me the keys to his funky pad in the heart of Yaletown". I hope he goes away again soon!

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: littlesmitty45
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel after looking on Tripadvisor for a hotel in Vancouver. I had always stayed at the Hamptons in the past. After staying at this hotel the last week I would never stay anywhere different in Vancouver. FIRST IMPRESSIONS- I arrived early in the morning on a snow covered day and the staff greeted me and had everything done in about 2 mins for me to get up to my room. I went up to my room to put my bags down before I went back out to get a friend I was coming to visit. When I opened the door I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the room was. It reminded me of the W chain of hotels. The room was not huge but very well designed and the washroom was to die for. When I got back from picking up my friend and sat on one of the beds I realized how incredibly comfortable the bed was. The next morning I almost didn't want to get out of bed I was so comfy. Staff- |As with most times I stay at hotels I don't know the city that well and ask a few questions the first day. I think this is the first time in recent memory that the staff actually made me feel like asking a question was a good thing rather then bothering them while they did work. Anytime I had any question or needed anything they were right on top of it. They even had coupons for when I went to the aquarium near by. Area- I had never heard of or been to yaletown where the hotel is located before this visit so I didn't know what to expect. I personally had never been a huge fan of Vancouver before largely because of the problem they have with run down areas and the poor everywhere but I was blown away by this part of town. It reminded me of Soho in new york or the hip and trendy spots in any city. It has tons of nice restaurants, bars, lounges and shops around it. Your also very close to all the sporting venues and if you need a ride they have a BMW 7 series that can drive you where you need to go. OVERALL- I personally am never intending to stay at another hotel when I am in vancouver. As long as there are rooms here I will be staying at this beautiful boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “PErfect memories”
Reviews.Author: LottieCardiff
Reviews.Content: If luxury and attention to detail is your thing then go. Treat a girlfriend to a romantic get away - we loved it! MAke sure you get to the recommended breakfast bar out of town ?Sophies. The limousine driver kindly dropped us there both days.

Reviews.Title: “Great until 11pm - Terrible after that”
Reviews.Author: mbuie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location, has very comfortable and funky rooms. Extra little touches like books and magazines in the room are awesome. Along with nice music selection. Beds were very comfortable. However, we could not enjoy it because there was a party in the room next door until 4am. They were extremely loud. We could not sleep even with earplugs. We did complain and the hotel did send two people up but it did not help for long. When we told reception at check out the next day, they did not seem to care. There was no offer for discount or apologies. That was very disappointing and eliminates all the good work the hotel does in all other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but over-rated”
Reviews.Author: travalstar
Reviews.Content: Staff was great, and the restaurant food was quite good. Location is in the trendy Yaletown district of Vancouver, with lots to do within walking distance. However, visitors should be aware that there is ongoing construction around the property due to the underground transit line. The hotel is modern decor, trendy, but not the luxurious elegantce of some of the other top hotels in Vancouver such as the Wedgewood, or Sutton Place. Overall the rooms are 'average', in that even in our 'deluxe' room, the carpets had some stains, and needed cleaning. The bed linens were nice, although that the duvet cover was made of a very rough material that was unncomfortable. Beds were average, not the great 'pillow-top' comfort one would expect from a hotel that is trying to be a top 'celeb' spot. So, better beds, better pillows, cleaner carpets, would be an imporvement. If you can get a 'deal' on a room, go for it, otherwise, for the money, you can do a lot better elsewhere in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - shame about the James Bond GM”
Reviews.Author: Brit-on-tour
Reviews.Content: Came to see Hip vancouver to reward a few colleagues in the Fund. Booked a chic little boutique hotel called Opus vancouver. Cool website and word-of-mouth recommendations were a real cause of excitement to the boys flying out of london. The GM who thought he was Ian Fleming was a real detriment to a great trip (lets leave aside the various entertainments the City can offer the world-weary traveller...) Shame - lets hope the hotel sees sense and releases Daniel to make another movie...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but temporarily noisy, and bad sofa beds”
Reviews.Author: zracoon
Reviews.Content: I mostly have good things to say about this hotel, but had just a couple problems. The hotel is very modern, which I liked. The service was outstanding. The location is terrific. I'm not terribly familiar with Vancouver, but it was nice to be able to park at the hotel and walk to lots of restaurants, the sea wall, etc. The only reasons I'd suggest not staying here are temporary and specific. First, they're constructing an underground subway station right next to the Opus (the hole for the station is about a foot from the exterior wall of the hotel, it's literally right next door). My room was on the same side as the construction, so once they started pounding at 7:00 A.M. I was awake whether I liked it or not. The desk clerk said that the current noise level was the worst that it's been. I think construction goes through 2009. Maybe the other side of the hotel isn't as noisy. There was no noise at night. Second, I was there on business with a coworker and we requested separate beds. We were "upgraded" to a suite which had a king and a sofa bed, but we were told the sofa bed was a normal mattress and just as comfy. It wasn't, it was as uncomfy as any sofa bed I've slept on. So, if you don't mind noise or the noise has subsided, and you don't need to use the sofabed, this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I want to live in the opus!”
Reviews.Author: worstnightmare
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the opus for five nights on a recent trip around Canada and thought it was a fabulous hotel. Yaletown, in my opinion is the nicest part of the city, very clean, safe and trendy and the opus hotel fits right in. Had a superior room, which was pretty big. Loved the bed, like a big marshmallow. There was a digital temperature control panel on the wall, which when adjusted, could change the temperature in the room within minutes, meaning you always felt comfortable. There was no noise from the construction site even though it was just outside our window. Our funky green room had magazines, cd's and books lying around so the place felt like being at home, except with someone else to make your bed and wash your towels. However, it also had the essentials like a safe, and the luxuries like the big flat screen tv and fab toiletries. Ate at the restaurant - the best food and service i had during my holiday in canada. The bar gets busy at the weekend as it has cool dj's and is a great place to try a few opus cocktails. There are lots of good restaurants and bars around yaletown. The hotel is within walking distance of everything. Downtown vancouver is small and we walked to the other side in about half an hour. The opus is a great hotel in a great location with very friendly and efficient staff. If I could afford the bill, I would move in. For the moment, however, I will just have to look forward to returning to vancouver and another few nights of luxury at the opus!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Opus”
Reviews.Author: warrenUk
Reviews.Content: Our 2 night stay at the Opus was thoroughly enjoyable. The entire hotel catered for our needs superbly, the bar is very trendy, and our Superior room was very comfortable, stylish and clean (very quiet air-con!). There were no disturbances from the nearby construction site, and even the waterfront at the northern end of downtown is only about 30 minutes walk, the furthest you would ever need to walk. The Aquabus dock for sightseeing is a five minute walk away, and Yaletown itself is a very relaxing neighbourhood to stay in. My only comment would be that the front desk & concierge seemed a little short staffed/inexperienced at peak times, perhaps more so at weekends, where waiting for luggage assistance/check in-out occasionally felt a bit drawn out for the standard of hotel the Opus is. However, we found the Opus overall to be in a class of it's own, and cannot wait to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place for Vancouver visit”
Reviews.Author: FCLOKC
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring Vancouver. Stayed 4 nights. Reminds me of the Home Hotel (but bigger) in BA. Hotel is small enough to feel personal and large enough to meet most traveler needs. The front desk people are friendly and helpful. Best of all is the location a stone throw from all of the best restauants. Used the hotel bicycles to ride to Stanley Park and the auqua bus to Granville island. Eat at Rodney's oyster house, Coast, Simply Thai the odd Elbow room for breakfast. Blue Water over rated and Joe Fortes too crowded and touristy. Overall Vancouver isn't cheap but is a great city for seafood and outdoor activities.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Hotel, Cool Location, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: dana323
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in Yaletown, which is a really vibrant place to be. You can walk to tons of restaurants and galleries. The staff was very helpful (i.e. offering us an umbrella when we left during a rain storm). We did use the free car service to go Robson for dinner one night. You need to reserve it ahead of time and they do have limits for the service (they would not take us to the cruise terminal a couple of miles away). You can borrow bikes for the hotel. The rooms were nice, but pretty small. We got a great deal for the hotel (just under $200) and it was definately worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “OPUS HOTEL - For those who want it all!”
Reviews.Author: GVG
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived on thursday and stayed for 3 nights while in Vancouver during Pride Week at Opus Hotel. We were very happy with the style, decor and location. Close to Everything. We were very impressed with the front desk staff and our room was fabulous. Our first night started at the Opus Bar, very friendly atmoshpere, great drinks and music,and even a cute DJ.Who played our song. Over all we had the best service I've seen in a long time. Our weekend was perfect. We will be back again, Opus Hotel is for people who want it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good design, great location”
Reviews.Author: LehGo
Reviews.Content: Located in trendy Yaletown, the great thing about the Opus is location: The streets around are bustling with hip restaurants and bars. The hotel interior is very contemporary, modern design (although you have to get used to having your bathroom on display on the rooms window to the street - don't worry the screens are efficient). The rooms are rather on the small side, but nicely furbished and with all amenities expected at a high class hotel (flatscreen TV, nice stereo etc.). Service is friendly and professional. If you look for a upscale place in Vancouver other than the traditional large hotels on the "plush" side, the opus is your choice. In summer 2007, there was a large construction site for the Vancouver underground right in front of the hotel - not a nice view, but the hotel is quite soundproof and you don't hear too much.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but not for me”
Reviews.Author: kinganasf
Reviews.Content: The Opus really is a nice hotel. I stayed there for two nights with my husband in a courtyard room with a terrace. The room was large and the bed was very comfortable. I loved the heated bathroom floor, the focus on design, and the terrace. The front desk staff was also very accomodating and professional. Honestly, I just don't think the Opus was for me. The nightclub is really something. The music is very loud and there is a loooooong queue of beautiful twentysomethings at night. I think the waitresses have to weigh in before work (in their three-inch heels). It's just not my scene. I much preferred staying in the West End. One note: the Opus really needs to work on its billing. We had a rental car for one night. I had noticed something on this website about problems with parking charges, so my husband cleared up the matter before we checked out. No problems during check out. However, when we arrived home, there was a letter from the Opus--not asking us about or stay or thanking us-- but telling us they realized they forgot to charge us for our second night of parking and so they went ahead and put the charge on our credit card. I spent another 15 minutes on the phone clearing up the matter. Not too big of a deal, but kind of annoying especially after taking the time to clear up the matter with the concierge.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jet-lagged-traveller
Reviews.Content: The Opus is a great little hotel. We stayed twice, either side of going to Whistler, so two different rooms. Both were comfortable, reasonable size and well kitted out except [and this is where they nearly lose a point from me] - no baths, just showers in both rooms. The location is really good, and there are lots of places to eat nearby [though booking needed at several]. What made it for us was the staff, who consistently gave friendly and professional service, and really put themselves out for me when I was taken ill [accessing a doctor, running me to hospital, checking how I was doing later and so on]. We also liked small things, like the free internet access in the business centre. I thoroughly recommend this hotel. If you are planning on staying you might be aware that there are roadworks nearby where they are making an underground link to the airport, but we heard no noise from this at all inside so I would not be put off.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel-don't waste time looking elsewhere to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sandy99
Reviews.Content: Opus was amazing-driving up I was a little nervous. The minute you step out of car/taxi, you are pampered-first rate service. The staff at the OPUS do it right. Ian was so helpful with directions/restaurant choices. Zaheed at the desk was wonderful with all his special suggestions. Rooms are perfect. Space is adequate, beds. linen luxurious! Turndown service, free shoeshines each evening, L'Occitane bath products in bathroom. Do check your reservation includes a bathtub if you prefer it to a shower. Location in Yaletown was wonderful-great restaurants, shops all within walking distance. 2 blocks to the ocean with more restaurants to sit and watch the marina over breakfast. Would return again. Did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “One of best hotels ever...”
Reviews.Author: tortola1
Reviews.Content: Opus was simply amazing! Our room was small, but luxurious. The bathroom was large, with a rainhead shower. Staying in the hotel made me feel so spoilt; little touches like the free BMW service were great. We ate breakfast at Elixir, the french bistro, every morning; it was a divine way to start our day. The staff were super friendly, and the lounge downstairs had a great nightlife scene. Opus is one my favorite hotels that I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Business_Visitor1
Reviews.Content: Very well situated area in a lively area of town. This may be an issue if you go at the weekend and want to go to bed early, but you can ask to be on the opposite side of the hotel. Staff are very friendly. Rooms come in 4 different styles/decors so you might want to select what suits you. Some rooms have connecting doors which is the daftest idea in the world to my mind as they tend to be noiser, but I didn't have a problem. The basic rooms are not huge, but presumably you are not going to Vancouver to sit in your hotel room!!! Beds are on the firm side (which works for me) and very comfortable. Shower is great. Coffee making facilities in room with freshly provided coffee at no cost, little cartons of milk in fridge let it down a bit, so I just some fresh milk from corner shop and used that instead. Reasonable sized gym which will give you a reasonable work out but will not turn you into Arnie. Lively bar and restaurant. Free internet in business centre, which compensates for them wanting to charge you if you use from your room. Altogether a great stay. Be aware that they are building a new subway on one side of the hotel in time for the Olympics and work starts early in the morning during the week. I submitted a couple of suggestions on feedback form and received a letter from manager thanking me, which I think illustrates that they are trying to do the right things.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: uofmfbfan
Reviews.Content: The Opus Hotel is one of the finest hotels I have stayed in around the world. The service is incredible. I highly recommend the Opus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - friendly staff - hip & comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: BluMartini
Reviews.Content: I spend 4 days in April at the OPUS after a lot of traveling in Canada & the United States. Working in the Travel Industry, it is the very first time I exprience a Design hotel & feel it has been a thoroughly comfortable experience. It has the hip feeling of a W hotel, without the expensive price tag, and with Service! The gym is small, but it has all the necessary equipment - everything from my room to the public areas & the gym were very well maintained. Staff, as often in Canada, was very polite, friendly & helpful. I warmly recommend this hotel. My room not only had a bathtub (you do have to pay if you need extra comfort!) & a shower, with delightful L'Occitane amenities. At last, the French restaurant & their lounge bar with live DJ over the week end are truly fun, with fantastic service. A real good address in Vancouver for people enjoying Design hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Opus”
Reviews.Author: Johnfos
Reviews.Content: I spent three days at the Opus Hotel while visiting family in Vancouver. This luxury boutique hotel is superb both for business people and up-market tourists. It has high-class restaurants and an excellent cafe and business centre. It is located downdown in the Yaletown area close to offices, stores and urban transit. False Creek is a short walk away, with mini-ferries shuttling to Granville Island and other attractions. This is one of the best hotels I've stayed in on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Opus”
Reviews.Author: LilyP
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Opus Hotel! Great boutique hotel with sleek modern design in a great neighborhood in Vancouver. The scene is a bit hipper than thou, but I completely enjoyed my stay. But be aware that this is a party neighborhood and I did wake up at 3 AM one night hearing a nearby guest stumbling back after a night of partying. But I would no doubt stay here on a return trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “What's the fuss?”
Reviews.Author: RedAhead
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be one of the best 100 hotels in the world? The bed is hard -- no pillowtops here. The lobby and room furniture are worn and seedy, suggesting that the Opus' days as some sort of living legend are probably behind it. The rooms are nice enough, but I've spent half this much for hotels that were at least as nice. (At these prices, I expect triple sheets and extra pillows and blankets at a minimum.) Nobody warned me about the $25 daily parking charge; and the guy at the desk cheerfully explained how to access the wifi -- without mentioning that I'd have to pay $15/day for it. (I can name a dozen $100/night highway motels that can manage free wireless internet. If there's a traveler's bill of rights, this should be on it.) The hotel's amenities are extremely limited, too. The location can't be beat if you're doing business in Yaletown. If you're not, there are plenty of better places to stay in Vancouver -- especially if you're willing to spend what this place costs. Seriously: It doesn't begin to come close to living up to the hype.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Pincut
Reviews.Content: I believe this hotel used to have some gimmick about matching rooms to fictional character/personality types?? They don't do this any longer, so you get a straightforward boutique-style hotel in Yaletown, downtown Vancouver. I thought the location was great with a couple of great bars and restaurants nearby (eg Glowbal) and the entire city was easily and enjoyably walkable. The staff here are fine - they are not going to babysit you and will leave you to figure things out unless you ask them for help directly. They stiff you on parking fees which are unadvertised in advance. Rooms are nice, but reasonably small. Overall, an enjoyable, friendly experience

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and style - I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Vancouvergirl1
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at Opus and have to say that every aspect of the stay was devine. It is a totally stylish hotel with every amenity you could wish for, with unique room decor and WOW those bathrooms!!!! Finally, you couldn't ask for a better staff - young, hip and absolutely lovely, they were great. Obviously an exceptional stay in my books, and believe me I have seen it all!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: AlasdairSB
Reviews.Content: OPUS Hotel is definately worth another visit, and another, and another. Well located, it is within easy reach of everything I needed, but I felt like I was in a more residential area. Staff were very pleasant, and went out of their way to help me. Meanwhile the restaurant was first rate. I ended up having to spend more time in my room on my computer working than I would have liked, but it was so comfortable I almost didn't mind. Go and find out yourself - it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “After spending $1200, this is by far the worst hotel in Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter604
Reviews.Content: I booked Opus for New Years Eve 2007. I live in Vancouver and decided that for New Years I would just stay in the city to celebrate NYE. My booking was made in November over the phone for an executive suite but for whatever reason Opus would not allow me to just book one night so I had to book 2 nights which cost just under $1200. The nightmare began on the 30th. The check-in time was after 3 PM so I came in around 6 PM and approached the front desk. The woman handling the reservations desk had a chip on her shoulder before I walked up. She asked me for my Visa card on which I booked my room on. I told her my Visa did not have enough for both nights and I would pay her a cash deposit. I've stayed at other hotels in Vancouver and around the world and almost every hotel will accommodate cash as deposit. Her response was 'NO' and told me if my credit card didn't have enough for both nights she wouldn't give me the room. At this point I told her that I would give her the full amount in cash and even an extra $200, which would be $1400!!! The answer was 'NO' and you would think by booking one of the expensive suites the front desk would have some respect and try to work the problem out but nope, she left me hanging and started helping someone else. I sat around the hotel in disbelief for 30 mins trying to figure out how I could pay the deposit with my visa. The whole time no hotel staff approached me to try to solve the problem, instead the front desk employees were too busy talking to each other. I finally approached her and asked if she could, for this one time only, let me pay with cash. This time around she made sure other people sitting in the lobby would hear and said 'do you not understand I’m not going to repeat myself...WE DON'T ACCEPT CASH AS DEPOSIT!’ I was shocked. I asked for the manager but the manager wasn't 'in'. I went back and sat down and started calling other hotels in Vancouver to see if I could get a room for NYE but all the other hotels were booked. I couldn't believe the service so after wasting an hour in total I approach another employee and asked her if I could use my debit card and her response 'Yes you can'. I was so pissed off that I told her and the lady that had spoken to me in such a rude way earlier that the service at this hotel was [--] and I wanted the manager's business card. The women were obviously shocked that I said '[--]' but if it wasn't for Nye’s, I would have cancelled the room and went somewhere else. I finally got a call from the manager a few days later and he tried to blame me and said 'you raised your voice and said [--]'. Of course it's [--] when someone is spending $1200 and your service is worst then a freaking gas station!!!!!!!!! As a resident of Vancouver I will warn all travelers to be careful. The service is 0 out 5, the executive suite was 1 out of 5 with torn bed sheets, no LCD TV's, carpet looks like its 20 years old and the washroom is plain. This by far is the worst hotel in Vancouver and is in no way a 5 star. Save your money and book at the Pan Pacific or Hotel Vancouver. I don't have any pictures of the rooms but I’ve added the receipt incase people think this is a [--] review.

Reviews.Title: “You will need earplugs to sleep here”
Reviews.Author: Emily07
Reviews.Content: Hi, From the website, the hotel seems like an upscale boutique but it is really not. When we got into the hotel at night, I noticed that they provided earplugs by my bedside. Later at 3AM I realized that I definitely needed them. Although the hotel had rooms facing the courtyard, they placed us in one facing the street. The noise from the street crowd didn't end until 5AM. Plus the neighbourhood was not really that safe either. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: ltkelowna
Reviews.Content: I found my stay at the OPUS to be an excellent experience. The hotel is very nice and has a unique interior design that sets it apart from your typical higher end hotel. The service and attention to detail were exceptional. The staff were friendly and professional. The food and service at the hotel restaurant was very good. The hotel is located in Yaletown in downtown Vancouver and is within walking distance to some very good shops, restaurants and pubs. I would highly recommend the OPUS Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the Opus”
Reviews.Author: mamaof6
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Opus Hotel to just get away and relax. We were greeted warmly by all hotel staff. The room had a relaxing feeling and the deep bathtub was completely luxurious. I loved the warm tiles in the bathroom. The room was well stocked and everything we needed was available and easy to access (ordering a movie). One of the greatest features are the heavy blinds that keep out the light in the morning so you can sleep in so peacefully... Thank-you.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahASeattle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great find! It's a boutique hotel, modern flare while still maintaining comfort and fun. the rooms are a bit different. There's a window from the tub to the room which opens up to the room, which was kinda funky but fun. We had a nice large soaking tub and a spa shower which was a nice touch. The beds were awesome. Very comfortable! When I made the reservation, apparently you can request the room color decor, they are all in funky bold colors, green, red, yellow, blue, etc. I requested blue and at check when we got to the room we had been given a yellow room. But no big deal, the rooms were quite lovely and comfortable. The check-in experience and staff seemed a bit pretentious, but if you look past that, it's a good deal at a nice hotel. The bar in the lobby can be loud in the evenings, but it didn't carry into the rooms at all. The neighborhood is off the beaten path so it's a better location if you have a car so you can get to the Vancouver sites. However, it's an up and coming area, lots of art studios, furniture stores, little shops, I really enjoyed walking around the neighborhood. There's a terrific little Italian restaurant less than a block away, which I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but terrible staff”
Reviews.Author: SJ123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a courtyard room for 3 nights over New Year and at $319.00 CAB plus tax per night it was very expensive for what you got. Firstly we had problems with the key card on checking in, after taking all our luggage ourselves up in the lift the key card didn't work and we had to go back to reception and change it, after being stuck on the 5th floor. Then we ordered ice and hot water from room service, as there is no ice making machines and no kettle in the rooms. When after 25 minutes this hadn't turned up I had to call again to see where it was. Then we booked into the Elixir Restaurant for dinner on New Years Eve. It was a set menu with no price written anywhere on the menu. When the bill came it was $150 CAN each for the food, way more than we expected for what was served. Then on New Years day the key card did not work again and the woman on reception was so rude and spoke to me like I was one of the homeless people that frequently beg for money outside the hotel. I was so angry. To make matters worse the second time that afternoon we went back to our room the keycard didn't work again. When I took it down to the same rude woman on reception she asked why I was angry!!! To top it all off, on the last afternoon we got back to our room to find that they had not replaced any of the toiletries in the bathroom, when you are paying $319 a night you don't have to expect to have to ask for some shampoo and soap! I would never stay here again. The only good thing about it is the location which is great, Yaletown is wonderful with heaps of great restuarants and bars, unfortunately there is only the Opus hotel in Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “Good... But not great”
Reviews.Author: westones
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that was rated to be one of the world's top 100, the bar was set very high. Unfortunately, the Opus did not live up to my expectations. Though the room was nice, other than the glass wall with a view of the bathroom (you could draw blinds for privacy), there was nothing else that captured the character the Opus is trying to portray. It reminded me of a nice Hyatt room but certainly not that of a boutique hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful. The location is great for holiday travelers - its a short walk to the ferry, there are several restaurants within 100 meters of the hotel and there is an outstanding cafe directly across from the hotel (the one attached to the hotel is mediocre). If you want to shop on Robson street, it is walkable but I suspect most will want to hail a taxi. The Opus is a magnet for the after hours scene. If thats your thing, then you'll certainly enjoy it. Otherwise, its not noticeable once you've passed the lobby. I would return (it was a very pleasant stay), but I do wish they'd add a bit more character to the rooms to showcase the essence of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It is a good hotel that has the potential to be great.”
Reviews.Author: Minsters041
Reviews.Content: Had high expectations of this hotel, however there is a lack of attention to detail that stops it from being a great hotel. They forgot little details, I am allergic to feathers they were aware of this (having written to them and they acknowledged) however the night duty manager ended up changing over the bedding at 9pm whilst we waited in the bathroom - disappointing! (They forgot in both rooms we stayed in) On the plus side the location was good, it was decorated to a high standard and they did provide nibbles and wine as a honeymoon present. The standard rooms are not large, but on the second night we moved to a courtyard suite which was really nice it had a fire you could relax next to. Overall it is a good hotel that has the potential to be great.

Reviews.Title: “Vastly overrated.”
Reviews.Author: MTWSeattle
Reviews.Content: A vastly overrated hotel. The room was barely large enough for the bed, and there was no bath tub. There was an adjoining room, and we could hear every word our neighbors spoke, and every cry and babble of their baby. I am sure they heard everything we said as well. It was like staying in a youth hostel. There was no maid service either, until we requested it, and then we had to go sit in the lobby for an hour while the room was serviced. The staff were neither friendly nor helpful. For $200 a night, one deserves a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Service is the difference”
Reviews.Author: CondoGuy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed there twice and it's as good as it gets. The rooms aren't huge but they're well-appointed and very comfortable. Great location, within walking distance of more restaurants than you could eat at in a month. It's the service though, that really makes The Opus world-class. I could mention a dozen employees who routinely exceeded my expectations like it was "all in a day's work". (Cassidy, Costa, Michele, Lisa, Christine, Patrick, Katrina, and Daniel, among others.) I've stayed at a great number of first-class hotels, but I can tell you that on any of my following trips to Vancouver I won't stay anywhere but The Opus. Whatever the rating system is, I put this hotel in the top ten I've ever stayed at, and as a loyal consumer I can assure you I'll be back there again!

Reviews.Title: “this is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: payneinass
Reviews.Content: this hotel is 5 star all the way. from the moviestar guests to the fantastic service. I lost my cellphone charger and asked fthe front desk for a store to buy one. after asking what model i owned one was quickly found by staff and sent to my room. the people are the best thing about this hotel, maids, room service and frontdesk staff are top notch. i have now stayed there 3 times in the last month and will be there again next week. its gets better each time as the staff come to know my likes and dislikes. no more bayshore only OPUS.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Town, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Vancouver and have been rather underwhelmed by the choice in so called 5 star properties. The Opus Hotel definitely hits the mark. Located in trendy Yaletown within walking distance of shops and many restaurants the hotel is the height of hip luxury in Vancouver. Unlike a lot of boutique hotels this one manages to offer trendy environs without coming off as ridiculous. The uniformly attractive staff offer no attitude only service.Elixir the house restaurant is one of the best in Vancouver, which is no small feat. There is a 7 series BMW to drop you off downtown and doormen who actually open the door and refer to you by name. Supposedly this hotel is a celeb haunt but we saw none when we were there. We did see families, dogs, and all sorts of people who appeared to be having a good time. Laundry service, room service, bell service, all first rate. The rooms are all a bit different in decor, and will not be to everyone's taste (our was lime green!) but it adds to the fun. Great business center, very good fitness room, and overall the best we have experienced in Vancouver. If they have space, I will never stay elsewhere. One drawback is there is construction outside for the new rail line but we did not find it overly noisy.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a rock star!”
Reviews.Author: bplatinum
Reviews.Content: Ok, I'm not a rock star by any means, but this place made me feel like I was one! We had an amazing 3 night stay at the Opus during a recent trip to Vancouver. The hotel is in Yaletown, which is full of fun shops and restaurants, and a stone's throw from most everything in Vancouver. Our room was bigger than we expected, it was one of the red themed rooms with a huge bathroom. It was hip and modern without being pretentious - ok, the huge glass wall in the bathroom might be a bit much for some, but you do have the option of pulling the curtains! The staff, in addition to being very good looking, was top notch. We felt welcomed and well cared for - from dinner reservations to shopping recommendations to biking routes - these folks were ready to help us make the most of our short trip. We loved Vancouver and plan to come back and will definitely book at the Opus again. Make sure you stop and have a drink in the lobby bar - you will definitely be able to try out your rock star act!

Reviews.Title: “Better to spend your money elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Traveller555
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus in September 2006. We were attracted by the fact it had been named as one of the 100 best hotels in the world etc etc. The design is nice but it is overpriced for what you get. We didn't stay in a standard room but the next one up, it was the most expensive hotel we stayed in in Canada yet the smallest room and worst experience over all. The staff were pretty helpful and the evening turn down service was good though we were furious to get woken up at 7.30 am the day we were checking out when the hotel called our room about a credit card problem which was their error. The location in Yaletown is not great - there are lots of bar/restaurants but nothing else like shops etc and it is a fair way to walk to shops etc. Also, there is a huge construction prject going on right outside which is really noisy during the day. The bar/restaurant was poor value for money. Overall, it was not unpleasant but I wouldn't stay there again Comparing what we paid and other hotels in Vancounvrer, we could have had a better experience elsewhere. We previously stayed at the Blue Horizon on Robson Street which was cheap and cheerful but a much better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Monea
Reviews.Content: Was in Vancouver on honeymoon and stayed in the Opus. What a hotel! Superb staff & service, wonderful Yaletown location and modern contemporary design. We particularly loved the room we had with the unusual outside-facing bathroom. Very different. All-in-all we had a great 3 days stay there and would highly recommend the Opus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, except for the construction”
Reviews.Author: eh555
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Opus after a horrendously disappointing evening at the Four Seasons, and what a change. The Opus is big on over-the-top design and decor (loud furniture and music and odd colors etc), which usually isn't my thing, but we didn't mind too much. We got a suite, and it was very nice and actually rather large. The absolute best thing about this hotel is the location in the heart of Yaletown - so much better than being in the financial district, I think. The neighborhood is filled with upscale bars and restaurants, and it was great to be within a stone's throw of it all. It's still close to everything else you'd want to see and do, but you feel a little bit more like a local in this part of town - highly recommend it. But the construction that is going on right outside on Davies Street is very, very annoying - and it is expected to go on until the Olympics (in 2010?). They're gutting the street to put in a subway, so it's no small project. Really too bad, because it comes close to ruining the hotel. Thankfully we are early risers - if you're not, you shouldn't go, because they start promptly at 8am, and it is loud. Maybe it's better on the other side of the hotel though - we were directly above it on the 5th floor. If you're a light sleeper and want to sleep in or nap, you probably shouldnt go unless they can guarantee a room away from the work - don't let them tell you that the windows are sound proof. I'm sure they blocked a lot of the noise, since they were actually ripping up concrete, but you could still hear plenty. Really too bad.

Reviews.Title: “High on design but not a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dblacksam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus for just one night but that was enough. The hotel is high on design which was why I picked it but it lacked any substance. It did not compare favourably with boutique hotels I have stayed in in other parts of the world. Neither the check in staff nor the concierge were particularly helpful and the lobby and bar area were totally lacking in atmosphere. The room was on the small side and too dark. In order to let light in one had to have the blinds of the bathroom open. This is slightly problematic as the bathrooms face the street and have wall to ceiling windows so there is a privacy issue if the blinds are open. I would not return here in a hurry but I fear that there is no where much better to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't change a thing”
Reviews.Author: NicT
Reviews.Content: When I booked the Opus I was impressed with what I saw on their website, and by the helpful staff when I called to change our reservation - but had no idea just how great the place would be. The staff are incredible - competent, friendly, professional. Nothing was too much trouble for any member of the team. They were happy to book or confirm dinner reservations - the Opus name certainly seems to count as we always got fantastic tables at some of the busiest and most popular restaurants in town; they have smart hotel bikes available for cycling tours; a town car which was readily available for our use; they greeted us cheerily and by name every time we came through the door, and asked how our day had been etc. We had an room overlooking the courtyard and did not hear noise from the bar or the construction work outside. We stayed for 6 nights and I would go back tomorrow. I would recommend it to anyone looking for something modern and stylish but down to earth and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms and unfriendly services!”
Reviews.Author: toptrader
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 3 nights. It is a very small room which I could barely walk in. After I called the front desk to ask if they can provide me a better room, they told me all the rooms are sold out and there is nothing they can do about it. Then I asked if I can checked out earlier then I planed, the hotel staff told me I need to pay extra fees ( something like 79.00 dollars) for early check- out. I am still very angry about their attitude and services. It is very noisy and many hotel guests are smokers. If you are non-smoker and more than 25 years old, I urge you not to stay there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: Writer46
Reviews.Content: I really don't know where the Opus finds the people who staff the hotel but they are uniformly the nicest and most service oriented group it's been my pleasure to know in any hotel anywhere. This was a return to the Opus where I've spent several happy visits. I am generally there over a week at a time which is a particular pleasure for me because the excellent staff all call me by name in a very short timeframe. This year I had a deluxe king on the the 6th floor. Normally I book an Executive suite but sad to say the exchange rate (US/Canada) is not what it was a couple of years ago. The Deluxe room was perfectly nice but I missed the under floor heating in the bathroom and the additional space in the suite which lets me set up one room for work and one where I can get away from it. Now, all those nice things being said, I think the food in Elixir, particularly the breakfast, is not what it was. There used to be a phenomenal crepe breakfast now gone but not forgotten. I also have another minute complaint. The soap has now shrunk down to the most ridiculously small piece I have ever encountered. It seems to me that any hotel calling itself a luxury property shouldn't be skimping on amenities. I also think replacing the soap on a daily basis is absolutely essential to a luxury experience but for whatever reason, it is no longer the case at the Opus. But enough! The Yaletown neighborhood is booming and getting better and more interesting with every visit. The restaurants are really excellent. We enjoyed Cioppino and Blue Water for some really fine dining. But we were knocked out by the unbelievably gorgeous waitstaff at the Cactus Club and Brown's --if you're into beautiful women-- and by the guys at Rodney's if you're into equally beautiful men. And let's say it out loud, Canadians are really the most polite and friendly people on the planet.

Reviews.Title: “Service was amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently checked in to the Opus Hotel in Vancouver over Memorial Day weekend. I wanted to stay at a small "boutique"style hotel that also offered the services of a larger, more traditonal hotel. To my great delight, Opus delivered everytime I came in contact with a staff member! The Front Desk made me feel like a VIP upon arrival; although I arrived early and my room was not available, they did everything to make me feel comfortable from assuring me my luggage would be delivered to the room once available to offering use of their Fitness Center to providing maps of downtown Vancouver.The staff at the door consistently greeted me with a smile upon each return to the hotel, most time using my name, and the restaurant staff acted like I was an old friend. The rooms were totally different from the usual Westin or Hilton product. The bathrooms were actually at the front of the room with the windows.. where the bed usually goes! (Speaking of the bed, it was so comfortable that I am looking online to purchase one). The design & colors of the room totally energized me. The bar is one of the hot spots in the city but as hotel guests we never had to wait in line. The Concierge was able to secure last minute tables at most restaurants; even when I walked into one and was told there was an hour & one half wait, I mentioned that the Opus Concierge recommended their place & soon a table was found! Their name means something in that city. All in all, a wonderful experience but as much as I liked their modern design, I would return for the genuine friendliness of all the staff. Maybe it's a Canadian thing!

Reviews.Title: “Great Urban Boutique”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for one night while in Vancouver at Opus Hotel and were very pleased with the style, decor and location and extremely impressed with the delightful young and attractive staff. Everyone we came in contact with from the staff at the Front Desk to those in Housekeeping were very friendly as well as, obviously, well trained. Over the years, we have traveled and stayed in 5 Star, Leading Hotels of the World throughout North & South America, Europe and Asia and were just as comfortable and received the same, if not better, attention at Opus as we have in many of the other hotels. I recommed the hotel for people traveling on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “"Club Scene & Loud" yet beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For some, this hotel would be an attraction. Yet for those that want to go to bed prior to 3am, I wouldn't recomend this hotel. MAKE SURE TO ASK FOR A "QUITE" ROOM. I stayed at this hotel with a friend of mine and had two seperate rooms. My room was on the third floor in the back of the hotel. At 2am, I could hear the base from the music playing downstairs....not from another guests room! My friends room was on the top floor with a small balcony. He couldn't sleep for the entire lobby turns into a night club. In fact, they had the enterence ropped off so that only guests can enter through the main enterence. Not only could you hear the people talking and laughing outside the hotel, you can also hear the music pumping from the 1st floor club. I would stay at this hotel again for it's right in the heart of the "Hip" area of Vancouver. However, I would ask for the top floor and the back of the building away from the street noise. There isn't another hotel that looked better then this one. Two blocks away, there is another hotel that also had the "club scene" going on in the Lobby of their hotel. I just don't get it!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love the Opus”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerAsia
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Vancouver many times for jobs and stayed in different hotels, but I have to say that the Opus is on of my favorties. The rooms are great,, the staff is nice, the location is great as there are so many wonderful restaurants and bars in quick walking distance. I always look forward to my return there...it's never soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Crhino
Reviews.Content: The Opus is that rare hotel that exceeds all expectations. I have never in my travels encountered more pleasant and helpful staff. Rooms are terrfic. No hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone who is tired of impersonal service and nothing but average facilities of most 5 star chains. C. Rhind Toronto

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: privatewire
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of fabulous, from the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty, evryone plays their part in making guests feel special. We were given a free upgrade to a superior room on arrival and really made to feel that we were welcome and valued. The rooms are perhaps not the biggest, but they are all stylish,practical,clean and comfortable with delightful individual touches. I loved this hotel and will never want to stay anywhere else in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but hardly the 3rd best hotel in north america!”
Reviews.Author: glazen
Reviews.Content: This is indeed a fine little boutique hotel in a perfect hip location, Yaletown, surrounded by streets of cool shops, restaurants and lounges. The lobby is minimalist, very elegant, with a fine lounge and restaurant occupying most of the ground floor. The staff is, as others have commented, extremely friendly and helpful. The room I stayed in was a single with a queen-sized bed, a very nice bathroom, great shampoos, etc, a normal televison, a cheap cd player (with a couple of CD's on the nightstand, which I promptly copied on to my laptop!). The sheets, the bed, the shower are all first class. That said, the hotel is truly just a very nice first class hotel in the usual W type of hip motif. There is a certain refinement to the place, but there is truly nothing so exceptional that this would be a Must-Visit institution. Still, the prices are pretty reasonable, and you are in the heart of the coolest neighborhood in Vancouver, so you will definitely be delighted with your stay, as long as you don't buy the company line that this is some sort of world-class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Opus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a night at the Opus as a "honeymoon in town". To sum it up, the hotel is fantastic. I've stayed in many hotels across North America and the Opus is the best hotel I've stayed in. The staff was very friendly - not that fake, annoying, overly helpful friendly - just genuinely helpful and friendly when you needed them. The rooms and linens are beautiful and the many, little thoughtful touches made me smile. There is a little plate of very nice chocolates and nuts when you arrive. There is an umbrella in your room that you are free to use and will keep you dry while exploring Vancouver during it's notoriously wet winter months. There are cd's available to play in the cd/dvd player and you can listen on the surround sound system while flipping through the magazines they have available for you in the room. I often get sick when I travel and thought the Vitamin C tablets in the minibar basket was a great idea. We had a great dinner out in the very trendy Yaletown area and then returned for a cocktail at the Opus's lounge which was packed with nightlife. We definitely had a great time at the Opus and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Opus Hotel is Exquisite Style and Impeccable Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Whenever in Vancouver (usually once a month) my husband and I always stay at the Opus Hotel. Having previously lived in Vancouver for 15 years, I know the city and its hotels and restaurants very well....and there is simply no contest from our perspective. Since its opening only a few years ago, the Opus Hotel is head and shoulders above its competition in Vancouver. From the moment a guest arrives, when greeted by chic yet friendly staff at the front door and the front desk, and throughout the stay.....style and service are the theme. Although the funky and contemporary lobby/lobby bar and the dark wood panneled French restaurant are definitely "see and be seen" hot spots (great food and lots of fun!), the hotel itself maintains a tastefully private and discrete respite for its guests, catering to a discerning and celebrity dominant clientelle visiting Vancouver. The staff are all extremely well trained and available at any time of day or night for any request imaginable. There are several different room styles and colour themes. We have made it our personal mission to try them all and have been thrilled with each and every one...however the penthouse remains our favourite. We travel constantly, and are very particular about our hotel/travel experience and we can say without hesitation that The Opus Hotel is a world class experience not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! I have stayed at the Opus several times and have always had a fantastic experience. The staff is first class with little touches like the complimentary Opus car. The rooms are ultra contemporary and the definition of hip. Can't say enought about this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Chic Boutique”
Reviews.Author: briandale
Reviews.Content: The Opus is hip in the way you would expect the trendiest hotel in the trendiest part of one of the trendiest cities in North America to be. You feel like a movie star returning from a late-night dinner at an upscale Yaletown bistro to a packed hotel lobby-turned-lounge. Celebrating a 30th birthday at the Opus with my wife last weekend however, what impressed us the most was the courteous, attentive staff who seemed to take care of everything with ease. Despite having booked our room on Priceline, we were upgraded to a suite without even asking! Further, from special requests to the turn-down service, the staff was thoughtful and prompt; and each task was performed with a certain flair that, like the physical trappings of the hotel, sets the Opus apart from the rest. Yes, it is incredibly expensive, and no, it is not the most opulent luxury hotel in town. But it is exactly what it tries to be, and it does that very, very well.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to the hype”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After hearing so much about Opus, finally took the time to try it myself. Surprised to find it's one of the few hotels that actually live up to the hype. Room design was not only chic but well thought out (not a combination you find often.) Everything was where I wanted it to be and expected to find it. Service was consistently superb, friendly and discreet, but not snotty which is my usual rap on "boutique" hotels. Location was fabulous, I now know why it's considered the hippest part of town, great restaurants and shopping. This trip was for leisure but Opus will now be my first choice for business as well. Definitely worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “Wow - a little piece of Fame and Stardome!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Opus Hotel this past weekend was fabulous!!! The room was very "hip" and we felt like movie stars during our stay there!!!! The service was efficient, friendly and very professional. The decor throught the whole hotel was very trendy and fashionable!!! The staff was most courteous in every department. They were happy to do anything we requested with smiles on their faces. I'd recommend if you want to stay in "cool" hotel right in the middle of the the Action - this hotel is for you!!! Who knows - you might even get "famous" staying there!!!

Reviews.Title: “terrific general manager”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Opus Hotel in Vancouver after hearing that it was the best boutique hotel in the city. To be fair, the location is enviable and the hotel lobby and bar is terrific--modern, sexy, boutique-style reminiscent of a W hotel. Also, the hotel supplies guests with L'Occitane soaps and shampoos. The nightly turn down service includes water and chocolates. In the morning, there is complimentary tea and coffee in the lobby. The Opus certainly tries hard. Apparently, there is also a hotel car available to take guests to dinner although we didn't use this service. On the downside, the standard rooms are small, the hallway lighting teeters on the brink of resembling a morgue and we had a problem with an uncomfortable, concave bed. Also, the front desk attendant gave us wrong directions to a local restaurant which made us an hour late for our reservation. However, when presented with these issues, the general manager, Daniel Craig, was immediate, polite, and professional in his response. He promised to remedy the situation in the future, and sent a letter expressing that he appreciated our feedback and would like for us to come to the OPUS hotel again in the future. While our experience was not top-notch, we appreciate the general manager's swift and professional response to our problems. We believe the Opus will probably improve under this Manager's direction.

Reviews.Title: “Not terribly impressed for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My new wife and I chose the Opus as our Honeymoon night hotel. Since we also live in downtown Vancouver and were married nearby, we figured the Opus would give us a few nights of relaxation before heading off on our real vacation in California. Unfortunately, the second night we were staying also happened to be New Years Eve.
