Rather than feel like special honeymooning guests, the hotel had far more to worry about with the large crowds of Elixir and with people stumbling up to their rooms afterwards. I suspect we might have a different opinion of the Opus if we had gotten an upgrade, but we were put in the most basic room; it was tiny, even by our standards, and lacked the voyeuristic bathroom or other cool touches noted in previous reviews. We live in a downtown Vancouver condo, under 700 square feet, so we are certainly used to tight quarters-- but the Opus room with a king sized bed still managed to seem small. My wife was also quite disappointed with the lack of a bathtub. Everything was marked up in price even beyond what you might expect at a hotel of this nature; room service, phone calls, the minibar-- were all more expensive when compared to the other 4-star hotels we stayed at on our trip... which included the luxurious Ritz-Carlton Dana Point. A few good points: - Friendly staff and a free half bottle of wine as a congratulations - Nice original decor. It seems in good shape though the lighting is low everywhere. Overall, there are much nicer rooms in Vancouver for the price and we would not recommend the Opus.

Reviews.Title: “The Opus Hotel...a fabulous find!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Opus Hotel for a Christmas party that was also being held at the Opus. Both were fantastic! The Opus staff were friendly and helpful...the service was incredible. And the Christmas party was amazing...it was just a small cocktail party...but the food was incredible. What I loved most about the Opus was how unique the hotel is...the room that we had was small...but unlike any other hotel room that we have ever been in (and we have been in a few...). The walls were painted a lime green...but the furniture was dark and cozy which somehow worked with the wall colour. Than there is the bathroom...not off to the side as you enter the room (as it would be with any other hotel room)...but instead it faced outside...with full length windows...and yes you could see in as well as out but there were double blinds for full privacy. So if you are looking for a unique and trendy hotel in downtown Vancouver...or perhaps are holding a function and are looking for something different...than look no further than the Opus Hotel...it is not like any other...

Reviews.Title: “Great place...”
Reviews.Author: drutuk
Reviews.Content: Stayed ot the opus for 2 nights on the last week of november 2005. A great hotel, its got the best of a large hotel and the best of a boutique hotel... very friendly and poilte staff, lovley rooms, very modernist/retro styling, lovley striking colours & leopard skin print chairs (yes - it looks great!) The bed gets 5*'s - one of the comfiest i've slept in for ages, lovley bathroom, not all have baths, so if you want a bath as opposed to a shower you need to request one... l'occitaine bath & shower gel & shampoo...!!! Location is perfect, its a trendy area full of bars, cafes, rezzos & nightclubs. the brewhouse nearby is great microbrewery with very good food. I travel a lot and hence stop in a lot of hotels, this one ranks amongst my favourites, its how a hotel of this (trendy/boutiqe) hotel should be - trendy, friendly and UNpretentious. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, but small uncomfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: clambake33
Reviews.Content: We really wanted to like this hotel. It is located in the most fashionable part of Vancouver which central to many great restaurants. Our complaint was with the room. It was very small, not pleasant or comfortable and painted a terrible shade of bright green. I suppose reasonable people can differ about the decor, but the the real problem was the bathroom. It had a very flimsy, opaque sliding door which afforded no privacy if you are sharing the room. Also, the bathroom had a giant window that faced the street (the only window in the room) meaning that you had to pull the shades down everytime you entered it. This is a very expensive hotel, for the money I expect much more. The service was good and it is trendy, but in our opinion not worth the cost. There are plenty of other wonderful hotels in Vancouver to choice from.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Opus”
Reviews.Author: RBruse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus from Sept. 4th thru the 7th. We had an Exec. Suite on the 6th floor. Although the first night was quite noisey due to late night partyers at a bar across the street the rest of the stay was much more quiet. The room was nice but I looked into a regular room and it was very small. The staff was great and the BMW that would take you places came in real handy. We used it often as the staff would recomend places to eat and take us there and pick us up when we were done. If you like a smaller hotel and the personal service that goes with it you will like the Opus.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations but no room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a weekend in Vancouver to celebrate my husband's birthday. I made reservations at the Opus and dinner reservations in nearby Yaletown to try a new hotel and area of Vancouver. We travel from Seattle to Vancouver 3 to 4 times a year because of our love for North Coast Indian Art (do not miss the Spirit Wrestler in Gastown). I made reservations at the Opus on line about 2 months in advance and had decided to get a Deluxe King room with Spa Bathroom($389 plus taxes) to add to the celebration feel for the birthday weekend. We arrived on Saturday to be told that they did not have our room for us but could put us in a lesser room with a queen bed. We declined, we have not slept in a queen bed for 20 years and I did not feel this was the weekend to begin. They then offered to move us to another hotel for Saturday and then we could return to the Opus on Sunday. We also declined, not wanting to have to unpack and then pack again. We ended up at the Four Seasons in a suite with a king bed, 2 bathrooms and a large living room for less than our original room at the Opus. I can't tell you how embarrassing it was to sit in the lobby while the staff tried to decide what to do with us. I also must mention that we received a confirmation from the Opus on Friday the day before we were to arrive. We will never return to the Opus. There are many fine hotels in Vancouver and why would anyone want to stay where reservations were so poorly handled. This may be a "hip" hotel but I would prefer good service and well managed hotels that know how to handle reservations. Our dinner reservations obviously did not work out as planned as Yaletown is a drive from the downtown area. The birthday celebration that I planned had a lot of changes.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night twice”
Reviews.Author: Burbankre
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus for one night before and one night after an Alaska cruise. The staff is very pleasant and Yaletown, where the Opus is located, is a great area. It was a warehouse district and has now been converted to lofts, and has a very "hip" vibe. The first night, our $200+ room was very small. The bathroom only had a shower. Having said that, it was very comfortable. On our return a week later, we were upgraded for the same amount to a larger room. It was obviously more comfortable, and had a full bathroom. The decor is very modern and colorful. The adjoining restaurant has a great circular bar. We had breakfast there twice, and it was very good each time. The strong points of this hotel are its helpful, friendly staff and the excellent location. We were walking distance from several Vancouver attractions and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wheelieWoo
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our honeymoon in Canada. Started in the Opus in Vancouver and were delighted with the service and the room. The staff were very helpful and attentive. The hotel location is excellent, within walking distance of most attractions. The room was well appointed, with a huge bed and a stunning bathroom. All was going well until we decided to have a drink in the Opus Bar, where we found the barman to be the opposite of the above - unhelpful and unattentive. I think he felt he was too cool to serve us a drink! Other than that, no real gripes except that the cost of using the internet was outrageous! Food good, etc but you'd expect that as the hotel is not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “best place in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: fifibell
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay in, the location is perfect if you want to go the lively bars and restaurants of Yaletown and as far as I know is the only boutique style hotel in Vancouver. I had high expectations having read the conde nast review that it was "one of the top ten places in the world". It was very good but I think that is a slight exaggeration unless of course you are in the very best room. We stayed 3 nights in a superior room, it was not particularly big (one king bed and just adequate room around it) but was stylish and had the trademark Opus bathroom looking out onto the street. The decor was good but apart from the interesting colours and unusual bathroom it was not actually any more luxurious than many other standard hotel rooms (no Bose sound system or plasma TV or spa bath: they are obviously reserved for only the best rooms). Read another review about them being stingey with the toiletries but we had plentiful supplies of Occitane products every day. The room service every day was very good, it was always very obvious that they had cleaned and tidied the room extremely thoroughly and there were all the nice touches that you would expect (e.g. overnight shoe shine service, chocolates on the pillow and complimentary bottled water left by the bed each night). The staff were very helpful with recommendations and ordering cabs. Only minor complaint is that we arrived to drop off bags for 5 minutes before returning our hire car. The valet insisted on taking the car for that short time and then lo and behold 3 nights parking at $25 per night appeared on our bill. They happily took it off but that is steep for parking when the hotel is already pricey. The bar area was packed when we returned late Saturday night and I suspect some rooms at the front would have been noisy as the music was incredibly loud (we could faintly here it on 6th floor). Overall though, it is a fantastic hotel with a great atmosphere in the best location. Next time I would probably pay the extra for a better room.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a keeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Oh yeah! Great location in Yaletown close to a bunch of restaurants, a fifteen minute stroll to the financial district, and just around the corner from the harbor and marinas. If the Opus is good enough for Sir Richard Branson (Virgin Airways / Records etc etc) who was staying, it's good enough for me! Nice room with a bathroom with a glass wall between the shower and the bedroom - with louvered shade - viewing by your room mate (if you have one) while you are showering optional! Good service in the restaurant and a nice bar. Definitely a hotel I will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Opus Hotel in june for a business trip for two nights. I simply loved the room I was in: colourscheme was great, excellent bed, good Bose Wave soundsystem and a truly exciting bathroom with lovely l'Occitane products! The service was very good: staff was always helpful and hospitable. The restaurant did not really match the architecture, style and decor of the hotel but this was surely intended to be totally different. The neighbourhood (Yaletown) is trendy and has nice restaurants closeby. All in all a good place to stay and to tell your friends about!

Reviews.Title: “Uber-Chic”
Reviews.Author: adomatic
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to stay at the Opus for 10 days on business. It's a refreshing change from a typical business hotel. Decor and the whole atmosphere is very cool. I felt like i had to be dress up to be there! I've uploaded some photos of the room i stayed in as well as the view. Yes, the large window is actually in the bathroom. There are glass doors that separate the bathroom from the bedroom and blinds to lower when you need the privacy. People can look into the windows if the blinds are up. The hotel was very accomodating. At one point I borrowed a bike from a colleague and was allowed to park in the garage overnight. There are CDs you can borrow to listen to in your room. That's a nice touch (though i wish the library was larger). But I don't think in 10 days they bothered to learn my name, though the concierge and bellmen were very friendly and the limo service was for the most part available when we needed it. Drinks in the lobby were always lovely. I had breakfast in the hotel once and it was good. The location is wonderful. There are tons of great restaurants and shops within walking distance. I look forward to staying there again (on the company's dime!)

Reviews.Title: “Beauty is in the details....(but not at the Opus)”
Reviews.Author: ErwinFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in a superior room during our wedding trip. When we arrived, we were advised there is no self park available, so the CAD 25 valet parking is obligatory. We arrived at 2.30 PM and were advised that international check-in time is 3 PM, so had to go for a walk. Our room was small, but clean and nice. The safe was not working properly during our entire stay. On the first morning, I left my pj's in bed; quite a challenge to recover them by the day we left; without appologies or so. (and they even lost my handkerchiefs...). They offer nice l'Occitane products in your bathroom, but they're so sparing with them; I didn't get a refill during my 3 days, although I finished them up. Internet access is really expensive for this type of hotel. The Opus bar is self-advertised as the place to be seen, but ehhhh, I'm afraid that goes back to times long gone (although the hotel only opened in 2002); all we saw were very typical tourists like us and some American students, and part of the staff was very unattentive. At check-out, there were 3 nights of accommodation on my bill, although fully pre-paid. On the positive: the only hotel during our honeymoon that did something special: they put a large bottle of VOSS water in our room, some top chocolates and a greeting card. The hotel's location is SUPER, and their dining suggestions are TOP (Tojo's for Japanese, Blue Water Cafe for Seafood) and they have a complimentary limousine service for their guests, meaning a nice Mercedes S-Class brings you around town free of chrage. My conclusion: the Opus doesn't come up to the mark and should work on the details. My advice: if you can book a promotion, don't hesitate!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in the West!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My first stay in this hotel was Valentines Day 2003 with my husband (who was then my "significant other"!) I felt like I was at club med in my own city! It was obvious the layout of the room was well thought out for the romantic, the travelling business person or the person travelling for pleasure. The soaker tub and/or rain shower head that you can indulge yourself in l'occitane products. You can get some wonderful rest on their comfy beds with fine linens, go downstairs for a delicious meal at the Elixir (which turns into one of Vancouver hot spots at night!) or just step out the door and you are in beautiful Yaletown. My husband and I stayed at the OPUS on our wedding night in 2003 (and the next night) and we had one of the garden terrace rooms. I private dinner for us was set up in the zen garden which was amazing. We have been back for our anniversary in 2004 and we are due to return July 18, 2005 for our 2nd anniversay. Each time we have stayed the service is professional, courteous and friendly. There is rarely a need or want that they will not make an effort to satifsy above your expectations. Thank you to all the staff at OPUS it is you that keep us coming back and recommending you to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: cubbyboy1991
Reviews.Content: I had read very good reviews of the Opus, and the hotel definitely lived up to expectations. The service was as good as any Four Seasons I've ever stayed in, even though the people at the front desk are responsible for not just check-in, but concierge duties as well, not to mention taking room service orders. They are incredibly cheerful and very helpful, very adept at making great suggestions for day trips or restaurants based on what we were looking for. We had an excellent room--splurged on a Deluxe Courtyard, with a push-button fireplace, which came in handy to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. They even had a bottle of wine and chocolates in the room when we arrived. It's right in Yaletown, blocks away from most of the hippest restaurants in town and great trendy shopping, and blocks from the water/aquabus station. It's an example of what an excellent small hotel can be.

Reviews.Title: “Good time at the Opus”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to the Opus for a bachelor party weekend. The service at the Opus is fantastic and all the staff were great. We had an executive suite which was plenty big on the corner of the hotel (the regular rooms were of okay size). The bed was very comfy and all the amenities in the room were what you would expect of a high end hotel. The only negative for some people would be that the room could get a little noisy from the street traffic (we were on the 3rd floor). The bar downstairs was great - not as crowded as I would have thought, but a good time. All the other bars in Yaletown were only 4 blocks away and easily walkable. The hotel has an S430 that will take you whereever you want - you should definitely request it if its available and just tip the driver. If you are up there for the strip clubs, screw Brandi's and go to No. 5 Orange instead - very very good times. I would highly recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent an unforgettable evening at the Opus hotel in my very own hometown, beautiful Vancouver, British Columbia. The Opus is a beautiful, boutiuque located in the heart of Yaletown - the newest and trendiest neighbourhood in Vancouver. It's surrounded by the city's busiest and best restaurants, cafes, and hip retail stores - all within walking distance. The hotel itself manages to strike a balance perfectly betwen minimalist and modern with all the oppulent luxuries you'd expect from a boutique hotel. Our room (a gorgeous suite on the top floor) had a bathroom you could live in - with heated marble tiles, a granite and wood vanity, a rainfall showerhead, and luxurious soaker tub! The amenities were incredible and expansive - from L'Occitane soaps and creams, to Oxia Oxygen. However, it was the little touches that impressed us both - when we came back from dinner the lights in our room were dimmed, the bed was turned down with Beligian chocolates placed on the pillows, and soft music playing. I can't recall the last time I had such an incredible evening! I would can't say enough about the wonderful experience at the Opus and would highly recommend it to tourists and locals alike looking for an escape in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Chic & stylish”
Reviews.Author: Cedre
Reviews.Content: This is the hippest hotel I have ever stayed at. The rooms are chic and stylish, so are the people that you meet at this hotel. The bathroom in my room was gorgeous and when you stepped into the shower, it had a window to the room that made it very sexy. Big windows brought in lots of sunlight in the room, and even to the bathroom that was at the other end of the room. The bed was very comfortable, and I had one of my best sleeps there. The rooms are spotless! We went out during the evening and when we returned our beds were turned and they had chocolates on our pillows...so sweet! The lounge downstairs is a very hip hang out and they have amazing martinis. I try to stay at Opus every chance I get when I go to Vancouver and have never been disapointed with my room or the service I have received. Oh, and they have free shoe shining while you sleep and umbrellas to loan for when the weather turns on you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in Vancouver for a business trip and had took the opportunity to stay at the Opus. There has been a lot of recent positive publicity from the Air Canada En Route magazines and local news media. I decided to see what this place was all about. It is about a $25.00 taxi ride from the Vancouver Airport. Upon arrival, we were greeted by a friendly doorman, who helped with our bags. The check-in process was quick and friendly. My room was a bright colourful blue. Very modern decor. Not like the old Victorian style that you see in other high class hotels. Keep in mind that the rooms are small, REAL SMALL. I'm sure they have bigger rooms, but you'll have to fork out the cash. It does not seem like a hotel you would bring children to(I didn't see any either). The bed was heavenly with soft clean linens and duvet. The bathroom was nice with a waterfall type showerhead. Not one of the water conserving ones you see in most hotels. Wonderful bath products. The in room safe wasn't working but one of the staff members quickly attended and remedied the problem. There is lots of stuff to see and do in the nearby area. Not too far from the downtown area. Had one of the best sleeps in months. Requested a wake up call in the morning. This was the first time I had a real person call and wish me good morning instead of an automated machine. For business travellers, this is the place to go. I will definitely keep this place on my favorites list.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: pro01
Reviews.Content: The hotel might be fancy but a lot of smaller things are not as they ought to be for a hotel in this category. ****** bedlinens - old, worn thin and covers are some synthetic material that you cannot sleep in. Bathroom fan can't be turned of. Internet acces is 14 dollars a day. Too much. Room is fairly small - only room for one suitcase folded out. No where handy to put the coffeemaker in the cabinet - you have to take it out, crawl under the desk to plug it in...hm. Would not book again.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad”
Reviews.Author: don666
Reviews.Content: We visited Opus on US Thanksgiving weekend. When Opus was good, it was very very good, and when it was bad, it was not that bad because they recovered well. Good: When I made reservations, they waived the $25 a day parking fee. Bad: I had to ask them to waive it. Good: Excellent directions. easy to find, Great location. Bad: The only visible place to park for reservations is the valet parking spot. We parked in the alley, and the registration clerk immediately asked us to move to the valet parking spot because tow trucks were fast and silent for alley parking. Good: They upgraded us to a suite without asking---and the suite was great. I could have lived in the bathroom, complete with soaking tub, separate shower, and heated floor. Some confusion as to whgether the room was made up---at 4 pm! More on that later. Bad: The bathrobe was small and a bit threadbare. The tub faucets had been installed in reverse so hot water was labeled cold and vice versa. A nice desk, and nice chairs---but dim blubs everywhere. One of the bed lights wasn't plugged in (nor was the clock radio) and when i went to plug them in, I couldn't find the plug,. which was behind a heavy bed. Toll-free calls cost $1.25 plus tax. Everything not nailed down seemed to have aprice tag. Good: Someone came up within two minutes to plug in the fixtures. Globe & Mail paper delivered to your door---even th ebig Saturday edition. Bad: The clock radio went off at 5 a.m. because they hadn't reset it, and the thing was so new-fangled designed that it was near impossible to figure out which button to press to shut it off. Bad: First night turn-down: No pillow cases on the pillows under the pillow covers. The maid failed to latch the door on leaving. Inconvenient to get to your car in the locked, valeted garage--only parking available. Loud street noise on Friday and Saturday nights. Good: The second night was completely different: Latched door after the turndown. Chocolate on the pillows. Water bottles. Bathtub faucet fixed. Pillow cases on the pillows. All in all, if I get another Internet deal, I'd go back, if only for the great bathroom. But it's not worth it without a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: SantaMonicaTraveler108
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus Hotel 11/12 - 11/14. The hotel is modern, comfortable, has a personal feel, like staying at a fine home, very comfortable beds and terrific bathrooms. This is a special place. The location in Yaletown is ideal for exploring the city and finding anything you may want. The staff was friendly, accommodating and immediately said yes to any of our requests - they greeted us at the door with a sincere welcome and that attitude was expressed by every staff member during our stay, from the doorman to the front desk to the General Manager. We called Guest Services for ice - and the ice was delivered in less than one minute - and I'm NOT exaggerating. It's rare to find a hotel that provides such a seemless, consistantly positive and relaxing experience - We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: NP17
Reviews.Content: After reading the positive reviews about the Opus, we decided to spend 4 nights there. When we arrived, our room wasn't ready but the staff at the front desk offered us 2 free cocktails at the bar. When we arrived at the room, it did seem a little on the small side, although we had booked a Standard room, however the decor and attention to detail was brilliant - particularly when a staff member would ask if we wanted complimentary bottled water and chocolates, she would also present us with a card detailing the following day's weather! We really enjoyed our stay....the staff were helpful and attentive. The location is great and on my return to fantastic Vancouver, I will definitley stay at the Opus!

Reviews.Title: “Super romantic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I actually live in Vancouver but I was looking to earn some brownie points with my girlfriend. I decided to book a room at the Opus since it is know here as a hip hotel. I booked one of the suites - and....well, it was sweet! The room was a good size, bathroom was great with a big shower and tub. We felt like rock stars staying there. Staff was friendly - which is always important. And the best part of all my girlfriend loved it. I think we will do it again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Opus was chic but...”
Reviews.Author: shansanfran
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Opus for the first 3 days of our honeymoonm on the recommendation from a friend. He said he was treated like gold and we were treating ourselves...after already spending $$$ on our wedding night at the W in San Fran (Fantastic). Our room was cool, we liked the comfy bed, fireplace and lounge chair. The room was so dark, we could never find anything without turning all the lights on and we lost the remote twice-housekeeping never put it in a place easy to find-we called down to the desk and no one ever came-we left for dinner after 40 min and never saw the remote for a day(baseball playoffs...). We did receive a nice welcome gift but that was about it for the out-of-the -ordinary service we thought we would get. The front desk was confusing-we never knew who to ask for restaurant recommendations-usually you ask the concierge but there was NEVER anyone at the desk so we would ask the door guys(all very nice and their recommendations were good) but asking them was akward because they acted like they had other things to do(earpieces were probably telling them something) and there were things going on in the bar so we never felt like we got the best advice and like I said, at other hotels it is very obvious who you should ask directions and recommendations. They did offer the car and we used it twice-that was very cool. We were not treated badly but for a chic hotel at this price and with the reviews we read, we expected a little more from the front desk area. We loved Vancouver-it's clean and the waterfront is beautiful. We rented bikes and rode around Stanley Park-stopping at the aquarium-very good even though we have been to Monterey Aquarium a few times. We had the best hot chocolate of our lives at the cafe in Stanley park by the Totem Poles. Granville Island is awesome-San Francisco farmer's market is nice but this blows it away. Vancouver Art Gallery is worth the time and Yaletown is fun and very hip-we really enjoyed the restaurants. We will go back to Vancouver but stay in a cheaper hotel and spend our money on meals and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry, all hype, no substance at the Opus”
Reviews.Author: GaryinSydney
Reviews.Content: Following the rave reviews on this site, plus the impressive hotel website i had excitedly booked 4 nights at the Opus from 30 Sept. On arrival, i simply couldn't believe the small size of the rooms (i was dumbfounded, thinking i'd been shown a standard rather than a superior room). I honestly don't geddit? The bathrooms were also tiny and there was no real luxury or nice feel to the rooms at all. As it looked nothing like the website pics, i asked to see other rooms and the staff did show me other room options, but again i was disappointed. It simply doesn't live up to its price and reputation IMO. I checked out after one night.
